commit_message:
Fix dhcp-provisioning validation

The `undercloud.conf` file has now 2 sections (DEFAULT and ctlplane-subnet).
A small numbers of parameters have been deprecated and moved to the
ctlplane-subnet section. Morever, the `undercloud_conf` custom plugin has some
issues to generate facts coming from the 'undercloud.conf' file due to the new
section.

This patch proposes to use the 'ini' custom plugin to get parameter's
values from the undercloud.conf file instead of using the 'undercloud_conf'
custom plugin.

Change-Id: Ieb38d974fbe2291a2cd3bb1a9d4df9cd971bd098
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit e69d6045a4d3ea130f193be365d00356be3e2d2e)

commit_message:
Run scenario009 on tripleo-deploy-openshift changes

The tripleo-deploy-openshift script is essential for openshift
deployments via tripleo. This should help prevent breaking scenario009
by mistake while modifying `tripleo-deploy-openshift`.

Change-Id: Ic0f9b746f49648450fe82b0773d8dd1ee009b152
(cherry picked from commit deb64247dacd8a653d28a175d1cc97697f31661e)

[{'account_id': 29790, 'date': '2019-01-15 10:48:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-01-15 10:48:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

the device path corresponding to the volume

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-16 14:49:22.000000000', 'message': "Enable 'all' IPv6 forwarding knob correctly

When the external gateway is plugged and we enable IPv6
forwarding on it, make sure the 'all' sysctl knob is also
enabled, else IPv6 packets will not be forwarded.  This
seems to only affect HA routers that default to disabling
this 'all' knob on creation.

Also, when we are removing all the IPv6 addresses from a
HA router internal interface, set 'accept_ra' to zero so
it doesn't accidentally auto-configure an address.  Set
it back to one when adding them back.

Re-homed newly added _wait_until_ipv6_forwarding_has_state()
accordingly.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py

Closes-bug: #1787919

Change-Id: Ia1f311ee31d1479089685367a97bf13cf170b342
(cherry picked from commit b847cd02c56dc8fe654f4731306dc2b5493a62eb)
(cherry picked from commit dfedafe5f6b46c8f6cdc407736e7c865a1984401)
"}]
commit_message:
Enable 'all' IPv6 forwarding knob correctly

When the external gateway is plugged and we enable IPv6
forwarding on it, make sure the 'all' sysctl knob is also
enabled, else IPv6 packets will not be forwarded.  This
seems to only affect HA routers that default to disabling
this 'all' knob on creation.

Also, when we are removing all the IPv6 addresses from a
HA router internal interface, set 'accept_ra' to zero so
it doesn't accidentally auto-configure an address.  Set
it back to one when adding them back.

Re-homed newly added _wait_until_ipv6_forwarding_has_state()
accordingly.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py

Closes-bug: #1787919

Change-Id: Ia1f311ee31d1479089685367a97bf13cf170b342
(cherry picked from commit b847cd02c56dc8fe654f4731306dc2b5493a62eb)
(cherry picked from commit dfedafe5f6b46c8f6cdc407736e7c865a1984401)

subject: [DVR] Allow multiple subnets per external network
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16688, 'name': 'Rodolfo Alonso', 'email': 'ralonsoh@redhat.com', 'username': 'rodolfo-alonso-hernandez'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26622, 'name': 'Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'neutron_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'neutron_hyperv_ci'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 12860, 'date': '2019-01-18 08:25:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-01-18 09:06:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/631724/1 : FAILURE in 39m 43s'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-01-18 16:17:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2019-01-18 23:51:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-18 08:25:50.000000000', 'message': "[DVR] Allow multiple subnets per external network

An external network can have more than one subnet. Currently only the
first subnet is added to the FIP namespace routing table. Packets for
FIPs with addresses in other subnets can't pass through the external
port because there is no route for those FIP CIDRs.

This change adds routes for those CIDRs via the external port IP and
interface.

These routes doesn't collide with the existing ones, added to provide
a back path for the packets with a destination IP matching a FIP.

E.g.:
$ ip netns exec fip-e1ec0f98-b593-4514-ae08-f1c5cf1c2788 ip route
  (1) 169.254.106.114/31 dev fpr-3937f879-d  proto kernel  scope link \
      src 169.254.106.115
  (2) 192.168.20.250 via 169.254.106.114 dev fpr-3937f879-d
  (3) 192.168.30.0/24 dev fg-bee060f1-dd  proto kernel  scope link  \
      src 192.168.30.129
  (4) 192.168.20.0/24 via 192.168.30.129 dev fg-bee060f1-dd  scope link

Rule (2) is added when a FIP is assigned. This rule permits ingress
packets going into the router namespace. This FIP belongs to the second
subnet of the external network (note the external port CIDR is not the
same). Rule (4), added by this patch, allows egress packets to exit
the FIP namespace through the external port. Rule (2), because of the
prefix length (32), has more priority than rule (4).

Change-Id: I4d476b47e89fa5709dca2f66ffae72a27d88340a
Closes-Bug: #1805456
"}]
commit_message:
[DVR] Allow multiple subnets per external network

An external network can have more than one subnet. Currently only the
first subnet is added to the FIP namespace routing table. Packets for
FIPs with addresses in other subnets can't pass through the external
port because there is no route for those FIP CIDRs.

This change adds routes for those CIDRs via the external port IP and
interface.

These routes doesn't collide with the existing ones, added to provide
a back path for the packets with a destination IP matching a FIP.

E.g.:
$ ip netns exec fip-e1ec0f98-b593-4514-ae08-f1c5cf1c2788 ip route
  (1) 169.254.106.114/31 dev fpr-3937f879-d  proto kernel  scope link \
      src 169.254.106.115
  (2) 192.168.20.250 via 169.254.106.114 dev fpr-3937f879-d
  (3) 192.168.30.0/24 dev fg-bee060f1-dd  proto kernel  scope link  \
      src 192.168.30.129
  (4) 192.168.20.0/24 via 192.168.30.129 dev fg-bee060f1-dd  scope link

Rule (2) is added when a FIP is assigned. This rule permits ingress
packets going into the router namespace. This FIP belongs to the second
subnet of the external network (note the external port CIDR is not the
same). Rule (4), added by this patch, allows egress packets to exit
the FIP namespace through the external port. Rule (2), because of the
prefix length (32), has more priority than rule (4).

Change-Id: I4d476b47e89fa5709dca2f66ffae72a27d88340a
Closes-Bug: #1805456

commit_message:
Create barbican's creator role by default

Barbican has a very specific set of keystone roles that it uses in order
to properly enforce RBAC. One of them (and the most important) is the
creator role. Which you'll assign to your users in order to allow them
to create and retrieve secrets (the other role that can do this is
admin... but we don't want to rely on this).

For usability, lets create this role automatically as part of the
TripleO installation.

Closes-Bug: #1812209
Change-Id: I9d5f912684a0987a6bdf244321215bd5595a0fa0
(cherry picked from commit dfd408a73d14ca2e8b8785d685b7d88a0739c71d)

commit_message:
Create barbican's creator role by default

Barbican has a very specific set of keystone roles that it uses in order
to properly enforce RBAC. One of them (and the most important) is the
creator role. Which you'll assign to your users in order to allow them
to create and retrieve secrets (the other role that can do this is
admin... but we don't want to rely on this).

For usability, lets create this role automatically as part of the
TripleO installation.

Closes-Bug: #1812209
Change-Id: I9d5f912684a0987a6bdf244321215bd5595a0fa0
(cherry picked from commit dfd408a73d14ca2e8b8785d685b7d88a0739c71d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-13 10:15:20.000000000', 'message': 'Set root_provider_id in the database

When nested resource provider feature was added in Rocky,
root_provider_id column, which should be non-None value, is created in
the resource provider DB.

However, online data migration is only done implicitly via listing or
showing resource providers. With this patch, executing the cli command

commit_message:
Set root_provider_id in the database

When nested resource provider feature was added in Rocky,
root_provider_id column, which should be non-None value, is created in
the resource provider DB.

However, online data migration is only done implicitly via listing or
showing resource providers. With this patch, executing the cli command

    `placement-manage db online_data_migrations`

makes sure all the resource providers are ready for nested provider
feature, that is, all the root_provider_ids in the DB have non-None
value.

Change-Id: I42a1afa69f379b095417f5eb106fe52ebff15017
Related-Bug:#1803925

(1 comment)

I have responded to a few questions on the etherpad on this topic from the summit:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/BER-ironic-smartnics

I'm not sure the discussions we had at the summit are reflected in this spec yet. Regarding the VNIC type we discussed that at the summit so I've given the idea as a comment inline."}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-11-29 21:55:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

 > fashion, but I don't know about the scalability implications.
 > 
 > I have some bikeshedding suggestions (no strong feelings about the
 > naming of things, I invariably get them wrong).

@Jan agentless use-case it out of scope for this spec as it about ovs mechanism driver which works with agents, but in the future we also would like to address the agentless use-case such as opendaylight for example.'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-11-29 21:59:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Sam thank, I update the etherpad with some more questions if can review them. The spec it not reflecting the discussions  as there are still some gaps I am trying to understand"}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-11-30 15:31:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-12-12 12:56:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2018-12-12 12:57:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(16 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25733, 'date': '2018-12-12 13:52:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(26 comments)

Again, please don't take the spelling / grammar suggestions as blockers!

My chief questions on content are at:

L71: I'm still a bit confused as to why only one port is specified in the local_link_information. I'd have thought both would make sense, or neither.

L85: While this would work.... I think I'm either missing something or a port would be hard associated with a specific NIC - I don't consider it a blocker, I just think the implication is that this is going to make scheduling a manual thing.

L130: I'm not quite sure who's going to call the os-vif plugin here."}, {'account_id': 25733, 'date': '2018-12-12 17:39:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

I spoke to Moshe over IRC (ref: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-neutron/%23openstack-neutron.2018-12-12.log.html#t2018-12-12T17:00:19 ) and he clarified most of my questions. At this point, this would fit Netronome's use case too, hence the +1."}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-12-12 23:11:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Looks good to me but I prefer that someone else will approve this'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-01-16 19:39:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

If Ironic is setting SSL certificates for the OVSDB interface, will Neutron need to have knowledge of these certs?  If so, is there a need for a Barbican integration here?'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2019-01-16 19:48:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> If Ironic is setting SSL certificates for the OVSDB interface, will
 > Neutron need to have knowledge of these certs?  If so, is there a
 > need for a Barbican integration here?

So SSL certificate are need only for the ovs neutron agent running remotely and should be address as part of this spec [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/595402/. This spec address the neutron ovs agent running on the smart-nic so we don't need the SSL certificate."}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-01-16 20:01:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

> So SSL certificate are need only for the ovs neutron agent running
 > remotely and should be address as part of this spec [1]
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/595402/. This spec address the
 > neutron ovs agent running on the smart-nic so we don't need the SSL
 > certificate.

commit_message:
Add Support for Smart NIC in OVS ML2 mech driver

This spec is the Neutron side changes to support
smart NICs with Neutron OVS ML2 mechanism driver
and Neutron OVS Agent.

Related-Bug: #1785608

Change-Id: I658754f7f8c74087b0aabfdef222a2c0b5698541

commit_message:
[CEPH] Fix a race condition with udev on OSD start

Under some conditions udev may not trigger correctly and create
the proper uuid symlinks required by Ceph. In order to work around
this we manually create the symlinks.

Change-Id: Icadce2c005864906bcfdae4d28117628c724cc1c

commit_message:
Ensure some directories are created with the correct SELinux label

As Podman doesn't create host location for bind-mount, we have to ensure
directories actually exists.
SELinux labels are also important, since Podman has selinux enabled by default,
and there is currently no way to disable it like in Docker.

Conflicts:
	common/deploy-steps-tasks.yaml

Related-Bug: #1811713
Change-Id: Ic1bede203e8199a296944273cb334027dab940fe
(cherry picked from commit 7719263c2748be7ce7168f609b759b1fcad79f0e)

commit_message:
[Horizon] Disable server-status page

This PS disables the server status page of Apache.
On the page provided information which can aid the
malicious user in finding vulnerabilities in the system.

Change-Id: I11104b10359808dc78a214ebb531d710ec353f60

subject: Add online-data-migration DB commands
messages:
[{'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-12-13 10:15:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-13 12:42:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

You'll need to update tests.unit.cmd.test_manage, that's what the -1 is for. The rest is some thoughts.

I recognize that it is inevitable that we will sometimes need to do migrations of data to fix things up in more than just a schema migration kind of way and that we will need some kind of tooling to make that happen.

But each time we add a command like sync, stamp or online-data-migration we increase the number of required moving parts in a system which is essentially really really simple: a web application in front of a database. Increasing the moving parts increases the load on and expectations we make of users, deployers and packagers and thus is something we should consider deeply and not simply do because "that's how we've always done it."

We should think about if there are ways we can accomplish the same things without add new stuff. For example, in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619050/ I've explored making it possible to do the db sync when the service starts up. With alembic and an already up to date service, this is one sql call and done. For a not up to date service, it performs the necessary and then lets the service start, which is what we want: we don't want it to run if the db isn't right.

Doing a similar thing for "online" migrations would be contrary to the goal of "online", so I'm not recommending that. What I'm asking is if there are alternatives to what we've come to consider the standard way of dealing with things like this.

One option is to make it so that code that is developed that eventually requires a migration (for example the changes that required the provider id fixup) always includes fixups during the individual requests: if it comes across a row that is wrong it fixes it there and then. We sort of had that for this particular change, but didn't get it right. Can we figure out how to make it right?

The end goal here is that we'd like to keep the external surface of placement as simple as possible (just start up the web app and go), sometimes as the cost of a little bit more complexity internally.

Can we do that here? I don't really know for certain, but I think we need to ask.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-12-21 01:43:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-12-21 04:04:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-21 10:00:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

looks good, suggestion within about using an existing fixture for capturing output.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-01-03 20:39:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Since we're exploring this we should probably use this to support  create_incomplete_consumers, see http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-placement/%23openstack-placement.2019-01-03.log.html#t2019-01-03T19:56:14"}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-01-16 16:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(18 comments)

I have couple of comments inline.

Cheers,
gibi'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-01-17 12:44:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(13 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-01-17 12:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-01-17 12:47:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-17 18:57:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(13 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-17 18:58:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

See my comments in PS3. I guess a lot of what I said is too late now since changes were made. This should at least have CLI docs and maybe also a release note to mention the new command that was added? Or are we just going to add that release note on each change that actually adds a data migration?'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-17 19:13:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-17 19:13:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I fixed some typos in the commit message, copied and tweaked the CLI docs from nova, and fixed the failing unit test. Still need to add the other missing unit tests from nova.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-17 22:58:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-01-18 07:48:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-01-18 07:53:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-01-18 14:17:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-01-18 17:14:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)

I think this goes in the right direction given the discussions we've had and the patches further along are working in grenade, so I think we should go for it, and tune as required later."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-18 20:11:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM, thanks for working on this.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-13 10:15:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add online-data-migration DB commands

Placement uses alembic to manage the DB version for schema changes.
However, changes with data manupulation should be separated from the
schema changes since the table can be locked and in the worst case
it breaks the service for backward incompatible changes.

We could handle them as a task that is done in a service down time.
However, to minimize the down time, it is better to have the concepts
of online data migration which has been a traditional way to handle
those data manupulation changes in nova.

This patch adds online data migration command to placement to enable
operators to manupulate DB data while the service is running:

    placement-manage db online-data-migration [--max-count]

where --max-count controls the maximum number of objects to migrate
in a given call. If not specified, migration will occur in batches
of 50 until fully complete.

Change-Id: I9cef6829513d9a54d110426baf6bcc312554e3e7

commit_message:
Add online-data-migration DB commands

Placement uses alembic to manage the DB version for schema changes.
However, changes with data manupulation should be separated from the
schema changes since the table can be locked and in the worst case
it breaks the service for backward incompatible changes.

We could handle them as a task that is done in a service down time.
However, to minimize the down time, it is better to have the concepts
of online data migration which has been a traditional way to handle
those data manipulation changes in nova.

This patch adds online data migration command to placement to enable
operators to manipulate DB data while the service is running:

    placement-manage db online_data_migrations [--max-count]

where --max-count controls the maximum number of objects to migrate
in a given call. If not specified, migration will occur in batches
of 50 until fully complete.

Change-Id: I9cef6829513d9a54d110426baf6bcc312554e3e7

commit_message:
Use base_package_type

This change updates the docker files to use base_package_type instead
of doing specific distro checks for the rhel/deb generic cases. The
base_distro is still available and is used when a specific distro needs
a customization but if the differences are purely rpm vs deb, then the
base_package_type can be used.

Change-Id: I8d720bb185df65a0178061ccf20b1ab2265da2c5

commit_message:
Add upgrade status check - instances with assigned tasks

This check detects Trove instances in state other than Active
(identified by assigned None tasks), as such instances have some
kind of activity running, which requires communication between
the instance and Trove control plane.

Change-Id: I64901fd27dc97de8ee5e3bc693ec966d4f1a3346
Signed-off-by: Dariusz Krol <d.krol@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Add HorizonSecureCookies to environments/ssl/enable-tls.yaml

It was missing and breaking folks trying to use it.

Change-Id: I06c3a8499ce72973f850df60961226a168ba49e4
Closes-Bug: #1812211
(cherry picked from commit eb52c794d9d3073d900958d0499e81be25979d52)

commit_message:
flatten cinder service configuration

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration.

With this patch the baremetal version of cinder services has been removed.

Change-Id: I88f047a8ee9c3eed80e4c48ed9cabdb3035d518b
Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening

Remove code that is redundantly tested.

This should not be tested here but in puppet-oslo

If we keep this and we do changes in puppet-oslo we

commit_message:
Remove redundantly tested code

Remove code that is redundantly tested.

This should not be tested here but in puppet-oslo
where this logic resides.

If we keep this and we do changes in puppet-oslo we
will break these unit tests, this is something we need
to sort out for all modules.

Change-Id: I92545e5dcd1404568dfee00fa9d2480a526a5c16

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-18 17:19:22.000000000', 'message': "Selenium: Disable Kibana tests temporarily

This temporarily disables the Kibana selenium tests as we've
noticed rare cases where the tests fail due to the paths not
being ready in time. Once we have a path forward for waiting to
ensure the path is ready, we should disable the job

Change-Id: I6c406ad8907cc87425562dee56eec6b8a0502142
"}, {'created': '2019-01-18 17:24:00.000000000', 'message': 'Selenium: Add "|| true" to kibana selenium execution

This temporarily adds a "|| true" suffix to the kibana
selenium script execution, as we've noticed rare cases where the
tests fail due to the paths not being ready in time. Once we have
a path forward for waiting to ensure the path is ready,
we should allow for periodic failures of the kibana selenium tests

Change-Id: I6c406ad8907cc87425562dee56eec6b8a0502142
'}]
commit_message:
Selenium: Add "|| true" to kibana selenium execution

This temporarily adds a "|| true" suffix to the kibana
selenium script execution, as we've noticed rare cases where the
tests fail due to the paths not being ready in time. Once we have
a path forward for waiting to ensure the path is ready,
we should allow for periodic failures of the kibana selenium tests

Change-Id: I6c406ad8907cc87425562dee56eec6b8a0502142

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-19 12:24:18.000000000', 'message': 'Add PENDING vm state

This feature adds support for the PENDING server state. Instead of
setting a server to the ERROR state when the Placement returns no
valid hosts for the requested server, the PENDING state is used if
the operator wishes so. This will allow the execution of subsequent
actions transparently to the end user.

Change-Id: Ie2989dee31a8d7242bf5b78019f016b3bc7e42a3
Implements: blueprint introduce-pending-vm-state

commit_message:
Add PENDING vm state

This feature adds support for the PENDING server state. Instead of
setting a server to the ERROR state when the Placement returns no
valid hosts for the requested server, the PENDING state is used if
the operator wishes so. This will allow the execution of subsequent
actions transparently to the end user.

Change-Id: Ie2989dee31a8d7242bf5b78019f016b3bc7e42a3
Implements: blueprint introduce-pending-vm-state

commit_message:
Create missing directories before mounting them

When deploying with podman, we need to create directories if they don't
exist before trying to mount them later when containers are starting.
Otherwise, podman fails with this kind of error:
error checking path \"/etc/iscsi\": stat /etc/iscsi: no such file or directory"

Related-Bug: #1811713
Change-Id: I7dbdc7f3646dda99c8014b4c8ca2edd48778b392
(cherry picked from commit 24f5a255c954a94d69768b139a113113d4e37c80)

Set proper setype for service directories

This will allow proper access from the containers without any
new SELinux policy

	docker/services/haproxy.yaml

commit_message:
docker: wire SELinuxMode with Ansible vars

When SELinuxMode is set to enforced in thedeployment, configure Docker
to enable SElinux.

It'll wire container_registry_selinux variable in ansible-role-container-registry
which enables --selinux-enabled if set to True.

Change-Id: Ic030ecbe8b6719ba45cb7c27c6cf44bab14fed88
(cherry picked from commit e3c1b7e7551c0274d0f28cece372d1320183cd60)

commit_message:
[prometheus] Enable ceph mgr exporter

This patch enables the ceph mgr prometheus exporter.

If enable_prometheus_ceph_mgr_exporter is set to true,
the ceph mgr prometheus plugin is enabled on the hosts that are part
of the ceph-mgr group, then the exporter is added into the prometheus-server
configuration file.

Change-Id: Ia2f879401e585e6043f69cc5e3ab1a1f72f7f033

Disable Critical Information Exposure through Directory Listing

This disables static page on Apache which would disable Directory
 Listings. This is done as a part of Security defect.

subject: Validate openstack_region value as a DNS label
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-18 17:05:51.000000000', 'message': "Validate openstack_region value as a DNS label

Because we're going to insert openstack_region into etcd paths that need
to be Kubernetes-compatible, and also construct a Calico/Kubernetes
namespace from it, openstack_region needs to conform to DNS label syntax
as validated at
https://github.com/kubernetes/apimachinery/blob/master/pkg/util/validation/validation.go#L110

Change-Id: I18e6bee8a1c58de51491fea1580be9efefd5a0bb
"}]
commit_message:
Validate openstack_region value as a DNS label

Because we're going to insert openstack_region into etcd paths that need
to be Kubernetes-compatible, and also construct a Calico/Kubernetes
namespace from it, openstack_region needs to conform to DNS label syntax
as validated at
https://github.com/kubernetes/apimachinery/blob/master/pkg/util/validation/validation.go#L110

Change-Id: I18e6bee8a1c58de51491fea1580be9efefd5a0bb

commit_message:
Ensure public volume type option is evaluated as a boolean

To ensure that all boolean types supported by ansible are evaluated,
and to ensure thhat it is evaluated as a boolean, we use the bool
filter.

Related-Bug: 1804438
Change-Id: I76ee77958d7e1bf94089b917ac064db4e97d1ad9

This _looks_ fine and all the tests are passing but I've no idea why this was done in the first place and don't know how to verify that. Sticking with +1 til I figure that out"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-08-27 13:22:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

i agree that there was no reason given why os was not monkey patached and it does appear to fuction well enough to pass the gate jobs but
this needs to be rebased.

the os module also provides acess to fork which we may be using for things like the real os threads we fork for comuniating with libvirt event stream so  this might prevent that from froking a real os thread.

personally i would like to see us disable as much monkey patachin in eventlet as possibale so that we can eventually stop using it entirely but that a seperate conversation.'}, {'account_id': 19849, 'date': '2018-08-28 01:32:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 19849, 'date': '2018-08-28 01:36:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> i agree that there was no reason given why os was not monkey
 > patached and it does appear to fuction well enough to pass the gate
 > jobs but
 > this needs to be rebased.
Done.
 > 
 > the os module also provides acess to fork which we may be using for
 > things like the real os threads we fork for comuniating with
 > libvirt event stream so  this might prevent that from froking a
 > real os thread.
I checked the eventlet.green.os module, `os.fork` is not monkey_patched.
 > 
 > personally i would like to see us disable as much monkey patachin
 > in eventlet as possibale so that we can eventually stop using it
 > entirely but that a seperate conversation.
I agree with you, monkey patch all modules in eventlet is not a good choice, we should know in detail why certain modules are patched but others are not.'}, {'account_id': 19849, 'date': '2018-08-28 01:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> i agree that there was no reason given why os was not monkey
 > patached and it does appear to fuction well enough to pass the gate
 > jobs but
 > this needs to be rebased.

Done.


 > the os module also provides acess to fork which we may be using for
 > things like the real os threads we fork for comuniating with
 > libvirt event stream so  this might prevent that from froking a
 > real os thread.
 
I checked the eventlet.green.os module, `os.fork` is not monkey_patched.
 
 > personally i would like to see us disable as much monkey patachin
 > in eventlet as possibale so that we can eventually stop using it
 > entirely but that a seperate conversation.

I agree with you, monkey patch all modules in eventlet is not a good choice, we should know in detail why certain modules are patched but others are not.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-08-28 03:00:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Remove args(os=False) in monkey_patch

The first patch introduced os=False is
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/11556/

But there is no explaination why nova should not monkey_patch `os`
module. The args(os=False) make nova process has to wait while calling
 os.(['fdopen', 'read', 'write', 'wait', 'waitpid', 'open'])
, which seems to be unnecessary.

For nova-compute running on Windows(Hyper-v), `os` module should not be
patched, because Windows pipes don't support non-blocking I/O. I add a
comment to note that.

[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/blob/v0.23.0/eventlet/green/os.py#L12

Change-Id: I8b456676a04b9066cb2b570060c0d95cd4fe69f8

Add opendev/base-jobs repo

We will move the base jobs from openstack-infra/project-config
into this repo so they can be shared across all Zuul tenants.

Change-Id: I0f8a3867c5fa76c7246866ec28edf0cb63496f69

Fix overcloud neutron sanity validation

The openvswitch_agent.ini file can't be used for the
neutron-sanity-check on the overcloud.

commit_message:
Remove tempest service enable vars

With I524df4c5a24c21057bd11ffa8cec3dad8b118384 implemented,
we no longer need these in group_vars because they're in
the tempest role instead.

commit_message:
Make container_interface optional for provider network

As Neutron agents move to bare metal by default, the container_interface
attribute for a Neutron provider network (e.g. br-vlan, br-vxlan, etc) is
unnecessary and confusing. This patch aims to change it from a required
attribute to an optional one.

Change-Id: I52692f5a36e7064c3a6ac6ccafc2420549685a66

commit_message:
Allocation API: minor fixes to DB and RPC

This is a follow-up to commit 36b047ff5e1b0c1cf64d4b58bf8a9ce3bcc87e85:
* Do the join on the database level when filtering allocations by node UUID
* Add a check that we do not touch instance_info in destroy_allocation to
  document it as an explicit decision.
* Fix a few grammar nits and inprecise comments.

Change-Id: I1fa7815ae3b6a0190bdb3bf0257ae79fb6a36671
Story: #2004341

commit_message:
Create barbican's creator role by default

Barbican has a very specific set of keystone roles that it uses in order
to properly enforce RBAC. One of them (and the most important) is the
creator role. Which you'll assign to your users in order to allow them
to create and retrieve secrets (the other role that can do this is
admin... but we don't want to rely on this).

For usability, lets create this role automatically as part of the
TripleO installation.

Closes-Bug: #1812209
Change-Id: I9d5f912684a0987a6bdf244321215bd5595a0fa0

commit_message:
Fixes  Bug1521873
move the attributes "port_id" in Tap Services and "source_port" in Tap Flow to "port" attribute, as that is the default nomenclature used across Neutron.
1.move tap_services's attribute "port_id" into "port"
2.move tap_flows's attribute "source_port" into "port"
3.change relative codes in neutron_taas/services/taas/taas_plugin.py
4.change relative codes in neutron_taas/taas_client(cli relavant codes)
5.change tests codes: move all variables:"port_id" and "source_port" to "port"
6.change neutron_taas/db/taas_db.py:modify db codes, change database column "port_id" and "source_port" to "port"
7.change neutron_taas/db/migration/taas_init_ops.py

Change-Id: Ib80ba6a69fc845c779692d330089b4056fd443e5

commit_message:
Fix check-network-gateway validation

The `undercloud.conf` file has now 2 sections (DEFAULT and ctlplane-subnet).
A small numbers of parameters have been deprecated and moved to the
ctlplane-subnet section.

This patch proposes to use the 'ini' custom plugin to get parameter's values
from the undercloud.conf file instead of using the 'undercloud_conf' custom
plugin.

This validation will now get the 'ctlplane-subnet/gateway' instead of
'DEFAULT/network_gateway', which has been deprecated.

Resolves:rhbz#1660088

Change-Id: I15f90676df0eac6172fc4049232754f630cf6eca
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 590b440d5c37dce750ed5aa4d1f30e49266b9f0a)

commit_message:
Explicitly set certmonger's CA cert's permissions

We were relying on the default permissions that were being set by the
command that extracts the certificate into a PEM file. This wasn't the
right approach, as it could be too restrictive in some setups.

Here, we explicitly tell puppet to set the appropriate permissions
instead.

Given this is a certificate file, and there's no private key involved,
we can set it as world readable (0644). As folks in the system need to
access the file.

Change-Id: I4b2cb1071e3fd5a1277d54b86822e8fef2df0d78
Closes-bug: #1788257
(cherry picked from commit 5d6201f9fc97c525913e1aded8edd85de60ab528)

commit_message:
Explicitly set certmonger's CA cert's permissions

We were relying on the default permissions that were being set by the
command that extracts the certificate into a PEM file. This wasn't the
right approach, as it could be too restrictive in some setups.

Here, we explicitly tell puppet to set the appropriate permissions
instead.

Given this is a certificate file, and there's no private key involved,
we can set it as world readable (0644). As folks in the system need to
access the file.

Change-Id: I4b2cb1071e3fd5a1277d54b86822e8fef2df0d78
Closes-bug: #1788257
(cherry picked from commit 5d6201f9fc97c525913e1aded8edd85de60ab528)

commit_message:
Add policy test for volume action policy

Add policy test for volume action policy, and
remove them from test policy file.

This is one of the series patches of policy-in-code test, see
more information on [1] and [2].

[1] 530fb9319ce21b7ff99e55f095c04f13f0785842
[2] f207bac80924ffaf6d4c2a500c295d0e2e71966e

Change-Id: I2fef858daf26a1a1b452d5ce3b085caa112bb688

commit_message:
Update Prefixes.

Update the Prefixes of Ceilometer generated
RPC and Notification addresses to override
the default prefixes generated by oslo messaging.

Change-Id: Ifd5c4bca8d1fc7bbfa9f03fc09250cce9dabd954

commit_message:
Changing "back end" to "backend"

All other occurances of "backend/back-end/back end" are of the form
"backend"; this is the only instance of "back end".  While the meaning
is clear regardless of this change, suggesting this change for
consistency.

commit_message:
Enable overriding the service setup host python interpreter

In order to enable the service setup host python interpreter to
be changed easily, we make it a variable. This will be useful
when someone sets the service setup host to be the utility
container, because we'll be able to set this var by default.

Change-Id: Id3727087b8302258875aa175b2bd2b2a6b4ebe0e
(cherry picked from commit 86c8f7fee2a1ee1a2d0c2e49b982c07c9059f74c)

turns out this variable doesn't do anything, all I can see is uwsgi getting set up (without ssl) and no web server in front of it.  anyone else see anything?

if that's the case setting the same options (disable ssl2/3 and tls1.0/1.1) would need enabling ssl in the uwsgi config and set this option as well.

ssl-option = 385875968

#define     SSL_OP_NO_SSLv2   0x01000000L
#define     SSL_OP_NO_SSLv3   0x02000000L
#define     SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1   0x04000000L
#define     SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1_2   0x08000000L
#define     SSL_OP_NO_TLSv1_1   0x10000000L

python -c 'print(int(0x01000000) + int(0x02000000) + int(0x04000000) + int(0x10000000))'
385875968

might need to add no_compress and stuff (looking at uwsgi code it adds a couple of other flags)."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-01-09 16:43:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-01-14 15:32:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Refactor on policy in code

Recently, we add the policy in code test, and put all these
cases into test_volume_protection.py, but with the test case
growing up, it's difficult to maintenance.

In this patch, we refactor these test cases:
1. Add a new unit test case path - "tests/unit/policies/".
2. Split policy in code test in their own file, which is one-to-one
mapping to policy file.

Note that, there is no functional changes in this patch.

commit_message:
flatten the heat service configurations

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration
for all heat services.

With this patch the baremetal version of each heat service has been removed.

Change-Id: I5d639135b19b8fabfaa8beac54ae0dfc48f070f9
Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening

commit_message:
Avoid ignoring failure to collect missing folders

Makes output easier to read by avoiding errors related to missing
folders.

Keep in mind that log collection happens even for failed builds so
missing files are to be expected and not a reason to create warnings.

Collection should create warnings only if it encounters something
unexpected.

Partial-Bug: #1787912
Change-Id: I5c40e531c06389e9707c0db33d6aaa5baea0ddea

subject: Don't set iface-id when creating an OVS port
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5756, 'name': 'Terry Wilson', 'email': 'twilson@redhat.com', 'username': 'otherwiseguy'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10237, 'name': 'Numan Siddique', 'email': 'nusiddiq@redhat.com', 'username': 'numansiddique'}, {'_account_id': 11604, 'name': 'sean mooney', 'email': 'smooney@redhat.com', 'username': 'sean-k-mooney'}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 16688, 'name': 'Rodolfo Alonso', 'email': 'ralonsoh@redhat.com', 'username': 'rodolfo-alonso-hernandez'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23804, 'name': 'Daniel Alvarez', 'email': 'dalvarez@redhat.com', 'username': 'dalvarez'}]

[{'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-01-18 11:49:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-01-18 11:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2019-01-18 11:59:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-01-18 12:04:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-01-18 12:07:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)

I think we had the same comment!'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-01-18 12:15:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-01-18 12:16:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> (1 comment)

Definitely!!! Shame on me :) thanks a lot folks'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-01-18 12:16:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

this is required for ml2/ovs to function.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-01-18 12:19:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> this is required for ml2/ovs to function.

Can you explain why this would break ml2ovs please?'}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2019-01-18 12:30:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> > this is required for ml2/ovs to function.
 > 
 > Can you explain why this would break ml2ovs please?

I still don't understand how the patch [0] addresses the security issue.
The commit says -
===
This change enables the neutron l2 agent to configure
  the ovs interface by assigning a vlan tag and
  installing openflow rules as appropriate.
====

But when libvirtd creates the prot with the option - "--if-exists del-port" will it not undo what ovs agent would have done (i.e it would have assigned the vlan tag and the port gets deleted and recreated again and ovs agent has to assign the vlan tag again) ?
I don't know the details. So I might sound naive :)

If the patch [0] solves the security issue and this patch proposed by Daniel would break ml2ovs, I think at least os-vif should provide the option to not create the ovs port during plug. The default behavior could be to create it. ml2 drivers like OVN can override that so that the ovs port doesn't get created at all in the first place.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-01-18 13:56:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

> this is required for ml2/ovs to function.

I don't understand how this is required for ml2/ovs. What is required will be added by Libvirt during vm boot process, no?"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-01-18 14:04:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

my inital -2 as based on a review of patchset 2 which stopped setting the iface-id in all cases. this whould have broken vhost-user windows and iptables case where libvirt would not recreate the port and set the iface-id.

in v3 this patch would work only because libvirt recreates the port.

if libvirt did not do that the neutron would never wire up the port by setting the approate teant tag in the case of ml2/ovs or openflow rules in the case of ovn/odl

when i wrote https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/commit/165ed325917e5deadb274ad9c122db157c0b55b2 my understanding was that libvirt only create the port if it did no exist.

that was wrong which is why we currently find our selves in the situation where the port is created twice.

i have proposed https://review.openstack.org/#/c/602432/ to solve the issue but it is highlighting other issue in the l2 agent. specifically with that patch applied only os-vif is creating the port but the l2 agent periodicly skips wireing up the port and does not send vif-plugged events.

the entire point of https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/commit/165ed325917e5deadb274ad9c122db157c0b55b2 was to force neutron to wire up the port before the vm is booted which is what we do for vhost-user and when hybrid-plug is true. 

i am going to propose a set of diferent patches to adress this in several ways. which we can evaluate.

path 1

1) a partial revert of https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/commit/165ed325917e5deadb274ad9c122db157c0b55b2 updtaing the release not to specify that https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1734320 is still present when using ml2/ovs with hybrid_plug=flase with libvirt.

this will temporally unblock ovn and other gates but will not resolve bug  1734320 and it will not resolve https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1808171. i have been able to repoduce that bug with my interface type ethernet change applied to the libvirt dirver.

2.) im going to add ovn and odl jobs to os-vif.

3.) im going to submit a patch to neutron and neutron-lib to record the ml2/driver in the vif binding details ditctionary in the neutron port object.

4.) ill add patch to nova to set the vlan tag in the libvirt xml to the dead vlan if hybrid_plug=flase and vif_type=ovs. 

5.) ill add a patch to os-vif that depend on the nova change to update teh release not for bug 1734320 to say that
the bug is now fixed when using ml2/ovs with hybrid_plug=flase with libvirt due to the nova change.

6.) ill extend the os-vif vif base object with a ml2/driver filed and modify nova to pass it to os-vif

7.) ill make setting the dead vlan automatic based on the value of the ml2 driver field with a fallback to the config option.

path 2

1.) we merge https://review.openstack.org/#/c/602432/

2.)we fix the issue in the ovs l2 agent that results in it sometimes not wireing up the interface
   and  not sending the network-vif-plugged event https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1808171

3.) we do steps 3, 6 and 7 as they were planed as follow up work anyway to remove the need for the config
    option to enable vif isolation.

for path 1 the open question is will libvirt mess with the vlan tag and try to revert it to 4095 after nuetorn wires it up.
i think the answer is no but ill need to test.

for path 2 the open question is what casues https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1808171.
bug 1808171 happens when the libvirt xml is set to not interact with ovs so it is not caused by
https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/commit/165ed325917e5deadb274ad9c122db157c0b55b2 but that change
seams to trigger it more frequently.


the reason i am keeping my -2 is this change does not update the release note or revert to the behavior before
https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/commit/165ed325917e5deadb274ad9c122db157c0b55b2
also this patch does not modify the ovo to allow a vlue of none whice is causeing the test failures.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-01-18 14:52:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

by the way whatever we end up doing this will require a new release of os-vif to take effect. 

neutron could blacklist 1.3.1  to unblock the gate but that is a pretty
heavy hammer as there are other changes that would eliminate.

i had planned on doing a release in two weeks time and another in 4 weeks time.
we can pull in the next release to early next week given the apparent gate impact of #1728600.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-01-18 15:26:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > my inital -2 as based on a review of patchset 2 which stopped
 > setting the iface-id in all cases. this whould have broken
 > vhost-user windows and iptables case where libvirt would not
 > recreate the port and set the iface-id.
 > 
 > in v3 this patch would work only because libvirt recreates the
 > port.
 > 
 > if libvirt did not do that the neutron would never wire up the port
 > by setting the approate teant tag in the case of ml2/ovs or
 > openflow rules in the case of ovn/odl
 > 
 > when i wrote https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/commit/165ed325917e5deadb274ad9c122db157c0b55b2
 > my understanding was that libvirt only create the port if it did no
 > exist.
 > 
 > that was wrong which is why we currently find our selves in the
 > situation where the port is created twice.
 > 
 > i have proposed https://review.openstack.org/#/c/602432/ to solve
 > the issue but it is highlighting other issue in the l2 agent.
 > specifically with that patch applied only os-vif is creating the
 > port but the l2 agent periodicly skips wireing up the port and does
 > not send vif-plugged events.
 > 
 > the entire point of https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/commit/165ed325917e5deadb274ad9c122db157c0b55b2
 > was to force neutron to wire up the port before the vm is booted
 > which is what we do for vhost-user and when hybrid-plug is true.

Please keep in mind that this port created by os-vif has got ofport=-1 and that prevents neutron-ovs-agent to wire it. So in fact port will not be configured in any case until it will not be properly set by Libvirt.

 > 
 > i am going to propose a set of diferent patches to adress this in
 > several ways. which we can evaluate.
 > 
 > path 1
 > 
 > 1) a partial revert of https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/commit/165ed325917e5deadb274ad9c122db157c0b55b2
 > updtaing the release not to specify that https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1734320
 > is still present when using ml2/ovs with hybrid_plug=flase with
 > libvirt.
 > 
 > this will temporally unblock ovn and other gates but will not
 > resolve bug  1734320 and it will not resolve https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1808171.
 > i have been able to repoduce that bug with my interface type
 > ethernet change applied to the libvirt dirver.
 > 
 > 2.) im going to add ovn and odl jobs to os-vif.
 > 
 > 3.) im going to submit a patch to neutron and neutron-lib to record
 > the ml2/driver in the vif binding details ditctionary in the
 > neutron port object.
 > 
 > 4.) ill add patch to nova to set the vlan tag in the libvirt xml to
 > the dead vlan if hybrid_plug=flase and vif_type=ovs.
 > 
 > 5.) ill add a patch to os-vif that depend on the nova change to
 > update teh release not for bug 1734320 to say that
 > the bug is now fixed when using ml2/ovs with hybrid_plug=flase with
 > libvirt due to the nova change.
 > 
 > 6.) ill extend the os-vif vif base object with a ml2/driver filed
 > and modify nova to pass it to os-vif
 > 
 > 7.) ill make setting the dead vlan automatic based on the value of
 > the ml2 driver field with a fallback to the config option.
 > 
 > path 2
 > 
 > 1.) we merge https://review.openstack.org/#/c/602432/
 > 
 > 2.)we fix the issue in the ovs l2 agent that results in it
 > sometimes not wireing up the interface
 > and  not sending the network-vif-plugged event https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1808171
 > 
 > 3.) we do steps 3, 6 and 7 as they were planed as follow up work
 > anyway to remove the need for the config
 > option to enable vif isolation.
 > 
 > for path 1 the open question is will libvirt mess with the vlan tag
 > and try to revert it to 4095 after nuetorn wires it up.
 > i think the answer is no but ill need to test.
 > 
 > for path 2 the open question is what casues https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1808171.
 > bug 1808171 happens when the libvirt xml is set to not interact
 > with ovs so it is not caused by
 > https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/commit/165ed325917e5deadb274ad9c122db157c0b55b2
 > but that change
 > seams to trigger it more frequently.
 > 
 > 
 > the reason i am keeping my -2 is this change does not update the
 > release note or revert to the behavior before
 > https://github.com/openstack/os-vif/commit/165ed325917e5deadb274ad9c122db157c0b55b2
 > also this patch does not modify the ovo to allow a vlue of none
 > whice is causeing the test failures.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-01-18 15:26:57.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+1 by Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>
'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-01-18 15:29:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

So, I think that we should go with this patch for now as a workaround for gate issue. After it will be merged, release new version to unblock gates and make life of others easier and then work on proper fixes on both nova and neutron side as they looks quite complex and may take some time.
What You think about it Sean?'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-01-18 15:52:57.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

As agreed on IRC, the problematic patch is going to be reverted as Sean's not keen on changing the OVO to allow None on the interface id."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-18 11:49:51.000000000', 'message': 'Don't set iface-id when creating an OVS port

After this patch [0], os-vif will always create the OVS interface
in the OVSDB during plug. Later, libvirtd will attempt to create
the port in OVS with "--if-exists del-port" options which causes
the port to be deleted and recreated.

This situation can cause some issues. In particular, for OVN backend,
it will make the port being claimed, released and claimed again by
ovn-controller. Flows associated to this port will be reinstalled
and it will be a problem at scale. Also, it's causing tempest
failures which are affecting the networking-ovn gate heavily.

In order to fix the issue for all the Neutron drivers, this patch
will make os-vif not set the 'iface-id' option on the OVS Interface
so ovn-controller (also ovs-agent) will ignore the port until
libvirtd ultimately creates the OVS port with the 'iface-id'
external-id and the binding will occur.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/602384/

Closes-Bug: #1728600
Related-Bug: #1808171
Related-Bug: #1811405

Change-Id: I8906f37c39b27f2f2bb3f51e1b3fc5c4b779ecc0
Co-Authored-By: Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Don't set iface-id when creating an OVS port

After this patch [0], os-vif will always create the OVS interface
in the OVSDB during plug. Later, libvirtd will attempt to create
the port in OVS with "--if-exists del-port" options which causes
the port to be deleted and recreated.

This situation can cause some issues. In particular, for OVN backend,
it will make the port being claimed, released and claimed again by
ovn-controller. Flows associated to this port will be reinstalled
and it will be a problem at scale. Also, it's causing tempest
failures which are affecting the networking-ovn gate heavily.

In order to fix the issue for all the Neutron drivers, this patch
will make os-vif not set the 'iface-id' option on the OVS Interface
so ovn-controller (also ovs-agent) will ignore the port until
libvirtd ultimately creates the OVS port with the 'iface-id'
external-id and the binding will occur.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/602384/

Closes-Bug: #1728600
Related-Bug: #1808171
Related-Bug: #1811405

Change-Id: I8906f37c39b27f2f2bb3f51e1b3fc5c4b779ecc0
Co-Authored-By: Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 29786, 'date': '2019-01-11 15:40:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-01-11 15:40:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2019-01-11 16:17:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I actually just pushed up:

that will allow you to remove some code. You can still call the job kata-dco-license (and parent to dco-license) or just consume dco-license directly.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-01-11 16:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

And can add a Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/630302/ so that both can be reviewed/tested at the same time'}, {'account_id': 29786, 'date': '2019-01-15 14:30:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

With the landing of:

this commit will now likely be redundant.
I'll open a new commit on the project-config repo to add the dco-license jobs to the existing kata projects, and given that is successful, will then close this commit down."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-01-18 15:43:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

They both merged so you can click on "Abandon" to abandon this change.'}, {'account_id': 29786, 'date': '2019-01-18 15:46:21.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Upstream versions have merged, no requirement for this commit any more.'}]

commit_message:
Add dco-signoff check files for Kata Containers

We are moving towards using Zuul CI to check the DCO
Signed-off-by validity for Kata Containers pull requests.
Add the playbook, role and job so we can then add to the
kata projects.

This code is based directly on #629565, and will be
superseded once that code lands in the mainline zuul
codebase.

Other refs:
 https://github.com/kata-containers/ci/issues/98
 https://github.com/kata-containers/ci/issues/99

Signed-off-by: Graham Whaley <graham.whaley@intel.com>

Change-Id: Ifad5d25daa24d95faac1a971ec91331f2d1e6ce8
Related-Bug: #629565

commit_message:
Add policy test for volume extend/retype/update_ro policy

Add policy test for volume extend/retype/update_readonly_flag policy,
and remove them from test policy file.

This is one of the series patches of policy-in-code test, see
more information on [1] and [2].

[1] 530fb9319ce21b7ff99e55f095c04f13f0785842
[2] f207bac80924ffaf6d4c2a500c295d0e2e71966e

Change-Id: I52f2cea01a84cb398fedddb8dbeaca377baaeb95

commit_message:
Make sure nova-compute is not configured with database access

Apparently we're inheriting some database config from the main file,
which should not be set for nova-compute. If we're properly in superconductor
mode where we have a dedicated config for compute, remove those lines
if present.

Closes-Bug: #1797413

Change-Id: I4820abe57a023050dd8d067c77e26028801ff288
(cherry picked from commit 7d0003ef7ed2c2609ffe6782e0ce6147f9c9a3bf)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-23 16:33:59.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Introduced PciDeviceAddressPattern class

The new class will be responsible for matching PCI device
addresses with PCI device patterns (spec).
Such patterns will be provided by operators, therefore it
should handle different formats.

Change-Id: Ic6f97129e928b446857af65d7b17bfdc91eba761
Signed-off-by: Maciej Kucia <m.kucia@partner.samsung.com>
'}]
commit_message:
WIP Introduced PciDeviceAddressPattern class

The new class will be responsible for matching PCI device
addresses with PCI device patterns (spec).
Such patterns will be provided by operators, therefore it
should handle different formats.

Change-Id: Ic6f97129e928b446857af65d7b17bfdc91eba761
Signed-off-by: Maciej Kucia <m.kucia@partner.samsung.com>

subject: Fixed compute vcpu properites missing underscore

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-11-09 16:46:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

This patch completely dropped off my radar.  Let me clarify what I'm interested in here:

(1)  The metadefs catalog should absolutely record the correct image property names as used by Nova.  We do not want to have a mix of correct and incorrect names in the metadefs catalog.  That would completely defeat the purpose of having a metadefs catalog.

(2) The migration issue is this: People have been adding 'hw_whatever' to their images since Juno.  This has turned out to be a no-op  because nova only recognizes 'hw_what_ever'.  Are we going to migrate the property names *on the images* so that they will actually work now?  Or is it better to leave them alone, because there might be a surprise effect on users if the properties actually cause their VMs to behave differently?  I don't have a preference for which we do; I just want it to be a conscious choice that is documented somewhere, either by including a migration on this patch, or by explicitly mentioning that there is no provision for migration in a release note.

(3) This is slightly off-topic, but Daniel B mentions on the bug that nova has a versioned image object that contains nova's canonical list of image properties that will be recognized by nova and have an effect.  The change addressed here is not the first time Glance metadefs have been out-of-sync with what nova is actually using.  If someone on this patch has some time, it would be good to look into whether we can get some testing associated with this.  Zuul3 has some capabilities that may make it possible for us to have a test that checks the Nova versioned image object to see if it's been modified, and if so, trigger a test."}, {'account_id': 25588, 'date': '2019-01-18 14:32:26.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

stale'}]

commit_message:
Fixed compute vcpu properites missing underscore

Property names should reflect nova code
 nova/virt/hardware.py

Co-authored-by: Mike Fedosin <mikhail.fedosin.ext@nokia.com>
Closes-Bug: #1568191
Change-Id: I0ef10320edc19ca89da2ff23de8a3558a5158fdc
Signed-off-by: Maciej Kucia <m.kucia@partner.samsung.com>

[{'created': '2017-06-21 11:39:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add JSON schema validation to PCI whitelist

Sanitize config input by providing schema. This change
should make easier for developers to understand the format
of whitelist entry and prevent undefined behaviour in code.
Until this patch only JSON syntax was checked.

Format is non-trival and code expects specific fields.
Operator is entering whitelist JSON items manually, it is
easy to make a typo.

commit_message:
Add JSON schema validation to PCI whitelist

Sanitize config input by providing schema. This change
should make easier for developers to understand the format
of whitelist entry and prevent undefined behaviour in code.
Until this patch only JSON syntax was checked.

Format is non-trival and code expects specific fields.
Operator is entering whitelist JSON items manually, it is
easy to make a typo.
 pci_passthrough_whitelist={"vendor_id": "8086", "prdouct_id": "10fb"}

Change-Id: I928e1c38db9b1829c30ffdd44b04033b45d96e81
Signed-off-by: Maciej Kucia <maciej@kucia.net>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-15 14:44:11.000000000', 'message': "kata: add dco-license jobs to kata projects

Now the dco-license check is part of the baseline zuul
library, add it as a pre-check (dependency) to the kata
projects.

We make it a pre-check, as if the signoff is incorrect,
the whole job will be re-submitted again, so why build
and test it all if we know we are going to have to
do it again later anyway. Sure, maybe a build will catch
problems 'earlier', but much of the time the submitter
may either fix the signoff before the builds have even
completed, or just see the signoff error and re-submit
without checking the rest of the build logs anyway.

Change-Id: I75c31b63bc4db3160162aac69b8d4bf94e32a942

commit_message:
kata: add dco-license jobs to kata projects

Now the dco-license check is part of the baseline zuul
library, add it as a pre-check (dependency) to the kata
projects.

We make it a pre-check, as if the signoff is incorrect,
the whole job will be re-submitted again, so why build
and test it all if we know we are going to have to
do it again later anyway. Sure, maybe a build will catch
problems 'earlier', but much of the time the submitter
may either fix the signoff before the builds have even
completed, or just see the signoff error and re-submit
without checking the rest of the build logs anyway.

Change-Id: I75c31b63bc4db3160162aac69b8d4bf94e32a942
Signed-off-by: Graham Whaley <graham.whaley@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add service template sections walkthough (part 1)

This adds the first bit of going through all of the available sections
of the service templates. This will hopefully make it easier for folks
to know what's available and how to use it.

This first part adds the bare minimum you need to do to create a
service, and describes each section.

The rest of the sections will be added in subsequent patches.

Change-Id: I1c8e7f5a8967a68554f28a66d4a151c44d892247
Related-Bug: #1804642

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-17 18:11:47.000000000', 'message': 'Make set_config.py compatible with both Py2 and Py3

When asserting the validity of config files, we currently
use viewkeys(), which has been removed in Python3, so a kolla
container cannot set the config with Python3 only.

  "Traceback (most recent call last):",
  "  File \"/usr/local/bin/kolla_set_configs\", line 406, in main",
  "    config = load_config()",
  "  File \"/usr/local/bin/kolla_set_configs\", line 297, in load_config",
  "    validate_config(config)",
  "  File \"/usr/local/bin/kolla_set_configs\", line 238, in validate_config",
  "    if not data.viewkeys() >= required_keys:",
  "AttributeError: 'dict' object has no attribute 'viewkeys'"

Use keys() instead, which is compatible with both Python2 and
Python3, and has no visible performance disadvantage.

Change-Id: I5f53c8f5a390a9df3ebb60659ebdcef41e3a9cad
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
'}, {'created': '2019-01-18 09:37:47.000000000', 'message': 'Make set_config.py compatible with both Py2 and Py3

When asserting the validity of config files, we currently
use viewkeys(), which has been removed in Python3, so a kolla
container cannot set the config with Python3 only.

  "Traceback (most recent call last):",
  "  File \"/usr/local/bin/kolla_set_configs\", line 406, in main",
  "    config = load_config()",
  "  File \"/usr/local/bin/kolla_set_configs\", line 297, in load_config",
  "    validate_config(config)",
  "  File \"/usr/local/bin/kolla_set_configs\", line 238, in validate_config",
  "    if not data.viewkeys() >= required_keys:",
  "AttributeError: 'dict' object has no attribute 'viewkeys'"

Use keys() instead, which is compatible with both Python2 and
Python3, and has no visible performance disadvantage and wrap it in a
set() call so that we are guranteed to compare sets.

Change-Id: I5f53c8f5a390a9df3ebb60659ebdcef41e3a9cad
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
'}]
commit_message:
Make set_config.py compatible with both Py2 and Py3

When asserting the validity of config files, we currently
use viewkeys(), which has been removed in Python3, so a kolla
container cannot set the config with Python3 only.

  "Traceback (most recent call last):",
  "  File \"/usr/local/bin/kolla_set_configs\", line 406, in main",
  "    config = load_config()",
  "  File \"/usr/local/bin/kolla_set_configs\", line 297, in load_config",
  "    validate_config(config)",
  "  File \"/usr/local/bin/kolla_set_configs\", line 238, in validate_config",
  "    if not data.viewkeys() >= required_keys:",
  "AttributeError: 'dict' object has no attribute 'viewkeys'"

Use keys() instead, which is compatible with both Python2 and
Python3, and has no visible performance disadvantage and wrap it in a
set() call so that we are guranteed to compare sets.

Change-Id: I5f53c8f5a390a9df3ebb60659ebdcef41e3a9cad
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>

commit_message:
pylint: fix unexpected-keyword-arg error

horizon/forms/fields.py:
ThemableCheckboxSelectMultiple.__init__ does not have
arguments "name" and "value". They were specified before somehow.

openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/forms.py:
messages.error() does not have "redirect" argument.
We need to redirect explicitly.

Change-Id: Ib51abf136fb49e3be65005c5f48715f004379178

commit_message:
Add policy test for volume metadata policy

Add policy test for volume metadata policy, and
remove them from test policy file.

This is one of the series patches of policy-in-code test, see
more information on [1] and [2].

[1] 530fb9319ce21b7ff99e55f095c04f13f0785842
[2] f207bac80924ffaf6d4c2a500c295d0e2e71966e

Change-Id: I26b9d6df49516394c98b3c2fa67aa61dde08ffd1

commit_message:
Ensure logs folder is created in prep hosts tasks.

We have non fatal errors in the upgrade
jobs execution if the logs folder is not
created when adding the readme.txt file
to clarify the possible locations of
the logs.

Closes-Bug: 1811708
Change-Id: Ibc0a266bdc6630eaf34bfadeff21f7bd72fa75ad

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-09-04 13:44:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

The bug is incomplete, I can't reproduce it. Please attach your _quickstart.log with command and logs. If it fails, the reason could be completely different"}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-09-06 09:44:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sagi, I bumped into this issue and Wes helped by debugging it. You can see a log print in https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1790932'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-09-07 08:28:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

> The bug is incomplete, I can't reproduce it. Please attach your
 > _quickstart.log with command and logs. If it fails, the reason
 > could be completely different

@sagi I agree the bug is incomplete but is that worth a -2. Do you disagree with the proposed change (other than the 'Closes-Bug' in the commit message). 

To me its looks like a nice refactor of a 'cp' module i.e. bash into something more ansible native.

After Carlos note here I marked the https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1790932 as duplicate of the one here but I copied the trace from that bug so you can find the info you were asking for at https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1788919 comment #2

I guess my question is what specifically are you -2 for, if it is for the closes-bug that feels a bit harsh imho"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-09-07 12:05:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

revoting after discussion just now with weshay seems some more testing is needed'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-09-18 18:29:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This patch has nothing to do with the bug. It also breaks the fetch-images role. Ansible copy module is NOT equivalent to bash 'cp', please read carefully about "copy" module on Ansible docs page. 

So if it does't solve anything, doesn't improve anything and breaks current functionality, it deserves -2 only imho.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-09-26 10:41:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-09-26 10:52:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2018-09-26 10:54:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2018-09-27 23:31:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

The -2 was applied on patchset 2, and we're now at patchset 5. I'd like to see the -2 removed so the change can be judged on its merits."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-10-17 14:56:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

remote_src magic here once again'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-10-17 14:57:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20936, 'date': '2018-10-17 16:14:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-10-17 19:35:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-10-17 19:35:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-01-18 13:14:03.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning because this was not the correct way to fix this. What user is used depends on the qemu configuration of the host and the environment variables.'}]

commit_message:
Assure copied image is owned by current user

Avoids failure to resize image when reproducer is run as non root user.

Change-Id: I3272188a4ec8affcb0d1f2b1cd3cc49caede156a

commit_message:
Avoid fatal task execution when falling back to QEMU

Avoids confusing output about a fatal task that was not really
fatal in the end.

Before this change we would see "fatal: [subnode-2]: FAILED! => ...",
and a failed task inside PLAY RECAP while the execution was a
success (returns 0).

Now this would be avoived, making easier to read the output.

Change-Id: Ic54983dd95ee3b8a5df8fbcb0659a95dbc4214c3

Use MultiType and types.text instead of str

The goal of this is to fix python3 compatibility issues.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-11 11:41:45.000000000', 'message': "Avoid using 'truncate' on Windows

The Windows SMB driver has been broken by a recent change [1],
which is attempting to handle info file permissions, using the
'truncate' command along the way, which is not available on Windows.

We're not handling file permissions on Windows, so we can just skip
this step, avoiding this issue.

Change-Id: I1f92cef19cd2eed7ba845210f7ff89d88ba78f49
Closes-Bug: #1811369
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid using 'truncate' on Windows

The Windows SMB driver has been broken by a recent change [1],
which is attempting to handle info file permissions, using the
'truncate' command along the way, which is not available on Windows.

We're not handling file permissions on Windows, so we can just skip
this step, avoiding this issue.

Change-Id: I1f92cef19cd2eed7ba845210f7ff89d88ba78f49
Closes-Bug: #1811369

commit_message:
Look for used parameters in conditionals

This patch searches for parameter use in conditions as well
and should eliminate a lot of false positive warnings with
our validations.

Change-Id: I33eba9d46d8c83b7a34c39fdfcd35b62f52c8752

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-18 05:06:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix address for glusterfs container images

The `openshift_storage_glusterfs*_version` openshift-ansible variables
were removed in commit [1] as a way to specify the image tags to use.
Instead, the image URL needs to be fully specified in the
`openshift_storage_glusterfs*_image` variables to include the tags.

[1] https://github.com/openshift/openshift-ansible/commit/0be4b2565beb92c064917627863401af7dfb73d3

Change-Id: Ia68ff32008c154a644af88ef5d4da21b2b368526
Closes-Bug: #1805611
(cherry picked from commit 7c070ab11ec45a0e3572bdec060fe31fb42cb164)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix address for glusterfs container images

The `openshift_storage_glusterfs*_version` openshift-ansible variables
were removed in commit [1] as a way to specify the image tags to use.
Instead, the image URL needs to be fully specified in the
`openshift_storage_glusterfs*_image` variables to include the tags.

[1] https://github.com/openshift/openshift-ansible/commit/0be4b2565beb92c064917627863401af7dfb73d3

Change-Id: Ia68ff32008c154a644af88ef5d4da21b2b368526
Closes-Bug: #1805611
(cherry picked from commit 7c070ab11ec45a0e3572bdec060fe31fb42cb164)

[{'created': '2018-07-13 02:01:32.000000000', 'message': 'teach tripleo-wirewall about the DefaultFirewallRules parameter

With the accompanying change in puppet-tripleo, this removes the
hardcoded firewall rule allowing ssh traffic in tripleo::firewall::pre
and replaces it with a parameter in tripleo-firewall.yaml so that an
operator may modify it via the parameter_defaults mechanism.

See-also: I14b540e6564c5b7c5d54b4f1fd5368b000744135
Change-Id: I89cff59947dda3f51482486c41a3d67c4aa36a3e
