'}, {'created': '2018-07-17 14:59:51.000000000', 'message': "implement default ssh-from-ctlplane rule via hiera

With the accompanying change in puppet-tripleo, this removes the
hardcoded firewall rule allowing ssh traffic in tripleo::firewall::pre
and replaces it with a configuration in tripleo-firewall.yaml that
allows only ssh access from the undercloud's controlplane network
address. This allows operators to define more granular ssh
firewall rules via tripleo::firewall::firewall_rules.

Depends-on: I14b540e6564c5b7c5d54b4f1fd5368b000744135
Change-Id: I89cff59947dda3f51482486c41a3d67c4aa36a3e
"}, {'created': '2018-11-19 17:32:57.000000000', 'message': "implement default ssh-from-ctlplane rule via hiera

With the accompanying change in puppet-tripleo, this removes the
hardcoded firewall rule allowing ssh traffic in tripleo::firewall::pre
and replaces it with a configuration in tripleo-firewall.yaml that
allows only ssh access from the undercloud's controlplane network
address. This allows operators to define more granular ssh
firewall rules via tripleo::firewall::firewall_rules.

Needed-By: I14b540e6564c5b7c5d54b4f1fd5368b000744135
Change-Id: I89cff59947dda3f51482486c41a3d67c4aa36a3e
"}, {'created': '2018-11-19 17:34:39.000000000', 'message': "implement default ssh-from-ctlplane rule via hiera

With the accompanying change in puppet-tripleo, this removes the
hardcoded firewall rule allowing ssh traffic in tripleo::firewall::pre
and replaces it with a configuration in tripleo-firewall.yaml that
allows only ssh access from the undercloud's controlplane network
address. This allows operators to define more granular ssh
firewall rules via tripleo::firewall::firewall_rules.

commit_message:
implement default ssh-from-ctlplane rule via hiera

With the accompanying change in puppet-tripleo, this removes the
hardcoded firewall rule allowing ssh traffic in tripleo::firewall::pre
and replaces it with a configuration in tripleo-firewall.yaml that
allows only ssh access from the undercloud's controlplane network
address. This allows operators to define more granular ssh
firewall rules via tripleo::firewall::firewall_rules.

Needed-By: I14b540e6564c5b7c5d54b4f1fd5368b000744135
Change-Id: I89cff59947dda3f51482486c41a3d67c4aa36a3e

commit_message:
oslo.config: Avoid dependency on oslo.log

This makes the switch to python 3.7 in a rolling
distribution (openSUSE Tumbleweed) hard doe to cyclic
dependencies between oslo.config and oslo.log (bsc#1121609)

Change-Id: I78a4c1aeca63f296acf3628989b5242fc26777d4

commit_message:
Use --preserve-env to keep proxy settings

User may set http_proxy/no_proxy and then run the install.
We don't preserve the env when doing undercloud install.

Change-Id: Iec51bf33bdca7fb0d3026512abd9360ef3cecb70
Closes-Bug: #1811376

subject: Break out ironic client from neutron agent
messages:
[{'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-01-15 18:29:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-01-15 18:34:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-01-16 13:45:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2019-01-17 09:21:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

If we split option out of the same namespace, we have to also update tools/config/networking-baremetal-config-generator.conf to include:
namespace = ironic-client

Besides, I found other issues when I generate the sample config file:
1. there is no env to generate a sample config (typically genconfig)
2. the sample output path (etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/) doesn't exist at all, generation will fail
3. the i18n '_' referenced by the help message of the ironic client opts doesn't be imported at all

I don't insist we solve issue 1&2 in this patch, but other two issues needs to be addressed."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-01-17 12:29:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-01-17 12:33:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > If we split option out of the same namespace, we have to also
 > update tools/config/networking-baremetal-config-generator.conf to
 > include:
 > namespace = ironic-client
 > 
 > Besides, I found other issues when I generate the sample config
 > file:
 > 1. there is no env to generate a sample config (typically
 > genconfig)
 > 2. the sample output path (etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/) doesn't exist
 > at all, generation will fail
 > 3. the i18n '_' referenced by the help message of the ironic client
 > opts doesn't be imported at all
 > 
 > I don't insist we solve issue 1&2 in this patch, but other two
 > issues needs to be addressed.

Good catch! Thanks!
I believe 1&2 is a conscious decision to not keep sample configs in the code tree. The sample configuration is generated whith the docs.


I have added ironic-client to config generator namespace. And pulled in i18n from ironicclient."}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2019-01-18 01:39:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Thank you Harald, LGTM!

We haven't kept sample config file in the repo around ?Pike?, but I am not sure whether it's a 'conscious decision' to not have a genconfig, I think it's a good addition, people may want to manually generate a file for testing, and it may benefit packaging as well. Anyway it's out of the scope of this patch :)"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-18 10:26:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Break out ironic client from neutron agent

With the coming Neutron Notification support the
ironic client will be used to send events. Since
the client will be used in different places it
makes sense to move the code out of the agent
so that it can be shared.

Related Story: 1304673
Change-Id: Ie615691f95165c21e7064ae3eb48bfb6b5c454fa

commit_message:
Ensure reaction to svc target-port update

When the target port of a service is updated and is not allowed
on the pods by the Network Policy, the security group rule needs
to be removed from the LBaaS.

Partially Implements: blueprint k8s-network-policies

Change-Id: Ic0e58aa558ff8497b5090509f5a91d2b3aedc61f

each connection from rbd image to osd needs 1 fd and 2 threads. if we

each connection from rbd image to osd needs 1 fd and 2 threads. if we

commit_message:
optimize qemu.conf

bump up the max_files to 32768 and max_processes to 131072.
when nova used ceph as backend, the default limit 1024 is not enough.
each connection from rbd image to osd needs 1 fd and 2 threads. if we
have 200 osds, we need 200 fds and 400 threads for 1 image.

Change-Id: I94c3ec111473ea2ccacdea5dbbf3fdc9c569859f

Add two dataplane load balance tests

test_dataplane_tcp for TCP traffic
test_dataplane_udp for UDP traffic

both tests check uniformity of traffic distribution

commit_message:
Convert test network setup to use the networkd role

The test network setup was using the legacy interface configs and
providing an inconsistent experience. These changes will pull it in plce
with the intergrated repo for all of our distros giving us a very
consistent experience.

Change-Id: I637b048b8c8a3fb44f91e4227a02787eacd32b57
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Move cellv2 discovery from control plane services to compute services

If compute nodes are deployed without deploying/updating the controllers then
the computes will not have cellv2 mappings as this is run in the controller
deploy steps (nova-api).
This can happen if the controller nodes are blacklisted during a compute scale
out. It's also likely to be an issue going forward if the deployment is staged
(e.g split control plane).

This change moves the cell_v2 discovery logic to the nova-compute/nova-ironic
deploy step.

Closes-bug: 1786961
Change-Id: I12a02f636f31985bc1b71bff5b744d346286a95f

commit_message:
Send context.global_id on neutron calls

In I866b8c6593c76c089da6bed55cf863ac556c9a8e nova sends global_id
on neutron calls, but in I41724a612a5f3eabd504f3eaa9d2f9d141ca3f69
it changed to global_request_id which may be None.

A simple unit test wrinkle is added to avoid future regressions.

Closes-Bug:#1809943

Change-Id: Iaa47304755db66a834dde38dcd55cc259c1008a3
(cherry picked from commit a31157c527ae88af2e8c283e8b5156e9ace55dfa)

[{'account_id': 29632, 'date': '2018-12-06 16:56:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-12-06 16:56:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

subject: Change phase to check for dracut-regenerate in iscsi-boot
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21909, 'name': 'Bob Fournier', 'email': 'bfournie@redhat.com', 'username': 'bfournie'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27731, 'name': 'Luis Arizmendi', 'email': 'luis.ariz@gmail.com'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2019-01-02 10:06:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2019-01-07 13:29:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-01-08 04:07:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I actually agree this should move, since it doesn't make sense to do this on every environment import.  So OK with the change ...

However, I'd like to understand why it doesn't work?

get_image_element should be exported by the call at [1]

we then source the environment files and run the scripts together in [2].  it is unclear to me why the sourced environment files wouldn't find this variable, but then the scripts we run in the next step do?

Do we have some logs that might suggest what's going on in more detail?


[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/diskimage-builder/tree/diskimage_builder/lib/disk-image-create#n242
[2] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/diskimage-builder/tree/diskimage_builder/lib/dib-run-parts#n113"}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2019-01-08 06:16:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Check https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1654615 , you can see logs there. I tried on my own and i could verify that get_element_array was not valid on that stage.'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2019-01-08 06:16:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

nit, that "get_image_element_array" was not valid at that stage'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-01-08 06:39:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Interesting, it did work in root.d

 2018-12-13 11:25:42.950 | dib-run-parts Sourcing environment file /tmp/dib_build.MmwDeVvF/hooks/root.d/../environment.d/open-iscsi-config
 2018-12-13 11:25:42.958 | + source /tmp/dib_build.MmwDeVvF/hooks/root.d/../environment.d/open-iscsi-config
 2018-12-13 11:25:42.958 | ++ [[ centos7 = \c\e\n\t\o\s\7 ]]
 2018-12-13 11:25:42.959 | +++ get_image_element_array
 2018-12-13 11:25:52.851 | +++ echo '[iscsi-boot]=/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/diskimage_builder/elements /iscsi-boot [rpm-distro]=/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/diskimage_builder/elements/rpm-distro

but not in pre-install.d

 2018-12-13 11:25:53.640 | dib-run-parts Sourcing environment file /tmp/in_target.d/pre-install.d /../environment.d/open-iscsi-config
 2018-12-13 11:25:53.643 | + source /tmp/in_target.d/pre-install.d/../environment.d/open-iscsi-config
 2018-12-13 11:25:53.644 | ++ [[ centos7 = \c\e\n\t\o\s\7 ]]
 2018-12-13 11:25:53.644 | +++ get_image_element_array
 2018-12-13 11:25:53.645 | /tmp/in_target.d/pre-install.d/../environment.d/open-iscsi-config: line 2:  get_image_element_array: command not found
 2018-12-13 11:25:53.645 | ++ eval declare -A 'image_elements=()'
 2018-12-13 11:25:53.645 | +++ image_elements=()
 2018-12-13 11:25:53.645 | +++ declare -A image_elements

thus I guess we're not exporting in-chroot -- which makes some sense now I think about it as that's in a separate subshell?  Not sure I'd considered this difference before ... perhaps we should just document this; as to fix it I guess we'd have to do something like write out a temporary .sh file with various variables, and source it before we run inside the chroot?  Sounds like over-optimisation when it's probably not necessary"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-01-08 07:34:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

now i get it I'm ok with this.  we can document better in a follow-on"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-01-09 00:15:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2019-01-15 13:57:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2019-01-15 15:49:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2019-01-15 18:48:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2019-01-16 15:29:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-01-18 08:01:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-02 10:06:05.000000000', 'message': 'Change phase to check for dracut-regenerate in iscsi-boot

There is an use of get_image_element_array on the environment.d
phase, for the iscsi-boot element.
This function is not available on that step. So moving the check
at next step, extra-data-d, where it is available.

Change-Id: I89cfe565492142c2f7962109360fcbcebadfd469
'}]
commit_message:
Change phase to check for dracut-regenerate in iscsi-boot

There is an use of get_image_element_array on the environment.d
phase, for the iscsi-boot element.
This function is not available on that step. So moving the check
at next step, extra-data-d, where it is available.

Change-Id: I89cfe565492142c2f7962109360fcbcebadfd469

commit_message:
Add policy test for volume update/del policy

Add policy test for DELETE_POLICY, UPDATE_POLICY, and
remove them from test policy file.

This is one of the series patches of policy-in-code test, see
more information on [1] and [2].

[1] 530fb9319ce21b7ff99e55f095c04f13f0785842
[2] f207bac80924ffaf6d4c2a500c295d0e2e71966e

Change-Id: Ic265cc7e558f48d215d3624453dcd5d85cbfd155

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-08 18:24:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix overcommit for NUMA-based instances

Change I5f5c621f2f0fa1bc18ee9a97d17085107a5dee53 modified how we
evaluated available memory for instances with a NUMA topology.
Previously, we used a non-pagesize aware check unless the user had
explicitly requested a specific pagesize. This means that for instances
without pagesize requests, nova considers hugepages as available memory
when deciding if a host has enough available memory for the instance.

The aforementioned change modified this so that all NUMA-based
instances, whether they had hugepages or not, would use the
pagesize-aware check. Unfortunately the functionality it was reusing to
do this was functionality previously only used for hugepages. Hugepages
cannot be oversubscribed so we did not take oversubscription into
account, comparing against available memory on the host (i.e. memory not
consumed by other instances) rather than total memory. This is OK when
using hugepages but not small pages, where overcommit is OK.

Given that overcommit is already handled elsewhere in the code, we
simply modify the non-hugepage code path to check for available memory
of the lowest pagesize vs. total memory.

Change-Id: I890b2c81cd49c1c601e9baee6a249709d0f6810e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1810977

commit_message:
Fix overcommit for NUMA-based instances

Change I5f5c621f2f0fa1bc18ee9a97d17085107a5dee53 modified how we
evaluated available memory for instances with a NUMA topology.
Previously, we used a non-pagesize aware check unless the user had
explicitly requested a specific pagesize. This means that for instances
without pagesize requests, nova considers hugepages as available memory
when deciding if a host has enough available memory for the instance.

The aforementioned change modified this so that all NUMA-based
instances, whether they had hugepages or not, would use the
pagesize-aware check. Unfortunately the functionality it was reusing to
do this was functionality previously only used for hugepages. Hugepages
cannot be oversubscribed so we did not take oversubscription into
account, comparing against available memory on the host (i.e. memory not
consumed by other instances) rather than total memory. This is OK when
using hugepages but not small pages, where overcommit is OK.

Given that overcommit is already handled elsewhere in the code, we
simply modify the non-hugepage code path to check for available memory
of the lowest pagesize vs. total memory.

Change-Id: I890b2c81cd49c1c601e9baee6a249709d0f6810e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1810977

commit_message:
Unity: Enable ssl verification

This commit allow user to enable ssl verification on demand for the
Unity Cinder driver.

Change-Id: Iaaa498a377edae873c489b6a5818923e16d594f0
(cherry picked from commit 8aa49599c7df62de5ab25a0a841265092e2881f7)
(cherry picked from commit 685de5a7b683552899fc0fd6c095d35b6a9bf555)

commit_message:
Make sure $TMP_BUILD_DIR/mnt is owned by root

The path $TMP_BUILD_DIR/mnt becomes the / inside the chroot during
the chroot phases of diskimage-builder. Previously this path was being
created using the account running diskimage-builder. This account may
not be valid inside the chroot. This causes path validation, when running
on a Ubuntu bionic host, to fail.
This patch chown's the $TMP_BUILD_DIR/mnt to root.root to make sure
that / is owned by a valid account inside the chroot.

Change-Id: Ifedc136baa67c7952942aed2c8cb1041902fef91
Closes-Bug: 1811113

commit_message:
Prevent podman healthcheck failures during deploy

Modify systemd healthcheck units so that check is not executed until
2min after being enabled, to allow containerized service time to become
available. The combination of OnActive and OnUnitActive replaces OnCalendar.
After the OnActive countdown causes the service unit to be first run,
OnUnitActive will provide a monotonic timer for future executions
Also, do not explicitly enable the service unit as only the timer should
control this service.

Closes-Bug: #1809833

Change-Id: I6a916d62e7b3eed5190c12ea3b37ba240a9ab184

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-04 17:21:14.000000000', 'message': "[DVR] Allow multiple subnets per external network

An external network can have more than un subnet. Currently only the
first subnet is added to the FIP namespace route table. Packets for
FIPs with addresses in other subnets can't pass through the external
port because there is no route for those FIP CIDRs.

This change adds routes for those CIDRs via the external port IP and
interface.

These routes doesn't collide with the existing ones, added to provide
a back path for the packets with a destination IP matching a FIP.

E.g.:
$ ip netns exec fip-e1ec0f98-b593-4514-ae08-f1c5cf1c2788 ip route
  (1) 169.254.106.114/31 dev fpr-3937f879-d  proto kernel  scope link \
      src 169.254.106.115
  (2) 192.168.20.250 via 169.254.106.114 dev fpr-3937f879-d
  (3) 192.168.30.0/24 dev fg-bee060f1-dd  proto kernel  scope link  \
      src 192.168.30.129
  (4) 192.168.20.0/24 via 192.168.30.129 dev fg-bee060f1-dd  scope link

Rule (2) is added when a FIP is assigned. This rule permits ingress
packets going into the router namespace. This FIP belongs to the second
subnet of the external network (note the external port CIDR is not the
same). Rule (4), added by this patch, allows egress packets to exit
the FIP namespace through the external port. Rule (2), because of the
prefix length (32), has more priority than rule (4).

Change-Id: I4d476b47e89fa5709dca2f66ffae72a27d88340a
Closes-Bug: #1805456

commit_message:
[DVR] Allow multiple subnets per external network

An external network can have more than one subnet. Currently only the
first subnet is added to the FIP namespace routing table. Packets for
FIPs with addresses in other subnets can't pass through the external
port because there is no route for those FIP CIDRs.

This change adds routes for those CIDRs via the external port IP and
interface.

These routes doesn't collide with the existing ones, added to provide
a back path for the packets with a destination IP matching a FIP.

E.g.:
$ ip netns exec fip-e1ec0f98-b593-4514-ae08-f1c5cf1c2788 ip route
  (1) 169.254.106.114/31 dev fpr-3937f879-d  proto kernel  scope link \
      src 169.254.106.115
  (2) 192.168.20.250 via 169.254.106.114 dev fpr-3937f879-d
  (3) 192.168.30.0/24 dev fg-bee060f1-dd  proto kernel  scope link  \
      src 192.168.30.129
  (4) 192.168.20.0/24 via 192.168.30.129 dev fg-bee060f1-dd  scope link

Rule (2) is added when a FIP is assigned. This rule permits ingress
packets going into the router namespace. This FIP belongs to the second
subnet of the external network (note the external port CIDR is not the
same). Rule (4), added by this patch, allows egress packets to exit
the FIP namespace through the external port. Rule (2), because of the
prefix length (32), has more priority than rule (4).

Change-Id: I4d476b47e89fa5709dca2f66ffae72a27d88340a
Closes-Bug: #1805456

commit_message:
Add image-list filter for multihash

This was missed when multihash support was added to the glanceclient.
The os_hash_value is an indexed field in the API.

Includes a release note.

Closes-bug: #1788271

Change-Id: Ibfe28b8c644967b7e0295dfd3f55c3ae1b0cbb2d

commit_message:
Set requireContributorAgreement false for windmill / windmill-ops

It was pointed out on IRC, we have CLA config option enabled. Given that
we are not official openstack projects, we can disable this making is
easier for new users to contribute.

Change-Id: Ib5fc7e547f0949e8624539f46ea28f9096c8c733
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-18 01:18:33.000000000', 'message': 'HTK: dont set keystone password on user creation

This PS updates the Keystone user job script to not
set the user password upon potential creation, falling back
to the set password command later in the script. This is both
slighly cleaner, and avoids potential race conditions when
running multiple keystone servers.

Change-Id: Ibe775df23fe7b747aea5137ca85975e067b8cea3
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>
'}]
commit_message:
HTK: dont set keystone password on user creation

This PS updates the Keystone user job script to not
set the user password upon potential creation, falling back
to the set password command later in the script. This is both
slighly cleaner, and avoids potential race conditions when
running multiple keystone servers.

Change-Id: Ibe775df23fe7b747aea5137ca85975e067b8cea3
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-17 15:49:13.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent abnormal timeout values from breaking sync with ironic

I had a case when an operator set the timeout too a abnormally large
value, which caused OverflowError in the timeout clean_up task, which,
in turn, prevented ironic-inspector from ever running node list sync
with ironic.

This change makes two corrections:
* The timeout configuration is limited to 10 years (0 can still be used
  to disable the timeout completely).
* Errors in the clean_up task do not prevent the node list sync from
  running.

Change-Id: Ie3ad29a4abb9ac58c41b776042f80dff6a9c72d2
Story: #2004807
Task: #28963
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent abnormal timeout values from breaking sync with ironic

I had a case when an operator set the timeout too a abnormally large
value, which caused OverflowError in the timeout clean_up task, which,
in turn, prevented ironic-inspector from ever running node list sync
with ironic.

This change makes two corrections:
* The timeout configuration is limited to 10 years (0 can still be used
  to disable the timeout completely).
* Errors in the clean_up task do not prevent the node list sync from
  running.

Change-Id: Ie3ad29a4abb9ac58c41b776042f80dff6a9c72d2
Story: #2004807
Task: #28963

[{'created': '2019-01-14 11:10:57.000000000', 'message': "Temporary solution for fixing gate test_tpool_size

This is a temporary solution to merge patches failing gate continiously
due to an unrelated test.
the test_tpool_size and test_default_tpool_size tests are basically
to check the config param 'backend_native_threads_pool_size' which
can be skipped temporarily.

Change-Id: I9dad0d45c3c4600a6567f34bb851b10a3f5d966b
Partial-Bug: #1811663
"}]
commit_message:
Temporary solution for fixing gate test_tpool_size

This is a temporary solution to merge patches failing gate continiously
due to an unrelated test.
the test_tpool_size and test_default_tpool_size tests are basically
to check the config param 'backend_native_threads_pool_size' which
can be skipped temporarily.

Change-Id: I9dad0d45c3c4600a6567f34bb851b10a3f5d966b
Partial-Bug: #1811663

Install ipmitool in the mistral_executor image

This package is needed by TripleO to run baremetal node discovery from
the undercloud.

Bug #1807159

commit_message:
Fix address for glusterfs container images

The `openshift_storage_glusterfs*_version` openshift-ansible variables
were removed in commit [1] as a way to specify the image tags to use.
Instead, the image URL needs to be fully specified in the
`openshift_storage_glusterfs*_image` variables to include the tags.

[1] https://github.com/openshift/openshift-ansible/commit/0be4b2565beb92c064917627863401af7dfb73d3

Change-Id: Ia68ff32008c154a644af88ef5d4da21b2b368526
Closes-Bug: #1805611

commit_message:
Fix a regression in generate_upper_constraints.sh

Commit 041c1795db9249b423622b21191cb88d22594451 has an issue that
prevents building IPA when requirements are not available locally.

Change-Id: I93d5fdb599315922f35a3caaf311b14d8a74a858
Story: #2004776
Task: #28901

commit_message:
Initiating Cinder Volume Manager with large number of volumes

This patch adds the option to split retrieved volumes and snapshots
by chunks during Volume Manager host initialization. Query results
will be obtained in batches from the database and not in one shot
to avoid extreme memory usage. Max number of volumes and snapshots
per batch is controlled by option init_host_max_objects_retrieval.
Option is disabled by default for backward compatibility.

To migrate any ConfKeyManager keys based on fixed_key to the currently
configured key manager Volume Manager will use special light-weight
object - VolumeMigration.

Change-Id: I4f22b532c7c22bcd9710954048effff36002106c

commit_message:
Use a single queue for update/upgrade

Use a single queue for update and upgrade ansible run to avoid
race while consuming both messages from the web wocket

Change-Id: I8b04c2a39d35f530467ddb5f2c4305c08cbc44f1
Closes-Bug: #1804812

commit_message:
Refactor some l3_dvr_db code

check_for_fip_and_create_agent_gw_port_on_host_if_not_exists()
and create_fip_agent_gw_port_if_not_exists() were logging
messages that didn't always make sense, cleaned it up.

Also removed some duplicated code that set the port MTU.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: Iea82cb9f5efb76599ed312fa960aea953e062588

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-01 22:41:37.000000000', 'message': "Avoid calling eventlet.event.Event.reset()

The eventlet maintainers have made it clear that calling reset() on an
Event is not recommended:

https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/715b2ced5239bbada84c06f488b9c8dda8180230

We don't really need to resend the event to wake up threads, because
Event.wait() will return immediately once the event has been sent. So
just rely on the internal _set flag to tell us whether we need to send
the event.

Change-Id: I466aa7cb64308e018598c3bb63a9d0cfbc833adc
"}, {'created': '2019-01-02 20:50:32.000000000', 'message': "Avoid calling eventlet.event.Event.reset()

The eventlet maintainers have made it clear that calling reset() on an
Event is not recommended:

https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/715b2ced5239bbada84c06f488b9c8dda8180230

We don't really need to resend the event to wake up threads, because
Event.wait() will return immediately once the event has been sent. So
just rely on the internal _set flag to tell us whether we need to send
the event.

Change-Id: I466aa7cb64308e018598c3bb63a9d0cfbc833adc
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid calling eventlet.event.Event.reset()

The eventlet maintainers have made it clear that calling reset() on an
Event is not recommended:

https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/715b2ced5239bbada84c06f488b9c8dda8180230

We don't really need to resend the event to wake up threads, because
Event.wait() will return immediately once the event has been sent. So
just rely on the internal _set flag to tell us whether we need to send
the event.

Change-Id: I466aa7cb64308e018598c3bb63a9d0cfbc833adc

commit_message:
Displays selectable ports in a tabular pop-up

This commit adds a new customizable Django/Horizon widget which displays
Select options as table without adding AngularJS components or new
custom JS code.

The widget is then used to display port information in the dialogs used
for port adding to, and removing from, Firewall Groups.

Change-Id: I9707179557919643d4432d8ed29f2c80e44e6af4
Closes-Bug: #1810391

commit_message:
Fix ansible lint errors

The gate is now using the last ansible-lint version (4.0.1) which have new
ids/tags and new rules. The old tags (ANSIBLE*) should remains backwardly
compatible but this patch is using the new ones.

This patch fixes all the lint issues.

Change-Id: Ic151f3e969b8e3729394fd477bb8341d1cb75fd7
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c08460c70754ee429c5ae5920be8b323070ad908)

commit_message:
Remove redundantly tested code

Remove code that is redundantly tested.

This should not be tested here but in puppet-oslo
where this logic resides.

If we keep this and we do changes in puppet-oslo we
will break these unit tests, this is something we need
to sort out for all modules.

Change-Id: I55684e165af02b7c4285075b8843eba1ef94824d

[{'created': '2019-01-16 17:28:07.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure libraries lint running with Bionic

* With [1] the libraries lint job fails because we
  try to use Puppet 6 on CentOS 7 so we need to move
  this job to Bionic, like we did with the module

commit_message:
Ensure libraries lint running with Bionic

See failures in [1].

* With [1] the libraries lint job fails because we
  try to use Puppet 6 on CentOS 7 so we need to move
  this job to Bionic, like we did with the module
  lint job.

* Remove unnecessary new lines because of generic cleanup

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/618920/

Change-Id: I4983744bf9143d7fee7a5380bade483f0c55c159

commit_message:

reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-08 03:53:16.000000000', 'message': "Dissuade .gitignore references to personal tools

Developers run all sorts of different tools within Git repositories,
any of which can leave their own special trashfiles all over the
place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to
recommend developers simply configure a global core.excludesfile to
filter the irrelevant files which tend to get created by their
personal choice of tools. Add a comment block explaining this, for
clarity, and remove the one current editor-specific entry present.

We can, and should of course, continue to list files created by the
tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks, documentation
and packaging builds, et cetera).

This change is a port of Ib58a57267b064e4142686de6c37a70dbff04b9a7
from the openstack-dev/cookiecutter repository.

Change-Id: Ifb58f6a5362d6d8177b6ef2a1def2b997153ca46
"}]
commit_message:
Dissuade .gitignore references to personal tools

Developers run all sorts of different tools within Git repositories,
any of which can leave their own special trashfiles all over the
place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to
recommend developers simply configure a global core.excludesfile to
filter the irrelevant files which tend to get created by their
personal choice of tools. Add a comment block explaining this, for
clarity, and remove the one current editor-specific entry present.

We can, and should of course, continue to list files created by the
tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks, documentation
and packaging builds, et cetera).

This change is a port of Ib58a57267b064e4142686de6c37a70dbff04b9a7
from the openstack-dev/cookiecutter repository.

Change-Id: Ifb58f6a5362d6d8177b6ef2a1def2b997153ca46

Change openstack-dev to openstack-discuss

Mailinglists have been updated. Openstack-discuss replaces openstack-dev.

[{'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-01-16 14:13:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-01-16 14:18:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

wrong updating'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-01-16 14:24:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-01-16 14:26:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

still working on this as per comments just now with ykarel so update incoming but want to see what happens with 'transport' as i can't quickly work out how/where the rest of those used {} vars in https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/d747625b82b28283e03b56e72b6cd90cf2b85e69/docker/services/nova-api.yaml#L223-L248 (like scheme hostname etc) so maybe transport is there otherwise will try with bash"}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-01-16 14:39:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> still working on this as per comments just now with ykarel so
 > update incoming but want to see what happens with 'transport' as i
 > can't quickly work out how/where the rest of those used {} vars in
 > https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/d747625b82b28283e03b56e72b6cd90cf2b85e69/docker/services/nova-api.yaml#L223-L248
 > (like scheme hostname etc) so maybe transport is there otherwise
 > will try with bash

Those come from https://docs.openstack.org/nova/rocky/user/cells.html#template-urls-in-cell-mappings . But there is an issue with nova-manage parsing the transport url. 

If we use {scheme} instead of rabbit, the validation in nova-manage fails as:

()[root@undercloud /]# su nova -s /bin/bash -c "/usr/bin/nova-manage cell_v2 create_cell --name=default --database_connection='{scheme}://{username}:{password}@{hostname}/nova?{query}' --transport-url='{scheme}://{username}:{password}@{hostname}:{port}/?{query}' --verbose"
Invalid transport URL: No scheme specified

Also nova-manage expects an int for the port, so using {port} fails as well:

()[root@undercloud /]# su nova -s /bin/bash -c "/usr/bin/nova-manage cell_v2 create_cell --name=default --database_connection='{scheme}://{username}:{password}@{hostname}/nova?{query}' --transport-url='rabbit://{username}:{password}@{hostname}:{port}/?{query}' --verbose"
Invalid transport URL: invalid literal for int() with base 10: '{port}'

So far I missed to file a bug against nova-manage or have a closer look at it to get this fixed. Thats why those parts are hard coded for the transport_url at the moment.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-01-16 14:46:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2019-01-16 14:48:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

 > --transport-url='rabbit://{username}:{password}@{hostname}:{port}/?{query}'

 > for the transport_url at the moment.

commit_message:
Fetch scheme/port from hiera instead of hard coding it

Looks like nit/forgotten in https://review.openstack.org/626177
Depends-On is so we can see the job run here missing nova in layout

Co-Authored-By: Yatin Karel <ykarel@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/631228
Change-Id: I4dbebcd3f3f530f21d3afc822084278136e58b4c
Closes-Bug: #1811004

subject: Fixes is_admin type from StrOpt to BoolOpt.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6722, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo(gcb)', 'email': 'guochbo@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'guochbo'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27954, 'name': 'Mois√©s Guimar√£es de Medeiros', 'email': 'guimaraes@pm.me', 'username': 'moguimar'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2019-01-03 15:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-01-03 16:01:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So this will handle "--is-admin True" the same as before? I don't know off the top of my head what the behavior of BoolOpts on the command-line is.'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2019-01-03 16:21:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2019-01-03 16:24:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

You're right Ben! I wasn't sure why I didn't change it to BoolOpt before, and that was because of the usage change. BoolOpt will behave as --is_admin and --nois_admin only."}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2019-01-03 16:25:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-01-03 16:57:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think everyone was generally in agreement that this would be a better way for this to work, but we do need to understand the implications of changing the behavior that way. It doesn't look like we have any positional arguments to this tool so at least it would fail-fast and not try to process the "True" as a different type of parameter.'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2019-01-07 16:28:08.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Workflow-1 by Mois√©s Guimar√£es <moguimar@redhat.com>
'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2019-01-07 16:28:10.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-1 by Mois√©s Guimar√£es <moguimar@redhat.com>
'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2019-01-07 16:29:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-01-09 21:00:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Was there further discussion about this?'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2019-01-11 12:24:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yes Ben, I talked to Juan Osorio and he is fine with the change.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-01-16 23:17:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Okay, let's do it then. We'll make this a major release to signal that it breaks backward compatibility."}, {'account_id': 11022, 'date': '2019-01-18 00:06:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-03 15:39:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes is_admin type from StrOpt to BoolOpt.

oslo.config already has a proper type to deal with boolean options.

Change-Id: I675c1dbfa13ca68506042f7907082b0e3d51672a
Signed-off-by: Mois√©s Guimar√£es de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fixes is_admin type from StrOpt to BoolOpt.

oslo.config already has a proper type to deal with boolean options.

Change-Id: I675c1dbfa13ca68506042f7907082b0e3d51672a
Signed-off-by: Mois√©s Guimar√£es de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove the split mistake

The format of target_portal is IP:PORT, it will never contain a ','.

Change-Id: I7b89586771a9d61052b4a65e2168b80ac40a69ea

[{'created': '2019-01-07 07:56:37.000000000', 'message': 'Run scenario009 on tripleo-deploy-openshift changes

The tripleo-deploy-openshift script is essential for openshift
deployments via tripleo. This should help prevent breaking scenario009

Change-Id: Ic0f9b746f49648450fe82b0773d8dd1ee009b152
'}]
commit_message:
Run scenario009 on tripleo-deploy-openshift changes

The tripleo-deploy-openshift script is essential for openshift
deployments via tripleo. This should help prevent breaking scenario009
by mistake while modifying `tripleo-deploy-openshift`.

Change-Id: Ic0f9b746f49648450fe82b0773d8dd1ee009b152

commit_message:
[Documentation] Must remove quickstart directory.

The quickstart directory must be remove before try to deploying. Use the
-X flag to automatically delete the directory.

Change-Id: I65eced4a56897ab4ca64f7f42bf981708eb60ab0
Closes-Bug: #1742149

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-18 16:34:40.000000000', 'message': 'VMAX driver doc - notification of fix on AFA OS upgrade issue

Workload support was dropped in PowerMax OS 5978. A fix has
been merged to Rocky to support a PowerMax OS 5878 upgrade
on a VMAX All Flash, so all functionality on existing OpenStack
Instances and Volumes created from VMAX All Flash storage, will
work as before.

Change-Id: I698367020d5f10900bb4f6347f21154254ee5bee
'}, {'created': '2019-01-09 14:34:11.000000000', 'message': 'VMAX driver doc - notification of fix on AFA OS upgrade issue

Workload support was dropped in PowerMax OS 5978. A fix has
been merged to Rocky to support a PowerMax OS 5878 upgrade
on a VMAX All Flash, so all functionality on existing OpenStack
Instances and Volumes created from VMAX All Flash storage, will
work as before. This is not an issue in the (not yet released)
Stein as the fix is in already in place, so does not need to be
documented.

Change-Id: I698367020d5f10900bb4f6347f21154254ee5bee
'}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver doc - notification of fix on AFA OS upgrade issue

Workload support was dropped in PowerMax OS 5978. A fix has
been merged to Rocky to support a PowerMax OS 5878 upgrade
on a VMAX All Flash, so all functionality on existing OpenStack
Instances and Volumes created from VMAX All Flash storage, will
work as before. This is not an issue in the (not yet released)
Stein as the fix is in already in place, so does not need to be
documented.

Change-Id: I698367020d5f10900bb4f6347f21154254ee5bee

commit_message:
Clean up the auto generated domain

During the federation test, when creating an identity provider, a
new domain will be created as well. This auto generated domain
should be cleaned up when test exit.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/628132/
Change-Id: I6dcd0a0154c8658585a98ae138825881fe51d664

[{'created': '2019-01-16 10:07:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fix incompatible version handling in BuildRequest

The BuildRequest object code assumed that IncompatibleObjectVersion
exception has a objver field that contains the object version. This
assumption is not true. The unit test made another mistake serializing
the function object obj_to_primitive instead of serializing the result
of the call of obj_to_primitive. This caused a false positive test
covering the error in the implementation as well.

Change-Id: I1ef4a23aa2bf5cb46b481045f3d968f62f74606d

The BuildRequest object code assumed that IncompatibleObjectVersion
exception has a objver field that contains the object version. This
assumption is not true. The unit test made another mistake serializing
the function object obj_to_primitive instead of serializing the result

Change-Id: I1ef4a23aa2bf5cb46b481045f3d968f62f74606d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incompatible version handling in BuildRequest

The BuildRequest object code assumed that IncompatibleObjectVersion
exception has a objver field that contains the object version. This
assumption is not true. The unit test made another mistake serializing
the function object obj_to_primitive instead of serializing the result
of the call of obj_to_primitive. This caused a false positive test
covering the error in the implementation as well.

Closes-Bug: #1812177

Change-Id: I1ef4a23aa2bf5cb46b481045f3d968f62f74606d

commit_message:
add xenial check jobs for z3

Now that we are running tempest jobs on bionic,
we use an additional minimal xenial job to test z3
because the z3 github currently do not offer precompiled
binary for bionic.

Change-Id: Ibe74ad66932e163e5ca5288daf1f19fedb2094bb

commit_message:
Add base_package_type

Currently in all the Dockerfile.j2 files, we are doing base distro if
conditions for package names when installing via a binary.  Rather than
duplicating these base_distro in [<distros>], let's provide a single
value for determining the binary installation method. This change adds a
base_package_type which we can use to lookup if 'rpm' or if 'deb' rather
than relying on specific distro names.

Change-Id: I8a0c6c8fbc32a8cfa6932fddf28a449fceda3d49

[Configuration] Add missing py37 and corrected default envlist.

Change order of default tox envlist in order of likeliness to fail on a
new change and add py37 and py36.

commit_message:
Stop installing octavia-amphora-image package

With containerized undercloud deployments, the octavia-amphora-image RPM
can no longer be installed in RHOSP-based environments as the playbook
runs in mistral_engine container and the syum repository list within it
is empty. This patch, together with the dependent change, fix that
issue.

Closes-Bug: #1800916

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614609/
Change-Id: Icae47e76f71b739cf0e1f5633b15432fd531e645
(cherry picked from commit f9389e32b11e15d119afee1e4c3544076371167d)

commit_message:
Remove registered limit policies from policy.v3cloudsample.json

By incorporating system-scope and default roles, we've effectively
made these policies obsolete. We can simplify what we maintain and
provide a more consistent, unified view of default registered limit
behavior by removing them.

Change-Id: I1ee7fb53a71361966584363687051615dc832329
Related-Bug: 1805880

commit_message:
Add tests for project users interacting with registered limits

This commit introduces some tests that explicitly show how project
users are expected to behave with the registered limits API. A
subsequent patch will clean up the now obsolete policies in the
policy.v3cloudsample.json policy file.

Related-Bug: 1805880

Change-Id: I66c1d1273dae98f32802de244eb220bf998f9070

commit_message:
Additional Selenium tests for Kibana dashboard

This helps verify Kibana is working properly by using
Selenium Webdriver to navigate to different index dashboards
and takes screenshot of each one. It also add the scripts to
the gates for single and multinode deployments.

Change-Id: Ic2c91734d1eaac0ea4e7985bf69082942166715d

commit_message:
Fix the child search logic during zone deletion.

This patch uses elevated context to look up the child zones
when a (parent) zone is deleted. If policy allows deleting a
zone with non-admin role - the search will not find the child
zones in another tenant and therefore parent zone gets deleted.

Change-Id: Id1a8228f287a8f8e02462017cd062607ff4bebf8
Closes-Bug: 1809906

commit_message:
[Configuration] Update min tox version.

The commands used by constraits need at least tox 2.0, update to reflect
reality, which should help with local running constraints targets.

Change-Id: Ib4d4ef78f06c37c6f5615b77581cc9eeaa86abc5

commit_message:
Add AdditionalArchitectures when configured

With a heat based deploy we need to add AdditionalArchitectures to the
environment so that consumers can do the right thing when needed.

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/616362
Change-Id: I173f3991cda24cd77ccba8a4cfb60c128ecfa3a4
(cherry picked from commit b3b45efc2b75a49ddfc0eea48f5fb2986a7d7a53)

commit_message:
venv: use inventory_hostname instead of ansible_hostname

It is possible that the hostname of the system does not match the
one in the inventory which means that the delegate_to or the
comparision to inventory_hostname will fail in the tasks later.

Change-Id: If6043cd2c579ab844f29d5a9e2a1752741e90689

commit_message:
Add mnaio_data_disk_suffix var to support NVMe partition naming

NVMe partitions generally show a `p` before the partition number,
causing the existing data disk partitioning script to fail. The
new var support changing the suffix to support alternative naming
schemes. The default remains '1' for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I7c0039ee13ba301c152424fc0b327195ec6a4367

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-17 00:31:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix manilaclient shell exception handling

The BaseException class no longer has a "message"
attribute in python 3 [1]. On the contrary, the
string representation of an Exception object will
always print all the exception args.

Change-Id: Ifb0725a057922367aaf1d5c72d0a22107e7bbb8e
'}, {'created': '2019-01-17 00:33:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix manilaclient shell exception handling

The BaseException class no longer has a "message"
attribute in python 3 [1]. On the contrary, the
string representation of an Exception object will
print all the exception args in python2 and python3.

[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/#transition-plan
Change-Id: Ifb0725a057922367aaf1d5c72d0a22107e7bbb8e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix manilaclient shell exception handling

The BaseException class no longer has a "message"
attribute in python 3 [1]. On the contrary, the
string representation of an Exception object will
print all the exception args in python2 and python3.

[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/#transition-plan
Change-Id: Ifb0725a057922367aaf1d5c72d0a22107e7bbb8e

commit_message:
Set container images for openshift 3.11

Wire in the new openshift 3.11 images with tripleo, so that any
customization applied either via heat param with the integrated image
preparation workflow gets passed to openshift-ansible.

Depends-On: Ibbd5ff9d3597f5add440b92a27a2f2f669f7bdbe
Co-Authored-By: Martin Andr√© <m.andre@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2cb6eac9136f4c24bfc2881ff0aa1ddec7a35fe4

[{'created': '2018-12-04 17:14:21.000000000', 'message': 'Remove openshift-ansible customization

This commit remove variables passed to openshift-ansible in order to
stay more inline with openshift-ansible defaults.

The removed variables are:
- `openshift_enable_excluders`: use default value from
  openshift-ansible.
- `openshift_use_dnsmasq`: removed from openshift-ansible.
- `openshift_docker_selinux_enabled`: use default value from
  openshift-ansible.
- `containerized`: removed from openshift-ansible.
- `skip_version`: removed from openshift-ansible.
- `debug_level`: use default value from openshift-ansible.
- `osm_controller_args`: use default value from openshift-ansible. The
  provided experimental-cluster-signing-duration setting had an
  extremely low period and could cause nodes to become unreachable in
  the event of cert renewal during the master node failover. See [1] for
  details.

Closes-Bug: #1806726
Change-Id: I4d9ae4f4745393aa817f07a542f06faa0c6a5eb9
'}]
commit_message:
Remove openshift-ansible customization

This commit remove variables passed to openshift-ansible in order to
stay more inline with openshift-ansible defaults.

The removed variables are:
- `openshift_enable_excluders`: use default value from
  openshift-ansible.
- `openshift_use_dnsmasq`: removed from openshift-ansible.
- `openshift_docker_selinux_enabled`: use default value from
  openshift-ansible.
- `containerized`: removed from openshift-ansible.
- `skip_version`: removed from openshift-ansible.
- `debug_level`: use default value from openshift-ansible.
- `osm_controller_args`: use default value from openshift-ansible. The
  provided experimental-cluster-signing-duration setting had an
  extremely low period and could cause nodes to become unreachable in
  the event of cert renewal during the master node failover. See [1] for
  details.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1648493

Closes-Bug: #1806726
Change-Id: I4d9ae4f4745393aa817f07a542f06faa0c6a5eb9

commit_message:
Rely on osa defaults for enabled services

Tripleo should rely on openshift-ansible defaults as much as possible,
especially concerning the services which are enabled.

This removes the setting that explicitly disabled the service catalog
and template service broker, and wire in the ansible-service-broker
from heat parameters. The service-catalog and template-service-broker
images do not need to be specified since they're derived from the
oreg_url in openshift-ansible.

Change-Id: Ie09696a54ba01f23003366a9f221d2f32f4b0270
Depends-On: Ic358ed27d63015d297f50c10f553fc1c470ea6a5
Closes-Bug: #1806353

commit_message:
Added Barbican option BarbicanPkcs11AlwaysSetCkaSensitive

Added support for setting the Barbican option
always_set_cka_sensitive.  The option defaults to true as
needed by Safenet HSMs.  It is set to false in the ATOS
and Thales HSM environments.

Change-Id: If3fa975e8243dfe30ef67ec81db891943a94a9d5
Story: 2004734

commit_message:
Let the operator manage openshift updates and upgrades

This remove the upgrade code to ensure that TripleO will not get
involved in the business of updating and upgrading OpenShift clusters
as it currently involved manual steps for clusters using glusterfs.

Instead, the operator is invited to upgrade OpenShift separately from
TripleO and follow the OpenShift upgrade documentation.

[1] https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/3.11/upgrading/automated_upgrades.html#special-considerations-for-glusterfs
[2] https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/3.11/upgrading/automated_upgrades.html

Change-Id: I6033525cde40fd44d648cef792efbca6901e88f0
Closes-Bug: #1810812
(cherry picked from commit 97cf1c274a9849e0b1dc84500ca8dae6414a1b83)

file that performs the docker service installation and configuration.

commit_message:
flatten sahara service configuration

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration.

With this patch the baremetal version of sahara services has been removed.

Change-Id: I5a555155c881e0e92acc3ebba7b844abdd686e6e
Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening

commit_message:
Run all linters via pre-commit

Executes all linters via pre-commit, which is much faster, guarantees
their version locking and allows upgrading them with a single command.

Before this change the only linter running via pre-commit was
ansible-lint.

Now we also run bashate, flake8 and yamllint via pre-commit.

For developer convenience we still keep the old tox environments
which allow running a single linter.

Change-Id: Ia0737c50de0f01de8576089d72de8940c16e9e0e

commit_message:
Recover CI run detection in imagebuild

The new zuul jobs use just /opt/stack instead of /opt/stack/new,
breaking the constraints handling and using dependencies from source.
This changes corrects it by accepting both directories.

Change-Id: I8d6f8c99e1ab5f26e3537630d0f6086e02a2b1ec

messages:
[{'account_id': 29402, 'date': '2018-11-01 21:18:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-11-01 21:18:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Create windmill-ops project

This repo will be used to hold additional scripts / playbooks to help
with the operation of windmill.  This is based on the same idea the
OpenStack Ansible ops team.

commit_message:
Fix CKM_AES_GCM encryption

This patch fixes a parameter mismatch bug when using the CKM_AES_GCM
mechanism.  This bug also renames the 'generate_iv' option to
'aes_gcm_generate_iv' to reflect the fact that it only applies to
the CKM_AES_GCM mechanism since IVs will always be generated when
using CKM_AES_CBC.

Change-Id: Iaa94b5cf2b2f77aaed72ec6b8b11e5ccf1fc3cca

[{'created': '2019-01-17 01:42:45.000000000', 'message': "Nagios: Update logging, remove hostPath

This updates the Nagios chart configuration to not use syslog for
logging, removes the logging of notifications, and drastically
increases the number of concurrent checks executed.

This also removes the hostPath for Nagios logs, as it seems to add
no value over what's already reported to the console.  Finally, as
Nagios's log file has the potential to grow very rapidly while the
service has no means to disable logging to disk, this adds a side
car container that very simply redirects the no-op command to the
nagios log file defined in its configuration

commit_message:
Nagios: Update logging, add readiness probe

This updates the Nagios chart configuration to not use syslog for
logging, removes the logging of notifications, and drastically
increases the number of concurrent checks executed.

This also removes the hostPath for Nagios logs, as it seems to add
no value over what's already reported to the console.  Finally, as
Nagios's log file has the potential to grow very rapidly while the
service has no means to disable logging to disk, this adds a
readiness probe that both checks whether Nagios's endpoint is
being served and clears out the log file by redirecting the
no-op commands output to the nagios log file.

Change-Id: I81151c48ef4e0b7877f595c271f55b8fd479e8c1

commit_message:
Build translated docs

openstackdocstheme 1.28.0 includes a script to build English and
translated documents together, use this for building docs.

Require the new openstackdocstheme version.

Change-Id: If4102ec42ee7f58cff5da46ee326833471520412

commit_message:
Move v3 project negative tests to work w/ pre-prov

I don't see any limitations by using pre-provisioned
credentials for these tests:

* test_list_projects_by_unauthorized_user
* test_project_create_duplicate
* test_create_project_by_unauthorized_user
* test_create_project_with_empty_name
* test_create_projects_name_length_over_64
* test_project_delete_by_unauthorized_user
* test_delete_non_existent_project

Note that these tests aren't interop tests [0] so can
be safely moved.

[0] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=admin.v3.test_projects_negative&i=nope&files=&repos=interop

Change-Id: Ibd3bd7ff57dfdd380c2ff0cc9156f3c359c7af01

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-22 08:46:52.000000000', 'message': 'Send context.global_id on neutron calls

In I866b8c6593c76c089da6bed55cf863ac556c9a8e nova sends global_id
on neutron calls, but in I41724a612a5f3eabd504f3eaa9d2f9d141ca3f69
it changed to global_request_id which may be None.

Change-Id: Iaa47304755db66a834dde38dcd55cc259c1008a3
'}, {'created': '2018-12-28 02:44:54.000000000', 'message': 'Send context.global_id on neutron calls

In I866b8c6593c76c089da6bed55cf863ac556c9a8e nova sends global_id
on neutron calls, but in I41724a612a5f3eabd504f3eaa9d2f9d141ca3f69
it changed to global_request_id which may be None.

Closes-Bug:#1809943

Change-Id: Iaa47304755db66a834dde38dcd55cc259c1008a3
'}, {'created': '2019-01-15 16:58:03.000000000', 'message': 'Send context.global_id on neutron calls

In I866b8c6593c76c089da6bed55cf863ac556c9a8e nova sends global_id
on neutron calls, but in I41724a612a5f3eabd504f3eaa9d2f9d141ca3f69
it changed to global_request_id which may be None.

A simple unit test wrinkle is added to avoid future regressions.

Closes-Bug:#1809943

Change-Id: Iaa47304755db66a834dde38dcd55cc259c1008a3
'}, {'created': '2019-01-16 02:57:07.000000000', 'message': 'Send context.global_id on neutron calls

In I866b8c6593c76c089da6bed55cf863ac556c9a8e nova sends global_id
on neutron calls, but in I41724a612a5f3eabd504f3eaa9d2f9d141ca3f69
it changed to global_request_id which may be None.

A simple unit test wrinkle is added to avoid future regressions.

Closes-Bug:#1809943

Change-Id: Iaa47304755db66a834dde38dcd55cc259c1008a3
'}]
commit_message:
Send context.global_id on neutron calls

In I866b8c6593c76c089da6bed55cf863ac556c9a8e nova sends global_id
on neutron calls, but in I41724a612a5f3eabd504f3eaa9d2f9d141ca3f69
it changed to global_request_id which may be None.

A simple unit test wrinkle is added to avoid future regressions.

Closes-Bug:#1809943

Change-Id: Iaa47304755db66a834dde38dcd55cc259c1008a3

In commit 4cb7a225297e804fb00c037904142dea9262475b we changed
to set the DeployIndentifier to ''. This looks like an incorrect
change. It would set the DeployIdentifier to '' (from the existing
unique value), if  --skip_deploy_identifier is used and this would

"}]
commit_message:
Use existing stack parameter for DeployIdentifier

In commit 4cb7a225297e804fb00c037904142dea9262475b we changed
to set the DeployIndentifier to ''. This looks like an incorrect
change. It would set the DeployIdentifier to '' (from the existing
unique value), if  --skip_deploy_identifier is used and this would
result in deployments applied on nodes, whereas we want exactly
the opposite. This checks the existing value in the stack for an
update.

Conflicts:
	tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py
	tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_update/test_overcloud_update.py
	tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_upgrade/test_overcloud_upgrade.py

Change-Id: Idd4178aa06aba5668dec6d8ba0427f57dfe5b5b6
Related-Bug: #1759326
(cherry picked from commit d550c19485efa388950288faaecf821a1b210138)

commit_message:
Pass the python interpreter to the play command directly

Ansible doesn't take into account any 'ANSIBLE_PYTHON_INTERPRETER' env
var, as per this comment[1] back in 2016.

We hence have to pass it as an extra variable directly in the command.

This patch corrects I0600218163269409ae35ca34ffdfedb57926424e in
order to ensure we do pass the python interpreter value correctly.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/6345#issuecomment-181981760

Change-Id: I48c8c532b23b9422406168cecdc9aebfe8f45651
Blueprint: python-3

commit_message:
Remove become and become_user from include_role

In new Ansible releases the become and become_user are not valid
options for include_role.
In Ansible 2.7 they are being ignored but for Ansible 2.8 they will
raise errors:
ERROR! 'become' is not a valid attribute for a IncludeRole
ERROR! 'become_user' is not a valid attribute for a IncludeRole

Change-Id: I0eb1c1713d9c3e2a5acb89f6606281a9ceb774fc

commit_message:
Fix download of ahuffman.resolv

We currently request v1.2, but this is no longer available to download
and causes a 404 error. Moving to the latest version of 1.3.1 seems to
get over this bump. The lack of "v" in the version is required, I
presume due to the recent ansible galaxy changes.

Change-Id: I29a6b8dc7d0759e43b1a64f4d6ab835687d0ab10

commit_message:
PowerMax driver - rebranding VMAX to PowerMax

PowerMax is to replace VMAX in release notes, online documentation,
directory structure and driver name.

Implements: blueprint vmax-powermax-rebrand

Change-Id: I74f690b60aac6d0d4bf49d25b04a067c7993bfc7

subject: Add release-notes-jobs-python3 job
messages:
[{'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-11-19 08:03:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-11-19 23:15:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Since this doesn't seem to have triggered the reno job, I pushed [1] to make sure it works.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/618904"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-11-19 23:58:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

The testing patch indeed runs the reno job. It outputs some weirdness - e.g. the version number at the top is 0.0.0 [1]. Also I think we've already said we don't want the rocky renos showing up in 'latest series', but aren't sure how to make that fly. But I reckon that's problems for (an)other patch(es).

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/04/618904/1/check/build-openstack-releasenotes/f06a92b/html/unreleased.html"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-11-20 18:01:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm unsure whether we want to be publishing release notes yet (which this job will do) because we currently have releases notes going back pre-stein and I think we decided we'd start with a limited set.

So though this looks fine and exactly what we want at some point we may want to put a procedural -2 on it until we know want to publish.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-11-20 19:58:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Chris, I agree. I thought we would merge this as a step in the right direction and fix that other stuff later, but we don't want to miss the release boundary and have indelible permanent weird/wrong stein release notes. So yes, please -2 this until we've prepared fixy patches on top of it to make the release notes show up properly. (And we still need to figure out what we want that to look like and how to do it.)"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-11-20 20:03:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Putting a procedural block on this because we don't yet want to be publishing release notes until we have figured out which of the existing release notes we want to publish and have some for a "release" whatever we define that to be.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-01-16 19:13:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-01-16 19:15:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Taking the -2 off this because we now have a strategy for which release notes to use. I've also resolved the merge conflict.

I've done the dependency handling as a Depends-On instead of a stack because both work and this was easier in the context I was in."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-01-16 19:19:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Note that this change won't trigger the release notes because no release notes are added, see the follow up"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-01-16 20:04:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Works - see test results in fup patch [1].

Confirm we agreed to cut the release notes to stein+, which the dep does correctly.

I think this is good to go now.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/04/618904/2/check/build-openstack-releasenotes/57a4151/html/unreleased.html'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-01-17 14:23:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 23640, 'date': '2019-01-17 14:35:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}]

[{'created': '2019-01-16 19:11:01.000000000', 'message': 'Trim the release notes to just stein/master

This removes all the releasenotes related to changes already released
with nova in rocky and prior. They were carried over into placement
as we weren't sure how we were going to manage release notes. In
a meeting it was decided that we would start the release notes fresh
with "since-extraction".

Therefore this change removes all the releasenotes that are already
present in nova, keeping anything new.

The index.rst file is already set to say "look at nova" for older
release notes.

Change-Id: If9255212acf21ed69abbed0601c783ad01133f72
'}]
commit_message:
Trim the release notes to just stein/master

This removes all the releasenotes related to changes already released
with nova in rocky and prior. They were carried over into placement
as we weren't sure how we were going to manage release notes. In
a meeting it was decided that we would start the release notes fresh
with "since-extraction".

Therefore this change removes all the releasenotes that are already
present in nova, keeping anything new.

The index.rst file is already set to say "look at nova" for older
release notes.

Change-Id: If9255212acf21ed69abbed0601c783ad01133f72

commit_message:
Move v3 identity endpoint group tests to work w/ pre-prov

I don't see any limitations by using pre-provisioned
credentials for these tests:

* test_create_list_show_check_delete_endpoint_group
* test_update_endpoint_group

Note that these tests aren't interop tests [0] so can
be safely moved.

[0] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=admin.v3.test_endpoint_groups&i=nope&files=&repos=interop

Change-Id: I2638348989ecdda14a88b0f8817ff42a1a6c9e77

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-15 22:59:19.000000000', 'message': 'Add rpm_distro_python3 option

As we add support for python3 on RHEL based systems, we need to add a
flag to key off of in the Dockerfiles to swap out the python3 package
names.

Change-Id: I4028991bad92c0e8e21066cc4173c06ce5eba393
Related-Blueprint: python3-support
'}, {'created': '2019-01-16 15:27:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add distro_python3 option

As we add support for python3 on RHEL based systems, we need to add a
flag to key off of in the Dockerfiles to swap out the python3 package
names.  This change adds a distro_python3 configuration option that can
be defined to force python3 or python2 package names.  If this option
is not provided, we set this to True for RHEL 8 based distros and false
for other distros.

Change-Id: I4028991bad92c0e8e21066cc4173c06ce5eba393
Related-Blueprint: python3-support
'}]
commit_message:
Add distro_python3 option

As we add support for python3 on RHEL based systems, we need to add a
flag to key off of in the Dockerfiles to swap out the python3 package
names.  This change adds a distro_python3 configuration option that can
be defined to force python3 or python2 package names.  If this option
is not provided, we set this to True for RHEL 8 based distros and false
for other distros.

Change-Id: I4028991bad92c0e8e21066cc4173c06ce5eba393
Related-Blueprint: python3-support

Thanks for getting this done so quickly'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-10-15 02:12:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

zun-compute on my devstack does not start due to failure on authentication to rabbitmq. http://paste.openstack.org/show/732140/
so I could not check any patches for now. however other reviewers could check this working, I'd like to merge this patch."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-10-15 02:28:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> zun-compute on my devstack does not start due to failure on
 > authentication to rabbitmq. http://paste.openstack.org/show/732140/
 > so I could not check any patches for now. however other reviewers
 > could check this working, I'd like to merge this patch.

Thanks @Shu. I added @Jiwei and @Shengqin as reviewers. There is a recent fix on the rabbitmq config: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609905/ , which might resolve the issue you are facing."}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-10-15 02:33:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks @Hongbin. I found the patch fixing about rabbitmq. I tend to forget to run `git pull` for devstack, and I'm trying to start devstack again. Sorry. (*Ôæâœâ„Éª*)ÔæÉÔæç"}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-10-15 03:11:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I pulled recent devstack and confirmed zun has the mentioned patch, but I got same error. Do I need change any configuration?'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-10-15 04:13:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I pulled recent devstack and confirmed zun has the mentioned patch,
 > but I got same error. Do I need change any configuration?

@Shu,

Possibly. If you check out /etc/zun/zun.conf and ensure the following:

* [DEFAULT]transport_url is set (e.g. http://logs.openstack.org/05/609905/1/check/zun-tempest-docker-sql/867e0b9/controller/logs/etc/zun/zun_conf.txt.gz)
* The legacy config [oslo_messaging_rabbit]rabbit_host , [oslo_messaging_rabbit]rabbit_password , [oslo_messaging_rabbit]rabbit_userid are removed.
* Restart the zun processes'}, {'account_id': 16352, 'date': '2018-10-15 05:23:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks @Hongbin! I could start devstack (removing /opt/stack/zun once) and this patch works fine! ;)'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2019-01-17 16:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 45f7b3d69d293b92dba56700e785bd9908ba25a1'}]

commit_message:
Split command into list

The 'command' parameter has changed from string to list [1].
This patch updates the UI to catch this up.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580990/

Change-Id: I60bdd84c22ba14e0646593a9747c5251e0dd46ff
Closes-Bug: #1797285

commit_message:
Enable the image signature verification feature

The rationale behind this change is to allow the use of the glance image
signature verification feature.
In order to do so, it is necessary to:
* Add the [barbican] section to `/etc/glance/glance-api.conf` with
keystone endpoint

Change-Id: I1ec0864b0a4ad6381532032830ac4948b74f7771
Closes-Bug: 1811067

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-16 19:36:42.000000000', 'message': 'Handle root vHost declaration

If the source chart does not declare a vHost value, or uses the value of
"/", the script would fail upon trying to declare the vhost. This change
avoids the declaration of the "/" vhost, and continues with setting the
specified user with permissions to "/"

Change-Id: I28619c0aef22049c632c92a2f9a9d3831f8c284c
'}]
commit_message:
Handle root vHost declaration

If the source chart does not declare a vHost value, or uses the value of
"/", the script would fail upon trying to declare the vhost. This change
avoids the declaration of the "/" vhost, and continues with setting the
specified user with permissions to "/"

Change-Id: I28619c0aef22049c632c92a2f9a9d3831f8c284c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-16 14:28:51.000000000', 'message': 'Added the `-e` parameter to the featureset049 for ceph templates

The `-e` parameter is required to allow the overcloud-deploy playbook task to
build correctly the *extra_args* string. That string is then used by the j2 template
that builds the `overcloud deploy` command (inside the overcloud-deploy.sh script)
adding the ceph templates.

Change-Id: Ibceff58e86cc4ed339eb7e4389ade78a3c161e22
Closes-Bug: #1812006
Signed-off-by: Francesco Pantano (fmount) <fpantano@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Added the `-e` parameter to the featureset049 for ceph templates

The `-e` parameter is required to allow the overcloud-deploy playbook task to
build correctly the *extra_args* string. That string is then used by the j2 template
that builds the `overcloud deploy` command (inside the overcloud-deploy.sh script)
adding the ceph templates.

Change-Id: Ibceff58e86cc4ed339eb7e4389ade78a3c161e22
Closes-Bug: #1812006
Signed-off-by: Francesco Pantano (fmount) <fpantano@redhat.com>
