subject: Removed more reliance on CDNs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 964, 'name': 'Anne Gentle', 'email': 'annegentle@justwriteclick.com', 'username': 'annegentle'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 10607, 'name': 'Alexandra Settle', 'email': 'a.settle@outlook.com', 'username': 'asettle'}, {'_account_id': 12826, 'name': 'Rob Cresswell', 'display_name': 'robcresswell', 'email': 'robert.cresswell@outlook.com', 'username': 'rob-cresswell'}, {'_account_id': 20156, 'name': 'Petr Kovar', 'email': 'pkovar@redhat.com', 'username': 'pmkovar'}, {'_account_id': 22314, 'name': 'Ryan Selden', 'email': 'seldenr@icloud.com', 'username': 'seldenr'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 22314, 'date': '2016-07-08 17:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2016-07-08 18:01:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

We put these files into each manual that we upload - and for some in each version. So, that's a lot of files to put onto our servers.

How much is this increasing for a single manual? How much for all of newton?"}, {'account_id': 22314, 'date': '2016-07-08 18:13:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Andreas,
It only actually ends up adding about 1MB. I think it's an ok tradeoff considering that we can get rid of all CDN use and any potential google conflicts. What are your thoughts?
Thanks
Ryan"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2016-07-08 18:22:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

so, 1 MB for each manual - how many manuals do we currently have up using the theme?

I would rather make this configurable or leave it as is.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-07-08 18:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-openstackdocstheme-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/47/339747/1/check/gate-openstackdocstheme-pep8/bddcc96/ : SUCCESS in 2m 12s
- gate-openstackdocstheme-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/47/339747/1/check/gate-openstackdocstheme-docs/f7418df//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 27s'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2016-07-10 13:27:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Agreed, 1 MB per manual when we have draft uploads 50+ times daily isn't a solution here. I'd like these to be configurable."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2016-07-10 17:42:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This significantly increases data to upload after each build and store. Make it configurable and default should be cdn usage.'}, {'account_id': 22314, 'date': '2016-07-11 17:25:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok - will do. Where can that configuration value go? Also what script would then go and download the dependencies when it was configured to build offline? I have a general idea of how sphinx templating and Jinja work, but I'm having trouble fitting it in with tox.
Thanks for your help!"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2016-07-11 17:28:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I don't know what is the best way, I can think of two:
* have a variable that says "use-cdn" and only copies files over if it's true (default is true). So, that for each guide, a packager needs to change that.
* have a build option when building the package that does not use CDN. This would be more easy for packagers since it's one place to change.'}, {'account_id': 22314, 'date': '2016-07-11 17:34:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes that's exactly what I was thinking - I'm just not exactly sure where to put that so that an end user can use a command line option instead of having to edit some file manually."}, {'account_id': 22314, 'date': '2016-07-11 17:36:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

We could pass a variable through to sphinx build (see link), but then we'd need a script somewhere to copy over if the option is selected.
That's my question - where to put this option in the tox workflow so that it gets to the right places
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27381997/get-variables-in-sphinx-templates"}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2016-07-15 21:11:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Andreas, do you know the answer to Ryan's question? Or should we ask Doug Hellman?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-11-24 01:30:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 12826, 'date': '2017-07-21 10:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This a potential alternative for the font handling:  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/486087/'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 02:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-01-17 09:01:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Petr or Doug - I think we should close this.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-01-17 16:03:22.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Stale review - let's abandon."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2016-07-08 17:47:34.000000000', 'message': 'Removed more reliance on CDNs

* Downloaded all OpenSans google fonts references

* (Using localfont, a tool for doing so)

* Downloaded html5shiv.js and respond.js for IE

* Used not minified versions of both

This also helps to qualm concerns over google
references that provide potential outlets for
unwanted tracking. GoogleFonts API is now
not used with CDN.

Change-Id: Icf272dbd3f0793e692e4510e4ad97b1a8160199c
Closes-Bug: #1523521
Related-Bug: #1523524
Partial-Bug: #1502806
'}]
commit_message:
Removed more reliance on CDNs

* Downloaded all OpenSans google fonts references

* (Using localfont, a tool for doing so)

* Downloaded html5shiv.js and respond.js for IE

* Used not minified versions of both

This also helps to qualm concerns over google
references that provide potential outlets for
unwanted tracking. GoogleFonts API is now
not used with CDN.

Change-Id: Icf272dbd3f0793e692e4510e4ad97b1a8160199c
Closes-Bug: #1523521
Related-Bug: #1523524
Partial-Bug: #1502806

Generalize prometheus datasource

Mapping Prometheus alerts into Vitrage entities using
config file 'prometheus_conf.yaml'.

Note: Documentation will be followed in the next commit.

Story: 2004682
Task: 28681

commit_message:
Apply workaround to host_info serialization test

Random failures started appearing in the gate with the following
pattern:

    testtools.matchers._impl.MismatchError: !=:
    reference = HostInfo(plugin_info=[HostPluginInfo,HostPluginInfo])
    actual    = HostInfo(plugin_info=[HostPluginInfo,HostPluginInfo])

This change attempts to work around the issue by adopting the same
workaround as implemented in the VIF tests.

Note that the host_info class is currently largely stub code for an
unimplemented negotiation interface.

Change-Id: I1fff71ec6793e009cbee9da0656b77915591dec4
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>

This patch adds more explanations for the lock action
in the Compute API reference and the Compute API guide.

subject: Do leader election with region-aware etcd path
messages:
[{'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2019-01-07 16:19:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2019-01-15 17:18:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 19461, 'date': '2019-01-16 11:48:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Just wondering what happens when the old master's key gets overwritten, will the overwrite then expire due to the old master's lease?"}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2019-01-16 17:33:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Just wondering what happens when the old master's key gets overwritten, will the overwrite then expire due to the old master's lease?

That's OK, because writing a key includes the applicable lease ID, so that will become the uplevel master's lease.  The old master's lease then becomes irrelevant."}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2019-01-17 12:20:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2019-01-17 12:52:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 19461, 'date': '2019-01-17 13:32:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2019-01-17 13:37:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2019-01-17 14:33:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
DHCP agent reads subnet info from both old and new paths

As part of this change, also demote a lot of INFO log spam generated by
the DHCP agent watching etcd.  With two subtrees being watched that
would be twice the spam, and we shouldn't really even have the first lot
of it.

Change-Id: I2259b707b5a33b4f2163da04d9f06da749ff6853

commit_message:
Add default case.

Add default case in switch:
default:
    position = {top: pos.top + pos.height, left: pos.left + pos.width / 2 - targetWidth / 2};
    break;
In case of 'placement' is not in other cases.

Change-Id: I60ce30ab9f6dcea47588a6efb888960279a04e50

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-17 13:57:01.000000000', 'message': 'Migrate away from oslo_i18n.enable_lazy()

The method is known to be problematic, and it is going to be
deprecated:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2018-November/016139.html

Moreover, its usage in Sahara produces some nasty side-effects
when Python 3.x is used. The provisioning of the clusters ends
abruptly when sahara-engine tries to update the status in the
database, with a failure inside oslo_i18n.

Change-Id: I19b5b25d1afa8daaad372b7a89b1c2c7f01785a0
'}, {'created': '2019-01-17 14:12:59.000000000', 'message': 'Migrate away from oslo_i18n.enable_lazy()

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2018-November/016139.html

Moreover, its usage in Sahara produces some nasty side-effects

abruptly when sahara-engine tries to update the status in the
database, with a failure inside oslo_i18n.

Change-Id: I19b5b25d1afa8daaad372b7a89b1c2c7f01785a0

commit_message:
Migrate away from oslo_i18n.enable_lazy()

The method is known to be problematic, and it is going to be
deprecated:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2018-November/016139.html

Moreover, its usage in Sahara produces some nasty side-effects
when Python 3.x is used. The provisioning of the clusters ends
abruptly when sahara-engine tries to update the status in the
database, with a failure inside oslo_i18n.

Change-Id: I19b5b25d1afa8daaad372b7a89b1c2c7f01785a0

commit_message:
Backporting two mutually dependent commits to fix CI

Fix download of ahuffman.resolv

We currently request v1.2, but this is no longer available to download
and causes a 404 error. Moving to the latest version of 1.3.1 seems to
get over this bump. The lack of "v" in the version is required, I
presume due to the recent ansible galaxy changes.

Previous change ID: I29a6b8dc7d0759e43b1a64f4d6ab835687d0ab10

Use kolla variable to set inspector DHCP config

Fixes an issue with ironic prechecks, which now require
ironic_dnsmasq_dhcp_range to be set when ironic is enabled.

Change-Id: I0b2e094904772fc6e14f1916e20ef207161ec001
(cherry picked from commit 5782bbc6ef66ad2d8efcebecf16192089dcd9b1a)

commit_message:
Support specifying a subnet for NIC

This may be required in case of routed networks as an alternative
to specifying a fixed_ip.

Change-Id: I8187f950cb961f60131af8b07fb54eee69019dbc

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-16 12:45:38.000000000', 'message': "Explicitly set certmonger's CA cert's permissions

We were relying on the default permissions that were being set by the
command that extracts the certificate into a PEM file. This wasn't the
right approach, as it could be too restrictive in some setups.

Here, we explicitly tell puppet to set the appropriate permissions
instead.

Given this is a certificate file, and there's no private key involved,
we can set it as world readable (0644). As folks in the system need to
access the file.

Change-Id: I4b2cb1071e3fd5a1277d54b86822e8fef2df0d78
Closes-bug: #1788257
"}, {'created': '2019-01-16 16:50:51.000000000', 'message': "Explicitly set certmonger's CA cert's permissions

We were relying on the default permissions that were being set by the
command that extracts the certificate into a PEM file. This wasn't the
right approach, as it could be too restrictive in some setups.

Here, we explicitly tell puppet to set the appropriate permissions
instead.

Given this is a certificate file, and there's no private key involved,
we can set it as world readable (0644). As folks in the system need to
access the file.

Change-Id: I4b2cb1071e3fd5a1277d54b86822e8fef2df0d78
Closes-bug: #1788257
"}, {'created': '2019-01-17 06:10:49.000000000', 'message': "Explicitly set certmonger's CA cert's permissions

Here, we explicitly tell puppet to set the appropriate permissions
instead.

Given this is a certificate file, and there's no private key involved,
we can set it as world readable (0644). As folks in the system need to
access the file.

Change-Id: I4b2cb1071e3fd5a1277d54b86822e8fef2df0d78
Closes-bug: #1788257
"}]
commit_message:
Explicitly set certmonger's CA cert's permissions

We were relying on the default permissions that were being set by the
command that extracts the certificate into a PEM file. This wasn't the
right approach, as it could be too restrictive in some setups.

Here, we explicitly tell puppet to set the appropriate permissions
instead.

Given this is a certificate file, and there's no private key involved,
we can set it as world readable (0644). As folks in the system need to
access the file.

Change-Id: I4b2cb1071e3fd5a1277d54b86822e8fef2df0d78
Closes-bug: #1788257

commit_message:
Migrate away from oslo_i18n.enable_lazy()

The method is known to be problematic, and it is going to be
deprecated:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2018-November/016139.html

Moreover, its usage in Sahara produces some nasty side-effects
when Python 3.x is used. The provisioning of the clusters ends
abruptly when sahara-engine tries to update the status in the
database, with a failure inside oslo_i18n.

Change-Id: I1e33216d7f1dc1ca7c7ab96deee9fa02d38b7252

commit_message:
Avoid eventlet_backdoor listing on same port

Oslo.service is binding to same port when we provide a port range
as eventlet is internally setting SO_REUSEPORT flag (starting from
eventlet version v0.20). And there is a flag (reuse_port)
introduced in v0.22 to give control to user to avoid SO_REUSEPORT.
In this patch, first we try passing reuse_port=False, if this fails
then directly open socket and listen instead of eventlist.listen.

Closes-Bug: #1810280
Change-Id: Idc842acc7e430199c76fe12785b0bf0e7a58e121

[{'created': '2018-10-15 16:21:43.000000000', 'message': 'Extend host_info to cover port profiles

Port profiles were first introduced to os-vif in
Id286f85cd5fe7ca80f02d95f6380979a0d920ef6 and the host_info description
for them were added in Idb206576570f04a6403b933b83eebf9b0f06a91a.

This change updates the core documentation and discovery mechanism in
host_info to allow port profile objects to filtered and version checked
in the same manner as VIF objects.

This change also documents the object version dependency model more
explicitly for composed objects (composed objects are assumed to be
independent).

commit_message:
Update port profile unit tests in host_info

Port profiles were first introduced to os-vif in
Id286f85cd5fe7ca80f02d95f6380979a0d920ef6 and the host_info description
for them were added in Idb206576570f04a6403b933b83eebf9b0f06a91a.

This change updates the unit tests to better cover the host_info object
model and expands the documentation a bit to illustrate their intended
use.

This change also documents the object version dependency model more
explicitly for composed objects (composed objects are assumed to be
independent).

blueprint vif-port-profile
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>
Change-Id: Id62f8f6e5f30020c828e1e75c3d1a1dbf171c645

commit_message:
Sample templates for linux_bond, ovs_bond, dpdkbond using VFs

1. Added sample templates and testcases for linux_bond, ovs_bond,
dpdkbond using VFs.
2. Set the default values for certain sriov_vf attributes when
its a member of ovs_bond, ovs_bridge
3. Set the default value of promisc for sriov_pf

Change-Id: Icdd2a077f6a996f409bbb2d82b0958b676bc5411
(cherry picked from commit 13d42df43144922d32491ff963321120dfa7c8ab)

commit_message:
undercloud: load podman environment when enabled

When podman is enabled, we should load podman.yaml environment from THT,
therefore we can benefit from the parameters in this env.

Change-Id: Id4e6795499009da9b9689d400052a8d547306162
Closes-Bug: #1811951

commit_message:
Do not merge, checking etcd process priority

We see a lot of etcd timeouts in kuryr-kubernetes gates, where we use
the etcd3 as Kubernetes backend. To fight this this commit sets highest
IO priority and higher niceness for the etcd process. Hopefully this
will help.

As of now commit is only used to test patches on Kuryr-Kubernetes.

Change-Id: I3ae1d04a6d9bfc96512eca5ab73f00035a009119

In general I wonder about moving to stevedore for loading plugins instead of having such things coded manually. stevedore is used widely in openstack for such cases. 

What do you think Joe ? I mean, not in this change because that'd be rather larger change. But general idea ?"}, {'account_id': 14273, 'date': '2017-05-09 05:28:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Unfortunately our experience with stevedore has not been positive.  We moved from it to this simpler model, based on a Rackspace library, in the monasca-api some time ago and found it to be more maintainable and easier to explain.  

The overall setup complexity and amount of work you need to do to register and load a plugin is much lower than when we were using stevedore.'}, {'account_id': 16168, 'date': '2017-05-09 07:39:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Unfortunately our experience with stevedore has not been positive. 
 > We moved from it to this simpler model, based on a Rackspace
 > library, in the monasca-api some time ago and found it to be more
 > maintainable and easier to explain.
 > 
 > The overall setup complexity and amount of work you need to do to
 > register and load a plugin is much lower than when we were using
 > stevedore.

stevedore is complex, yeah - but in overall process of loading the plugins is not too complex, every comes down to defining the namespace, driver_mgr and entries in setup.cfg. This is really simple, requires some adjustment to the model but after that I cannot say I saw anything simpler.

From my POV, depending on library widely used in openstack, moving responsibilities there and lowering down custom code in monasca is thing worth considering.'}, {'account_id': 16168, 'date': '2017-05-09 07:41:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This does not seem to work properly. In devstack/gate environment the actual configuration file for monasca-notification comes from the plugin (monasca-api/devstack/files/monasca-notification/notification.yaml) and that file does not feature any plugins that would be enabled.

Therefore I'd expect that no plugins are enabled, however:


  $ monasca notification-type-list
  +-----------+
  | types     |
  +-----------+
  | EMAIL     |
  | PAGERDUTY |
  | WEBHOOK   |
  +-----------+"}, {'account_id': 16168, 'date': '2017-07-27 05:56:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I think the problem lies in schema of monasca-api that inserts those types. But that conflicts with this change.

IMHO that change's outcome is that there are no default notifiers and everything is a plugin. Having that said, unless user specify some, there's shouldn't be anything enabled by default."}, {'account_id': 14273, 'date': '2017-07-27 13:22:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Tomasz, I'm not familiar with that API call and I can't pick out quite what it's doing with a quick look at the code.  There shouldn't be any direct connection between the notification engine and the API though.  I don't believe that the notifications configured in the notification engine are stored anywhere other than the notification engine.

I think if we want the API and the notification engine to have the same set of available notifications they both need to be configured the same."}, {'account_id': 16168, 'date': '2017-07-27 20:20:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Tomasz, I'm not familiar with that API call and I can't pick out

 > configured in the notification engine are stored anywhere other
 > than the notification engine.
 >

 > same set of available notifications they both need to be configured
 > the same.

 > Tomasz, I'm not familiar with that API call and I can't pick out
 > quite what it's doing with a quick look at the code.  There
 > shouldn't be any direct connection between the notification engine
 > and the API though.  I don't believe that the notifications
 > configured in the notification engine are stored anywhere other
 > than the notification engine.
 > 
 > I think if we want the API and the notification engine to have the
 > same set of available notifications they both need to be configured
 > the same.

@Joe -> https://github.com/openstack/monasca-api/blob/master/devstack/files/schema/mon_mysql.sql#L195

Here you have 3 types inserted directly into DB. My take is that it'd be sufficient to have them removed in order to get your code properly running."}, {'account_id': 16168, 'date': '2017-07-27 20:56:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> > Tomasz, I'm not familiar with that API call and I can't pick out
 > > quite what it's doing with a quick look at the code.  There

 > engine

 > >
 > > I think if we want the API and the notification engine to have
 > the

 > 
 > @Joe -> https://github.com/openstack/monasca-api/blob/master/devstack/files/schema/mon_mysql.sql#L195
 > 
 > Here you have 3 types inserted directly into DB. My take is that
 > it'd be sufficient to have them removed in order to get your code
 > properly running.

BTW. There isn't any direct connection between notification and API, but there's indirect connect through the same database. That said, notification engine manipulates (RW) notification_method_types table (either inserting enabled notifiers or removing rows based on config file [which, btw, seems a bit wrong for scaled notification engine where each could be configured differently])."}, {'account_id': 16168, 'date': '2017-10-25 10:52:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 16168, 'date': '2017-10-25 11:02:44.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from review/joe_keen/hipchat-cards to hipchat-cards'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2017-12-06 13:24:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Make default notifiers pluggable

Erasing distinction between plugins that are an inherent part of the
notification engine and plugins that can be specified via the config file.
Fixing broken tests.

Story: 2003801
Task: 26532
Change-Id: I360cc2ad0782f209606706bf1869570fdae2260d

commit_message:
Fix download of ahuffman.resolv

We currently request v1.2, but this is no longer available to download
and causes a 404 error. Moving to the latest version of 1.3.1 seems to
get over this bump. The lack of "v" in the version is required, I
presume due to the recent ansible galaxy changes.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/629452/
Change-Id: I29a6b8dc7d0759e43b1a64f4d6ab835687d0ab10

commit_message:
oslo.config: Avoid dependency on oslo.log

This makes the switch to python 3.7 in a rolling
distribution (openSUSE Tumbleweed) hard doe to cyclic
dependencies between oslo.config and oslo.log (bsc#1121609)

Change-Id: I78a4c1aeca63f296acf3628989b5242fc26777d4

commit_message:
Raise an SDKException/Error on duplicate hostnames

Currently a RuntimeError is raised, which is not handy. Hide the real
exception class since it's going away with switch to allocation API.
Finally, add mising tests on _get_node.

[{'created': '2018-03-25 15:42:17.000000000', 'message': 'add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I655b51e91e6fc4b4aca0e09ce8b3e582419974f5
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I655b51e91e6fc4b4aca0e09ce8b3e582419974f5
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-13 17:05:45.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Test increase vrrp adv interval

Change-Id: I8a39ed443c37266b39d42c42d55fb797bd86858c
Closes-Bug: #1798475
'}, {'created': '2018-12-14 10:32:50.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Test increase vrrp adv interval

Change-Id: I8a39ed443c37266b39d42c42d55fb797bd86858c
Closes-Bug: #1798475
'}, {'created': '2018-12-15 17:29:30.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Test increase vrrp adv interval

Change-Id: I8a39ed443c37266b39d42c42d55fb797bd86858c
Closes-Bug: #1798475
'}, {'created': '2018-12-16 04:13:17.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Refactor a HA router fullstack test case

1. We got RPC time out so increase the rpc_response_timeout to 300.
2. We got VRRP packet lose or timeout, so increase the advertisement
   interval.
3. Create HA router with gateway info will send two router_update
   notifacation implicitly, so we refactor it to create HA router
   and then explicitly set router gateway. Then it still will be
   two notifacations, one for HA router create, one for set router
   gateway.

Change-Id: I8a39ed443c37266b39d42c42d55fb797bd86858c
Closes-Bug: #1798475
'}, {'created': '2018-12-16 12:21:24.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Refactor a HA router fullstack test case

1. We got RPC time out so increase the rpc_response_timeout to 300.
2. We got VRRP packet lose or timeout, so increase the advertisement
   interval.
3. Create HA router with gateway info will send two router_update
   notifacation implicitly, so we refactor it to create HA router
   and then explicitly set router gateway. Then it still will be
   two notifacations, one for HA router create, one for set router
   gateway.

commit_message:
Refactor a HA router fullstack test case

1. We got RPC time out so increase the rpc_response_timeout to 300s.
2. We got VRRP packet lose or timeout, so increase the advertisement
   interval 10s.
3. Create HA router with gateway info will send two router_update
   notifacation implicitly, so we refactor it to create HA router
   and then explicitly set router gateway. Then it still will be
   two notifacations, one for HA router create, one for set router
   gateway.
4. Router gateway port may be processing under a replace procedure,
   so we increase the ping timeout to 10s.
5. Use empty external_network_bridge to set gateway port to br-int.

Change-Id: I8a39ed443c37266b39d42c42d55fb797bd86858c
Closes-Bug: #1798475

INFO:kolla.common.utils.base:Executing: /tmp/apt-key-gpghome.utZMwIQ8EO/gpg.1.sh --recv-keys --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80 418A7F2FB0E1E6E7EABF6FE8C2E73424D59097AB

Change-Id: I4a9f2fb2c9fdd21430ce3a9bd02999ae21e1847a
"}]
commit_message:
base: tell gnupg to not use TTY when we import APT¬†keys

Debian builds fail with gnupg error:

INFO:kolla.common.utils.base:Executing: /tmp/apt-key-gpghome.utZMwIQ8EO/gpg.1.sh --recv-keys --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80 418A7F2FB0E1E6E7EABF6FE8C2E73424D59097AB
INFO:kolla.common.utils.base:gpg: cannot open '/dev/tty': No such device or address

This change stops GnuPG from using tty.

Change-Id: I4a9f2fb2c9fdd21430ce3a9bd02999ae21e1847a

commit_message:
Add agent_updated to BgpDrAgentNotifyApi notifier

When a bgp-dragent is deployed with enable_new_services
set to False so that the agent is disabled upon creation
the first attempt to enable it again throws an error but
the second time works, see the bug report.

Change-Id: If77e2035d0c12d0391ab9c38054bf2e0d24dac4a
Closes-Bug: 1799455

messages:
[{'account_id': 29303, 'date': '2018-12-18 12:41:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-12-18 12:42:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

As discussed in IRC, needs at minimum a precheck task to validate the format of the variable. Also needs a release note, including an upgrade note about the format change.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-12-19 11:24:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I haven't really worked much with multiple regions before. Is the old configuration a valid use case, where every URL points to the local keystone? Or was it just plain broken before?

I'm just thinking, if it's a common use case to point to the local keystone (as before), then maybe we should make the 'url' field optional, to avoid repeating it? Maybe it's not a big deal."}, {'account_id': 29303, 'date': '2018-12-19 14:42:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> I haven't really worked much with multiple regions before. Is the
 > old configuration a valid use case, where every URL points to the
 > local keystone? Or was it just plain broken before?
 > 
 > I'm just thinking, if it's a common use case to point to the local
 > keystone (as before), then maybe we should make the 'url' field
 > optional, to avoid repeating it? Maybe it's not a big deal.

The old config was working only if the regions were sharing the local keystone. If each region had its own keystone, then the user is not able to swap between them in Horizon. 

As for the optional url field, to be honest I don't think it's a big deal and probably better for the user to explicitly define the url list, but I can look into making it optional. It'll add some more conditionals in some plays, but should be doable. What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-12-19 14:53:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

 > 
 > As for the optional url field, to be honest I don't think it's a
 > big deal and probably better for the user to explicitly define the
 > url list, but I can look into making it optional. It'll add some
 > more conditionals in some plays, but should be doable. What do you
 > think?

Ok, it's making a bit more sense now. Some suggestions inline."}, {'account_id': 29303, 'date': '2018-12-19 17:51:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-12-19 19:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 29303, 'date': '2018-12-19 20:27:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 29303, 'date': '2018-12-19 21:36:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-12-20 08:27:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 29303, 'date': '2018-12-20 10:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-12-20 14:49:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2019-01-02 10:12:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

please check previous comment'}, {'account_id': 29303, 'date': '2019-01-17 11:52:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> (1 comment)

Hey Eduardo! I should be able to change this, although then Keystone will create a new endpoint for the other regions, using the local urls, even though they will have their own separate keystones. If that's acceptable, then I can work on this. It'll just mean that there will be some non-usable keystone endpoints in the local catalogue, which could confuse some users. Let me know what you think!"}]

commit_message:
Fixes multi-region with separate Keystones

Instead of just a list of region names, the user now defines a list
of region urls and names in globals.conf. Then all these are added
in Horizon's local_settings. For Keystone's endpoint creation, it
only creates endpoints for the regions that have a shared Keystone
with the current one. Also, changed the documentation to reflect
these changes.

Change-Id: I02871d9dbe042d3a446512ec45c0a99d4f2a9358
Closes-Bug: 1808970

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-11 18:11:18.000000000', 'message': 'Only print polling.yaml file contents as DEBUG

Since this file can contain sensitive information such
as admin credentials of target resources (e.g. snmp) it
is not a good idea to print this log as INFO since admins
might want to have INFO level logging but without the risk
of it containing this kind of information.

We might want to consider remmoving this log altogether.

Closes-Bug: #1811098
(cherry picked from commit 8881a42af169a2d7c912b1434911f978883c83f3)
Change-Id: Iff5fcc4b6c30142f2c5c9ad26027dc5a6542a881
'}]
commit_message:
Only print polling.yaml file contents as DEBUG

Since this file can contain sensitive information such
as admin credentials of target resources (e.g. snmp) it
is not a good idea to print this log as INFO since admins
might want to have INFO level logging but without the risk
of it containing this kind of information.

We might want to consider remmoving this log altogether.

Closes-Bug: #1811098
(cherry picked from commit 8881a42af169a2d7c912b1434911f978883c83f3)
Change-Id: Iff5fcc4b6c30142f2c5c9ad26027dc5a6542a881

commit_message:
Only print polling.yaml file contents as DEBUG

Since this file can contain sensitive information such
as admin credentials of target resources (e.g. snmp) it
is not a good idea to print this log as INFO since admins
might want to have INFO level logging but without the risk
of it containing this kind of information.

We might want to consider remmoving this log altogether.

Change-Id: Iff5fcc4b6c30142f2c5c9ad26027dc5a6542a881
Closes-Bug: #1811098

[{'created': '2018-10-24 10:26:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add the possibility to create more than one stack with reproducer.

By making sure we prefix the private net name, we ensure that we can
create multiple reproducer stack on the same cloud provider.

Closes-Bug: #1775826
'}]
commit_message:
Add the possibility to create more than one stack with reproducer.

By making sure we prefix the private net name, we ensure that we can
create multiple reproducer stack on the same cloud provider.

Change-Id: I2fec9abe139481cb1e10bb72aac88b651214269f
Closes-Bug: #1775826

commit_message:
Make ceph-ansible integration respect PythonInterpreter

PythonInterpreter defaults to /usr/bin/python. If a user overrides
this default, e.g. to something like python3, then we should use it.
Modify ceph-base.yml to use the PythonInterpreter parameter. The
variable will already be set to ansible_python_interpreter by the
calling ansible execution.

Change-Id: If599855c00d0ab8861ea7f873d410f9a880d35be
Closes-Bug: #1811974

commit_message:
nova-libvirt: conditionalize selinux bind-mount

on a F28-based container image nova-libvirt fails to
start in Podman if /sys/fs/selinux is bind-mounted
from the host, with the following logs:

2019-01-16 13:41:35.375+0000: 452430: error : virSecuritySELinuxQEMUInitialize:634 : cannot open SELinux label_handle: No such file or directory
2019-01-16 13:41:35.375+0000: 452430: error : qemuSecurityInit:425 : internal error: Failed to initialize security drivers
2019-01-16 13:41:35.375+0000: 452430: error : virStateInitialize:775 : Initialization of QEMU state driver failed: internal error: Failed to initialize security drivers
2019-01-16 13:41:35.375+0000: 452430: error : daemonRunStateInit:837 : Driver state initialization failed

Perform the bind-mount only when the ContainerCli is set
to 'docker'.

Change-Id: I7a2ca4fb1ff8ea5950fd52774c648af5ef274796
Closes-Bug: #1812013
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>

neutron-sanity-check on the overcloud.

commit_message:
Use usr/share/ansible/plugins for data_files

tripleo-quickstart[1] always look for ansible modules
whether it is installed system-wide or venv in
usr/share/ansible path.

commit_message:
Switch python3 test to bionic

Ubuntu bionic is python3 by default, and OSA
stein will not support Ubuntu xenial, so it
makes sense to switch the testing to use bionic
instead.

Change-Id: I8eba7f2ed61d667a332cbe736278fd79964e3bd2

messages:

We're testing this and will report back here"}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-01-16 06:04:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ok this works fine even on systems where the umask for non-root users is more strict (0777)'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-01-16 06:04:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2019-01-17 09:32:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-15 14:44:43.000000000', 'message': "Ensure /run_command is readable by all users

On some distro, running kolla_start via su changes
the default UMASK, and consequently set_configs.py
generates a /run_command that is not world-readable,
and kolla cannot start the configured service.

Make sure /run_command always has 'go+r' permissions.

Change-Id: I6304f5937c512068ee1fb8aac5c88a2bd086e387
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure /run_command is readable by all users

On some distro, running kolla_start via su changes
the default UMASK, and consequently set_configs.py
generates a /run_command that is not world-readable,
and kolla cannot start the configured service.

Make sure /run_command always has 'go+r' permissions.

Change-Id: I6304f5937c512068ee1fb8aac5c88a2bd086e387

commit_message:
Fix download of ahuffman.resolv

We currently request v1.2, but this is no longer available to download
and causes a 404 error. Moving to the latest version of 1.3.1 seems to
get over this bump. The lack of "v" in the version is required, I
presume due to the recent ansible galaxy changes.

Change-Id: I29a6b8dc7d0759e43b1a64f4d6ab835687d0ab10

[{'created': '2019-01-15 23:18:07.000000000', 'message': 'Workaround for installing correct version of ruby bundler

See https://github.com/bundler/bundler/issues/6870

Bundler 2.x dropped support for Ruby < 2.3 so now we detect ruby
version and install last known to work version. This means that
newer OS will get newer versions of bundler.

Change-Id: I521affb16d8d2312be3ff507a014adddacd6cb8b
Closes-Bug: #1810401
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround for installing correct version of ruby bundler

See https://github.com/bundler/bundler/issues/6870

Bundler 2.x dropped support for Ruby < 2.3 so now we detect ruby
version and install last known to work version. This means that
newer OS will get newer versions of bundler.

Change-Id: I521affb16d8d2312be3ff507a014adddacd6cb8b
Closes-Bug: #1810401

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-14 17:29:20.000000000', 'message': "Make functional-py37 job work like others

The functional-* jobs have specific dependencies (external
placement) which need to be present in the job. When the
functional-py37 was created it conflicted with that change
but since it is not yet run in the gate, we didn't notice.

Also, because the functional jobs use the tox-siblings
functionality in the gate, the tox name and tox env have to
be the same (that's just how tox-siblings works), so that
is fixed here too.

Change-Id: I51e60a3149d653753ec4fc9d62a8c670e6eaf96e
"}]
commit_message:
Make functional-py37 job work like others

The functional-* jobs have specific dependencies (external
placement) which need to be present in the job. When the
functional-py37 was created it conflicted with that change
but since it is not yet run in the gate, we didn't notice.

Also, because the functional jobs use the tox-siblings
functionality in the gate, the tox name and tox env have to
be the same (that's just how tox-siblings works), so that
is fixed here too.

Change-Id: I51e60a3149d653753ec4fc9d62a8c670e6eaf96e

If building images, kolla currently uses its own version for their tag
by default.  This might not match the version of kolla-ansible, which is

commit_message:
Use kolla-ansible version to tag images

If building images, kolla currently uses its own version for their tag
by default.  This might not match the version of kolla-ansible, which is
what is used by default in kolla-ansible. This leads to the image not
being found.

This change uses kolla-ansible's version to tag locally built images.

Change-Id: I49c7afb9167d1e3f8a4470b6ebbb6ad6798d4996

commit_message:
upgrades: purge old compute service entries

Add pre-upgrade step to discover and purge and old compute service
entries; in later openstack releases, the DB model will throw
exceptions for service entries with versions less than the minimum
requirement, causing API requests to error post upgrade.

Change-Id: Id739f0f23aaadf08dff216bb9f17552deee1b0a4
Closes-Bug: 1809260

commit_message:
Pin to older grpc for ruby < 2.3

A new version of grpc was released which breaks our CI because we don't
have a newer ruby.

Change-Id: Icb87ea9b4322f5eee97802970b4e215c2bbce8f7
Related-Bug: #1812105
(cherry picked from commit 799f976b7b7f31da2b3c474350d94b3000e60acd)

subject: Upper-constrain neutron to stable rocky
messages:
[{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-01-16 18:41:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-01-16 18:45:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This I think would solve the failing "Run tox without tests" tasks in stable/rocky jobs.

However, could the constraining of neutron cause any problem in any project?'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-01-16 18:49:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

what are those projects doing to move from using neutron, a service, as a library?  https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/requirements-libs'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-01-16 19:15:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Matthew: thanks for the etherpad link! Now I see that it's a bit more complicated than I thought.

Actually what I've seen was that the periodic stable jobs are failing for the mentioned projects and I tried to figure out why, and how I could fix them.

(I also gave a try to adding "neutron<14.0.0.0b1" on those projects requirements.txt on stable-rocky, which fixes the problem.)'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-01-16 19:19:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

ya, we have it in our blacklist for those reasons

https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/blacklist.txt#L27'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-01-17 08:55:24.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Thanks Matthew for the information!

Then I guess *for stable branches* now the best solution is to restrict neutron on the given project instead of here. (As the replacement of the neutron to neutron-lib is rather a new feature, that fits to master branches, i guess)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-16 18:41:26.000000000', 'message': 'Upper-constrain neutron to stable rocky

Some neutron related projects that use neutron in their requirements.txt
(e.g. neutron-fwaas, networking-odl, neutron-vpnaas, networking-ovn) have
now failing tests on stable/rocky due to the tests pick up a neutron
release from master (14.0.0.0b1), instead of using a stable/rocky release.

See periodic job failures for the above projects for examples:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-stable-maint/2019-January/thread.html#11631

Change-Id: I84f9a711a3f42b88432bf35c2e34791b303b38ee
'}]
commit_message:
Upper-constrain neutron to stable rocky

Some neutron related projects that use neutron in their requirements.txt
(e.g. neutron-fwaas, networking-odl, neutron-vpnaas, networking-ovn) have
now failing tests on stable/rocky due to the tests pick up a neutron
release from master (14.0.0.0b1), instead of using a stable/rocky release.

See periodic job failures for the above projects for examples:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-stable-maint/2019-January/thread.html#11631

Change-Id: I84f9a711a3f42b88432bf35c2e34791b303b38ee

commit_message:
Add libselinux-python package for Red Hat distro

Since Red Hat distro uses selinux and when tempest role is
executed on target host it expects libselinux-python package
needs to be installed otherwise tasks gets aborted.

Change-Id: I0284ec5e57e36764c90e6aa110b00382a08a8a3f

commit_message:
Add options for sphinx-build -W in docstheme-build-translated.sh

The user can choose

- if warnings should be ignored (SKIP_SPHINX_WARNINGS=1)
- if warnings on translation build should be on (SPHINX_WARNINGS_TRANS=1)

added an example to the previously releasenotes

Change-Id: I1486139fdbdef5dd4e00a38c9cb751a5ed7881c6

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-16 05:20:56.000000000', 'message': "Fix contract violation for User resource

When trying to use the io.murano.user resource, you get the error:
io.murano.User.extra['options'] Value {} violates string() contract
because the output is dict, not a string.

This commit changes the contract type to become $ rather than $.string()
which matches what the Project resource has.

Change-Id: If6ef0e2e3750a39aaa022a7b12f4c130a692d691
"}]
commit_message:
Fix contract violation for User resource

When trying to use the io.murano.user resource, you get the error:
io.murano.User.extra['options'] Value {} violates string() contract
because the output is dict, not a string.

This commit changes the contract type to become $ rather than $.string()
which matches what the Project resource has.

Change-Id: If6ef0e2e3750a39aaa022a7b12f4c130a692d691

fluentd service deprecated. This patch just adds warning message about
the fact.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 02:01:40.000000000', 'message': 'remove ssh from tripleo::firewall::pre

including global ssh access in tripleo::firewall::pre makes it
difficult for the operator to control ssh access to overcloud hosts.
This removes the hardcoded rule and the accompanying change in t-h-t
makes the default set of firewall rules a parameter on the
tripleo-firewall.yaml service.

Depends-on: I89cff59947dda3f51482486c41a3d67c4aa36a3e
Change-Id: I14b540e6564c5b7c5d54b4f1fd5368b000744135
'}, {'created': '2018-07-13 02:56:12.000000000', 'message': 'remove ssh from tripleo::firewall::pre

including global ssh access in tripleo::firewall::pre makes it
difficult for the operator to control ssh access to overcloud hosts.
This removes the hardcoded rule and the accompanying change in t-h-t

commit_message:
remove ssh from tripleo::firewall::pre

including global ssh access in tripleo::firewall::pre makes it
difficult for the operator to control ssh access to overcloud hosts.
This removes the hardcoded rule and the accompanying change in t-h-t
configures the default firewall rules via hiera config_settings.

Depends-On: I89cff59947dda3f51482486c41a3d67c4aa36a3e
Change-Id: I14b540e6564c5b7c5d54b4f1fd5368b000744135

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-10 11:28:18.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Ceph driver should respect the `--incremental` option for backups"

This reverts commit 797c5aa78574a29a9a0bf7dd1b8adb47554b42c2.

That patch doesn't really fix the Ceph full backup issue.

When doing a non incremental Ceph to Ceph backup, instead of doing a
full backup that is ussable by the incremental feature, it creates a
full backup as if it where a backup from a non Ceph volume, which then
cannot be used by the incremental feature.

Change-Id: I73a40babf5cb13956e44d4caef3d0ff7ef698048
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Ceph driver should respect the `--incremental` option for backups"

This reverts commit 797c5aa78574a29a9a0bf7dd1b8adb47554b42c2.

That patch doesn't really fix the Ceph full backup issue.

When doing a non incremental Ceph to Ceph backup, instead of doing a
full backup that is ussable by the incremental feature, it creates a
full backup as if it where a backup from a non Ceph volume, which then
cannot be used by the incremental feature.

Change-Id: I73a40babf5cb13956e44d4caef3d0ff7ef698048

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-14 08:10:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix an issue in iniset function

Given the file to be configured, if user "stack" even doesn't have read access,
the result of configuration is not expected. iniset with "-sudo" option will
always create the section and the option which we want to configure for each
calling, no matter whether this section and this option exist in the file or
not. The root cause is the calling of grep and ini_has_option in iniset don't
use the "sudo" option.

Change-Id: I9d21322046b7be411c4c7c28fefc24894fa2e131
Signed-off-by: Yi Wang <yi.c.wang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Fix an issue in iniset function

Given the file to be configured, if user "stack" even doesn't have
read access, the result of configuration is not expected. iniset with
"-sudo" option will always create the section and the option which we
want to configure for each calling, no matter whether this section and
this option exist in the file or not. The root cause is the calling of
grep and ini_has_option in iniset don't use the "sudo" option.

Change-Id: I9d21322046b7be411c4c7c28fefc24894fa2e131
Signed-off-by: Yi Wang <yi.c.wang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Fix key error with unknown service in size

When Adjutant has sizes defined for a service that
only exists in certain regions, this can cause errors.

If we come across a region without that service, skip
the service.

Cherry-picked from: 4396ad3c87e81551d1ce51e907d31ec517c6d4ca

Change-Id: Ic52ffb2bf0d918a49a79088a2e13e5ad1f9b6216

commit_message:
Add project directory to overlay inventories

The use of an overlay inventory has now been added to a stand alone
directory which should help deployers understand how this could work
within their environments. Inventory configuration has been updated to
show this working in the various projects that have tests and could
benefit from an overlay inventory.

Change-Id: I1681fce160b43e9127851f06ae05ff5eaabe852f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Use existing stack parameter for DeployIdentifier
messages: [{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-01-16 19:13:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-01-16 23:54:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-16 19:13:29.000000000', 'message': "Use existing stack parameter for DeployIdentifier

In commit 4cb7a225297e804fb00c037904142dea9262475b we changed
to set the DeployIndentifier to ''. This looks like an incorrect
change. It would set the DeployIdentifier to '' (from the existing
unique value), if  --skip_deploy_identifier is used and this would
result in deployments applied on nodes, whereas we want exactly
the opposite. This checks the existing value in the stack for an
update.

Conflicts:
	tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py

Change-Id: Idd4178aa06aba5668dec6d8ba0427f57dfe5b5b6
Related-Bug: #1759326
(cherry picked from commit d550c19485efa388950288faaecf821a1b210138)
"}]
commit_message:
Use existing stack parameter for DeployIdentifier

In commit 4cb7a225297e804fb00c037904142dea9262475b we changed
to set the DeployIndentifier to ''. This looks like an incorrect
change. It would set the DeployIdentifier to '' (from the existing
unique value), if  --skip_deploy_identifier is used and this would
result in deployments applied on nodes, whereas we want exactly
the opposite. This checks the existing value in the stack for an
update.

Conflicts:
	tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py

Change-Id: Idd4178aa06aba5668dec6d8ba0427f57dfe5b5b6
Related-Bug: #1759326
(cherry picked from commit d550c19485efa388950288faaecf821a1b210138)

commit_message:
Resolve deprecation warning for rfc3986 uri validation

rfc3986.is_valid_uri is deprecated in 1.1.0. That generates a lot of
warnings: "Please use rfc3986.validators.Validator instead. This
method will be eventually removed.".

This patch updates URI type to use rfc3986.validators.
ValueError exception is preserved.

Change-Id: Ida56dfa17fca0080b74c1a80d5420ebed203431f

commit_message:
Add multiattach attribute when do backup restore

When we do a backup restore without specifying the target volume, it
will create a new volume without inheriting the multiattach attribute
of the source volume of backup.
This patch fix this.

Change-Id: I9b5758e64e0658315ab96b7af7e77b18f5a3a04d

commit_message:
placement: Use the less generic PlacementApi service name

I5dbce7883f86ba6a92f48a398b0d0eb9b743d212 had incorrectly set this to
Placement instead of PlacementApi.

commit_message:
Resolve ansible warnings related to empty inventory

When the inventory file is missing ansible defaults to localhost
but not without throwing some warnings at runtime.

Newer code is producing a clean inventory file that contains only
localhost and which triggers no warnings at runtimel.

Change-Id: I8d510b9177af48dbc92ec031f0d495d2ec34c55e

[{'created': '2019-01-16 14:49:11.000000000', 'message': "Enable 'all' IPv6 forwarding knob correctly

When the external gateway is plugged and we enable IPv6
forwarding on it, make sure the 'all' sysctl knob is also
enabled, else IPv6 packets will not be forwarded.  This
seems to only affect HA routers that default to disabling
this 'all' knob on creation.

Also, when we are removing all the IPv6 addresses from a
HA router internal interface, set 'accept_ra' to zero so
it doesn't accidentally auto-configure an address.  Set
it back to one when adding them back.

Re-homed newly added _wait_until_ipv6_forwarding_has_state()
accordingly.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py

Closes-bug: #1787919

Change-Id: Ia1f311ee31d1479089685367a97bf13cf170b342
(cherry picked from commit b847cd02c56dc8fe654f4731306dc2b5493a62eb)
(cherry picked from commit dfedafe5f6b46c8f6cdc407736e7c865a1984401)
"}]
commit_message:
Enable 'all' IPv6 forwarding knob correctly

When the external gateway is plugged and we enable IPv6
forwarding on it, make sure the 'all' sysctl knob is also
enabled, else IPv6 packets will not be forwarded.  This
seems to only affect HA routers that default to disabling
this 'all' knob on creation.

Also, when we are removing all the IPv6 addresses from a
HA router internal interface, set 'accept_ra' to zero so
it doesn't accidentally auto-configure an address.  Set
it back to one when adding them back.

Re-homed newly added _wait_until_ipv6_forwarding_has_state()
accordingly.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py

Closes-bug: #1787919

Change-Id: Ia1f311ee31d1479089685367a97bf13cf170b342
(cherry picked from commit b847cd02c56dc8fe654f4731306dc2b5493a62eb)
(cherry picked from commit dfedafe5f6b46c8f6cdc407736e7c865a1984401)

commit_message:
Remove unused jinja code in network-isolation environment

Change I222873859af1b4ed1050cfffe55687b2f8d4c528 removed the
RedisVipPort using the {{primary_role_name}} jinja varialble.
The code to get the primary_role_name is no longer necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1808893
Change-Id: Id416786c85a48c598ccc8a9975bb07d7735df218

commit_message:
Allow domain users to access the GET domain API

This change updates the policy for identity:get_domains to allow
users with role assignments on a domain to fetch the domain. As long
as they call the API with a domain scoped token, they should be
authorized to retrieve the domain. Subsequent patches will do the
same for project users.

Change-Id: I83a9b8af775580d36a1141be55e9c1cc283a75b6
Partial-Bug: 1794864
Partial-Bug: 968696

subject: Make neutron ovs agent work with python3
messages: [{'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-01-16 16:14:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-01-16 17:44:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-01-16 21:11:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-16 16:14:29.000000000', 'message': 'Make neutron ovs agent work with python3

Currently neutron_ovs_agent_launcher.sh unconditionally
runs neutron with the default python from /usr/bin/python,
so it is impossible to force it to use python3 if
/usr/bin/python points to python2.

Make the python interpreter overridable, by reusing the
existing Heat parameter "PythonInterpreter" and honouring
its value in neutron_ovs_agent_launcher.sh

Change-Id: I43c17de81603bd41e6503dd01d6f4ef452b7d533
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
'}]
commit_message:
Make neutron ovs agent work with python3

Currently neutron_ovs_agent_launcher.sh unconditionally
runs neutron with the default python from /usr/bin/python,
so it is impossible to force it to use python3 if
/usr/bin/python points to python2.

Make the python interpreter overridable, by reusing the
existing Heat parameter "PythonInterpreter" and honouring
its value in neutron_ovs_agent_launcher.sh

Change-Id: I43c17de81603bd41e6503dd01d6f4ef452b7d533
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>

subject: Fix comparing dictionaries for changes detection
messages: [{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-01-15 15:28:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/rocky.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-01-16 21:08:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-15 15:28:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix comparing dictionaries for changes detection

Non-unicode and unicode dicts cannot be compared.
That makes paunch failing to detect config changes and
rebuilding containers w/o a need.

Use yaml safe_load in order to produce a non-unicode dict
for the right comparison of config data.

NOTE: This change is different for <= Rocky as we refactored in Stein.
Conflicts:
	paunch/builder/base.py
Change-Id: I507f4b07af2c515fd8548af7dbe6b35ad2a269a9
Closes-Bug: #1810690
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5558e521abc48f5cf1bd3fcfdaec1149a05dcfaa)
(cherry picked from commit e52fdc085412b7631364b1c93c98a5e5a25d4320)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix comparing dictionaries for changes detection

Non-unicode and unicode dicts cannot be compared.
That makes paunch failing to detect config changes and
rebuilding containers w/o a need.

Use yaml safe_load in order to produce a non-unicode dict
for the right comparison of config data.

NOTE: This change is different for <= Rocky as we refactored in Stein.
Conflicts:
	paunch/builder/base.py
Change-Id: I507f4b07af2c515fd8548af7dbe6b35ad2a269a9
Closes-Bug: #1810690
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5558e521abc48f5cf1bd3fcfdaec1149a05dcfaa)
(cherry picked from commit e52fdc085412b7631364b1c93c98a5e5a25d4320)

[{'created': '2018-10-23 14:41:17.000000000', 'message': "Per role Numa aware vswitch configuration

The parameters 'NeutronPhysnetNUMANodesMapping' and
'NeutronTunnelNUMANodes' need to be role specific as
the NIC placement in the server may not be consistent
between 2 compute nodes with different roles.

Change-Id: I860897f4c0489156fc3a8798a3e6e3667e4c4937
"}, {'created': '2018-10-24 12:06:50.000000000', 'message': "Per role Numa aware vswitch configuration

'NeutronTunnelNUMANodes' were missing the tag 'role_specific'.

Change-Id: I860897f4c0489156fc3a8798a3e6e3667e4c4937
"}]
commit_message:
Per role Numa aware vswitch configuration

The parameters 'NeutronPhysnetNUMANodesMapping' and
'NeutronTunnelNUMANodes' were missing the tag 'role_specific'.

Change-Id: I860897f4c0489156fc3a8798a3e6e3667e4c4937

commit_message:
Add role definition for ComputeOvsDpdkSriov role

Addd support to generate roles_data file with both OVS-DPDK and
SR-IOV services in the same role.
Closes-Bug: #1789804

(cherry picked from commit 911da8ce89e4818b037034db999dce7b2c7ec1de)

commit_message:
Pin to older grpc for ruby < 2.3

A new version of grpc was released which breaks our CI because we don't
have a newer ruby.

NOTE: also temporarily remove teh ubuntu job because it's broken.

Change-Id: Icb87ea9b4322f5eee97802970b4e215c2bbce8f7
Related-Bug: #1812105

commit_message:
Migrate OvnWorker to a separate location

This patch migrates OvnWorker to a separate plugin file, so
that importing ovsdb_monitor in any other process( like Octavia )
does not cause any duplicate configuration issues.

Change-Id: I16a7f9971f4e429512e959f36ac745c98010b2a0

[{'created': '2019-01-16 00:48:13.000000000', 'message': "Do not use 'exit' in the script

The scripts in kube_cluster_config SoftwareConfig resource are combined
together as one script inside the VM, any 'exit' clause will stop
executing the following script.

Change-Id: I25965c663e6e1ca5a59d0f28098174810bd76df1
"}]
commit_message:
Do not use 'exit' in the script

The scripts in kube_cluster_config SoftwareConfig resource are combined
together as one script inside the VM, any 'exit' clause will stop
executing the following script.

Change-Id: I25965c663e6e1ca5a59d0f28098174810bd76df1

commit_message:
Add smartnic port type to VNIC_TYPES

Neutron OVS ML2 mechanism driver will allow binding the `smart-nic`
vnic_type. The rationale for creating new vnic_type and not using the
barmetal one is that there is a wide range of mechanism drivers that
use heirachical port binding for configuring TOR switches and we want
to allow this to work with smart NICs.

Story: #2003346
Change-Id: I91f63810626ce4e054e358f5de5e46434c4da131

commit_message:
Remove NeutronServicePlugins from octavia environment files

There are no additional octavia specific neutron service plugins for
octavia required so this parameter should be removed from the
environment files.

Change-Id: I3da329db28701c7e9798083982953c5c9c861c50
(cherry picked from commit 2998c2119171f92aad6f2768ee3ea526f1527128)

commit_message:
Don't fail when undeploying and the stack doesn't exist

Before attempting to delete the stack, we check if it exists.  And if it
doesn't, we skip straight to updating the environment.

Change-Id: I4124f73571cd794a457f52d4f76bfb75cf64e886

commit_message:
Implement workaround for failure to load ansible.cfg

While the correct fix for this is to stop using fetch-zuul-cloner job,
this is not possible right now as is imported by zuul base job.

infra-root said that they it will take more time for the zuul base
to be fixed due to risk involved on very-old jobs, so we need to
implement a local fix for tripleo.

Change-Id: I14abcb3273e68e267d6bcc7b2a060486bbd77351
Partial-Bug: 1807703

Fix paunch logs verbosity control

Make ConfigDebug also controlling the paunch logs verbosity.

commit_message:
Add script to facilitate MembershipFreeze handling

This script will compute a list of deliverables present in
governance but unknown to release management, for manual
processing.

Change-Id: Ibebf777911416d978ecea5ba8d7b25b211e7ae52

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-10-21 11:43:31.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: reconstructor: do not sync recently moved parts

When the reconstructor ask the left and right nodes for a partition, if the
partition was recently rebalanced, but the revert job has not been done yet,
reconstructor will think all fragments of partitions are missing. It will try
to reconstruct them, generating a lot of IO. By waiting before doing sync jobs
we can save IO.

Change-Id: I1e5f1cdb2e6a043484b88bff5895f93953fa3075
'}, {'created': '2016-10-21 11:44:07.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: reconstructor: do not sync recently moved parts

When the reconstructor ask the left and right nodes for a partition, if the
partition was recently rebalanced, but the revert job has not been done yet,
reconstructor will think all fragments of partitions are missing. It will try
to reconstruct them, generating a lot of IO. By waiting before doing sync jobs
we can save IO.

Change-Id: I1e5f1cdb2e6a043484b88bff5895f93953fa3075
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: reconstructor: do not sync recently moved parts

When the reconstructor ask the left and right nodes for a partition, if the
partition was recently rebalanced, but the revert job has not been done yet,
reconstructor will think all fragments of partitions are missing. It will try
to reconstruct them, generating a lot of IO. By waiting before doing sync jobs
we can save IO.

Change-Id: I1e5f1cdb2e6a043484b88bff5895f93953fa3075

commit_message:
Stop using setup.py [test|testr|build_sphinx]

These are all deprecated. For unit testing stestr should be used
directly, and for doc builds sphinx-build should be used directly.

A couple of minor doc changes were needed to eliminate warnings.

Change-Id: Ic2e1b9d692c9b5866f888fb4c8c08bf95742764e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-16 17:07:50.000000000', 'message': "Update Elasticsearch health status expressions

This updates the Elasticsearch health status expressions used in
Prometheus, Nagios and Grafana.  The previous Prometheus rule
defined for Elasticsearch health checked for a status that was
> 0 to trigger an alarm for a green health status. The correct
returned values are: 1 for green, 0 for both red and yellow. This
changes the expression to use arithmetic operators to give us a
result that maps to: 2 for green, 1 for yellow, 0 for red.

This also updates the Elasticsearch dashboard in Grafana to add a
new mapping for the updated 2g,1y,0r scale.

Finally, this also updates the Nagios service check to explicitly
mention that the Elasticsearch cluster's health is either red OR
yellow when the alarm is raised, instead of only reporting that it
is red.

Change-Id: I6ef2a7c308c6ebfdb693b46127a285bceb6ba872
"}, {'created': '2019-01-16 17:09:12.000000000', 'message': 'Update Elasticsearch health status expressions

This also updates the Elasticsearch dashboard in Grafana to add a

Finally, this also updates the Nagios service check to be a bit

For reference, see:
https://github.com/justwatchcom/elasticsearch_exporter/issues/120

Change-Id: I6ef2a7c308c6ebfdb693b46127a285bceb6ba872

This also updates the Elasticsearch dashboard in Grafana to add a

commit_message:
Update Elasticsearch health status expressions

This updates the Elasticsearch health status expressions used in
Prometheus, Nagios and Grafana.  The previous Prometheus rule
defined for Elasticsearch health checked for a status that was
> 0 to trigger an alarm for a green health status. The correct
returned values are: 1 for green, 0 for both red and yellow. This
changes the expression to use arithmetic operators to give us a
result that maps to: 2 for green, 1 for yellow, 0 for red.

This also updates the Elasticsearch dashboard in Grafana to add a
new mapping for the updated 2g,1y,0r scale.

Finally, this also updates the Nagios service check to be a bit
more verbose in its output.

For reference, see:
https://github.com/justwatchcom/elasticsearch_exporter/issues/120

Change-Id: I6ef2a7c308c6ebfdb693b46127a285bceb6ba872

commit_message:
Fix volume revert to snapshot tests

According to the revert to snapshot spec, it should not be
possible to revert a volume to a snapshot after the volume is
extended. This was fixed on [1] but the cinder_tempest_plugin
test still was being considering the old behavior.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1798503

Change-Id: I21d0b2291608922e46278ae5799478a5df0c4904

commit_message:
The field instance_name was added to InstanceCreatePayload

The field instance_name was missing from Nova instance notifications.
It was added to instance.create.* notifications, as discussed in:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/001141.html

Change-Id: I52f3186d1bcda0c23a471f9bfd2c55763262658f

commit_message:
Enhance exception raised when invalid power state

The invalid state exception did not pass wht power state
as a string. Ensure that it is a string and not an integer.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I37bb05585bc16de14f7e9a2eb3864c5ed90c7603
Closes-bug: #1811565

commit_message:
Don't display router's is_ha and is_distributed attributes always

In case when is_ha or is_distributed attribute of Neutron's router is
set to None, it means that it wasn't returned from server and should
not be displayed.
Otherwise it might be confusing for user is making
openstack router show <router_name>
call as an admin will return e.g. is_ha=True but same call done as
regular user will return False or None.
It might happen like that because returning of those attributes is
forbidden for regular users in Neutron's policy.json

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/567606/
Change-Id: I626b5193d9ecb308baad7b27939f9673c32b4182
Closes-Bug: #1689510
Task: 19789
Story: 2002110
(cherry picked from commit 8db3933feb35f91f3ff3d121c155286973c66122)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-01 14:08:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add image setup to trove devstack plugin

* export environmental variables for diskimage-builder
* build an image
* register the newly created image in trove
* add tripleo-elements information to default settings

Change-Id: I6e57890c5b6fb65e9b8c63363f92e5a7c70e523e
'}, {'created': '2018-10-04 13:56:40.000000000', 'message': 'Add image setup to trove devstack plugin

Main goal is to have a working vm image registered in
trove after devstack installation.

It is a first step towards trovestack-redesign as described
in https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/trovestack-redesign

It is enabled by default during devstack installation with
trove enabled plugin, but it can be skipped by setting
DISABLE_TROVE_IMAGE_SETUP=TRUE

Implementation details:
* export environmental variables for diskimage-builder
* build an image with disk-image-create script
* register the newly created image in trove
* add tripleo-elements information to default settings

Change-Id: I6e57890c5b6fb65e9b8c63363f92e5a7c70e523e
Signed-off-by: Dariusz Krol <d.krol@samsung.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-10-10 13:27:36.000000000', 'message': 'Add image setup to trove devstack plugin

in https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/trovestack-redesign

It is enabled by default during devstack installation with
trove enabled plugin, but it can be skipped by setting
DISABLE_TROVE_IMAGE_SETUP=TRUE

Implementation details:
* export environmental variables for diskimage-builder
* build an image with disk-image-create script
* register the newly created image in trove
* add tripleo-elements information to default settings

Change-Id: I6e57890c5b6fb65e9b8c63363f92e5a7c70e523e
Signed-off-by: Dariusz Krol <d.krol@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Add image setup to trove devstack plugin

Main goal is to have a working vm image registered in
trove after devstack installation.

It is a first step towards trovestack-redesign as described
in https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/trovestack-redesign

It is enabled by default during devstack installation with
trove enabled plugin, but it can be skipped by setting
DISABLE_TROVE_IMAGE_SETUP=TRUE

Implementation details:
* export environmental variables for diskimage-builder
* build an image with disk-image-create script
* register the newly created image in trove
* add tripleo-elements information to default settings

Change-Id: I6e57890c5b6fb65e9b8c63363f92e5a7c70e523e
Signed-off-by: Dariusz Krol <d.krol@samsung.com>

Add both TC and PTL elections to the schedule.  Due to this cycle being

commit_message:
Add Train elections to schedule

Add both TC and PTL elections to the schedule.  Due to this cycle being
slight different because of the scheduling of the summit, forum and PTG
at essentially the same time we'll have only a single email deadline and
the confirmation of the TC election dates implies the PTL election
dates.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/629693
Change-Id: Ia5ec78a123fbe73e544cc5557f7ae1ebd7a7197d

[{'created': '2018-12-07 10:07:26.000000000', 'message': '[Configuration] Update min tox version.

The commands used by constraits need at least tox 2.0, update to reflect
reality, which should help with local running constraints targets.

Change-Id: I73017538f259268d8a77eaeea3ba99e116bcd0f9

commit_message:
[Configuration] Update min tox version.

The commands used by constraits need at least tox 2.0, update to reflect
reality, which should help with local running constraints targets.

This is a week earlier than expected (based on the summit date of
2019-04-29) as we have the PTG and summit at more or less the same time
and we'd like to run the elections in series rather then parallel.

commit_message:
Setup Train TC election

Set the TC election as follows:

  Summit is at: 2019-04-22
  Latest possible completion is at: 2019-03-11
  Moving back to Tuesday: 2019-03-05
  TC Election from 2019-02-26T23:45 to 2019-03-05T23:45
  TC Campaigning from 2019-02-19T23:45 to 2019-02-26T23:45
  TC Nominations from 2019-02-12T23:45 to 2019-02-19T23:45
  Set email_deadline to 2019-02-19T00:00
  Setting TC timeframe end to email_deadline
  Begining of Rocky Cycle @ 2018-02-09 00:00:00+00:00
  End of Stein cycle @ 2019-02-19 00:00:00+00:00
  Election timeframe: 375 days, 0:00:00s

This is a week earlier than expected (based on the summit date of
2019-04-29) as we have the PTG and summit at more or less the same time
and we'd like to run the elections in series rather then parallel.

Change-Id: Ieead5df13df4e56ac29031398a4fa1634e5912e9

subject: Add link to self-healing SIG documentation
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2394, 'name': 'Adam Spiers', 'email': 'aspiers@suse.com', 'username': 'adam.spiers'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 17765, 'name': 'Frank Kloeker', 'email': 'f.kloeker@telekom.de', 'username': 'eumel8'}, {'_account_id': 18591, 'name': 'Eric Kao', 'email': 'ekcs.openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'ekcs'}, {'_account_id': 20156, 'name': 'Petr Kovar', 'email': 'pkovar@redhat.com', 'username': 'pmkovar'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-02 22:07:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-02 22:43:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure whether the SIG has enough documentation yet to warrant this - would welcome outsider opinions on that.  But even if not, we can just shelve this review and resurrect it later when the docs have grown a bit."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-01-03 06:40:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree we should link to it - but think that " Operations and Administration Guides " is wrong. On the other hand, there's no perfect place for it ;(

Reviewers, should we add another section for SIGs? Or is this a kind of contributor Guide?'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-03 10:26:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree that "Operations and Administration Guides" isn't quite the right section, and also that there's no other obvious place for it now.  One option would be to rename that section to "Operations and Administration" (i.e. just drop "Guides").  Then it would make more sense.  Another section for SIGs also sounds like a good option.  I don't think it counts as a kind of contributor guide, since only one page covers that topic:

https://docs.openstack.org/self-healing-sig/latest/meta/CONTRIBUTING.html'}, {'account_id': 20156, 'date': '2019-01-03 15:37:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> One option would be to rename that section to "Operations and Administration" (i.e. just drop "Guides"). 

Sounds good to me. What do others think?'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2019-01-03 17:01:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> > One option would be to rename that section to "Operations and
 > Administration" (i.e. just drop "Guides").
 > 
 > Sounds good to me. What do others think?

For me it's confusing. I wouldn't expect a SIG doc under that chapter with openstack-manuals. 
Another option is a new chapter  "SIG-specific Guides" (similar to  Project-specific Guides), because there are more SIGs and possible plans for docs.
The user chapter could be also an option, contributor guide looks already overloaded.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-01-03 17:27:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

following Frank's comment: What about rename "Project specific" to "Project and SIG specific", create a new page with sig specific content and link to it from the renamed section?'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-03 17:52:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Thanks for the feedback Frank, that's all I needed to hear to confirm my suspicion that patch set 1 isn't good enough.  I like the suggestion from Andreas and yourself for a SIG-specific section, and yes hopefully other SIGs will contribute docs too at some point.

Andreas, what's the thinking behind having SIG-specific stuff grouped together in the same section as project-specific stuff, rather than in a separate section?"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-01-03 19:02:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Adam, I was thinking that with giving it a different header we can reduce clutter on the page. And having a separate SIGs page allows to link to it from all pages easily...'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-04 15:38:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Andreas I'm also +1 on a separate header for SIGs.  I worry that a separate SIGs page might be overkill - at least for now, since there would be very little to put on there.  It also might risk duplicating https://governance.openstack.org/sigs/.  Maybe we could start with a new SIG section on the docs.o.o toplevel and if it grows too large in the future then consider splitting it off?"}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-10 17:08:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-10 17:10:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:
