commit_message:
Add link to self-healing SIG documentation

The self-healing SIG documentation is in its early stages, but already
includes some practical information which certain operators may find
useful.

Linking from the index also helps promote the visibility of the SIG,
which could help encourage more involvement from operators, which
would in turn help drive development, reducing the inertia of the
current chicken-and-egg bootstrapping challenge we face.

Change-Id: I9821c1a228a35a729ea4f101b29f2dcf8cbbf152
Story: 2001628
Task: 24545

OK so something is not clear in the code or in your commit message. You are saying "By always pre plugging the vm interface to the ovs bridge..." What is that VM interface if it's not a TAP device?

Also if you create ports without TAP, ovs is going to log errors. I was considering that function "create_vif_port" was creating the TAP.

An other point the agent is looking at the bridge or the devices (TAP) so I'm not sure about the benefit of your code.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-10-31 14:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

this change does not make os-vif create a tap.

plugging is the process of configuring the backend to hanel the vm interface when the interface is create by the hypervior.

in this case we are configuring the ovsdb with the info it requires to manage the tap when it is create by libvrit but we are not creating the tap.

the agent does not look for the create of a bridge or a tap.

it monitors the ovsdb for the addtion of an interface record in the interfaces table with an external id set to a value that matches a
neutron port.

it does not have any depency on the datapalne ports acutlly existenting to wire up the interface by tagging the ovs port in the db with the correct tenant isolation vlan.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-01 21:02:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-01 21:07:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2018-11-02 09:28:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

all the changes make sense to me.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-06 21:14:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-07 11:44:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-07 19:37:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-11-08 09:50:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I would suggest Sean to rewrite your commit message to reflect what you actually do in this patch.

Basically you give the opportunity to create OVS ports when we call plugin() which since Nova is calling that method during the pre-live-migration step will create the ports in OVS, the agent will detect them and start to configure the L2. So during the live-migration step, when libvirt will create and plug the TAPs the L2 will be proactively configured.


Also do we have to be worried about bad behaviors? My thinking is that the connectivity on source will be stopped early so my thinking is your change is good for a post copy migration but not sure for a normal migration, what do you think?'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-10 20:59:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-10 21:11:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

i should also note that this will have no effect on the network connectivy on the source host in a detramental way.

as currently written becase libvirt is used to create the ovs db port entry and not os-vif all of the livemigration perfromace benifits of 
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/queens/approved/neutron-new-port-binding-api.html
are effectivly disabled when using kernel ovs with the ovs firewall driver.

this will signifcantly reduce the interval withing which a vm may lose packets as a result of live migrations. today there is a mulitsecond interval when using the ovs firewal driver while the interface is being wired up and mac learning takes effect. this dose not happen when using the ip tabels fire wall and this is a result of the fact that neutron cannot pre wireup the ovs configuration today when libvirt creates teh port and need to instead react once it detects its created.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-14 08:58:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-15 17:09:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Also, question inline for you Sean on whether there is a corresponding Nova patch that removes the code from the libvirt virt driver that was setting up the OVS port when hybrid=False?'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-21 12:41:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

{"Interface":{"7e3ff866-08cc-480b-8fa9-4eff3966097c":{"name":"tap53086ae1-70","external_ids":["map",[["attached-mac","fa:16:3e:e1:8b:e2"],["iface-id","53086ae1-7037-4308-8588-965ff277c5f5"],["iface-status","active"],["vm-id","54a6cf57-4a5f-45ea-9be2-992f03620f36"]]]},"3be7cf7f-407e-4050-bce1-43b0b4cadeac":null},"Port":{"7e5764c8-8f67-4a00-a295-a774d7905d93":null,"a2222b10-9303-4db8-b486-8232930c03b1":{"name":"tap53086ae1-70","interfaces":["uuid","7e3ff866-08cc-480b-8fa9-4eff3966097c"]}},"_date":1547318060510,"Bridge":{"55c43e83-4e31-46b6-b8d6-d0dc6bc14679":{"ports":["set",[["uuid","13e94811-130b-4cf8-a460-cf234f8837bf"],["uuid","71bcee89-73d8-420a-a26a-957fea9ce3c1"],["uuid","a2222b10-9303-4db8-b486-8232930c03b1"],["uuid","c57faa24-eb47-4ce1-9458-f06a2d42878c"],["uuid","fa0b9b9e-3938-45c7-baee-aafdbc95d1f8"]]]}},"_comment":"ovs-vsctl (invoked by /usr/sbin/libvirtd): ovs-vsctl --timeout=5 -- --if-exists del-port tap53086ae1-70 -- add-port br-int tap53086ae1-70 -- set Interface tap53086ae1-70 \"external-ids:attached-mac=\\\"fa:16:3e:e1:8b:e2\\\"\" -- set Interface tap53086ae1-70 \"external-ids:iface-id=\\\"53086ae1-7037-4308-8588-965ff277c5f5\\\"\" -- set Interface tap53086ae1-70 \"external-ids:vm-id=\\\"54a6cf57-4a5f-45ea-9be2-992f03620f36\\\"\" -- set Interface tap53086ae1-70 external-ids:iface-status=active","Open_vSwitch":{"65f243d2-685c-4676-895c-c66e53bcad80":{"next_cfg":276}}}
**

When libvirtd calls ovs-vsctl, it passes the option - "--if-exists del-port tap53086ae1-70.."

This results in the ovs port getting deleted and recreated again.
In the case of OVN, this results in 3 events -
  (1) interface/port created
  (2) interface/port deleted
  (3) interface/port created again

Which results in the logical port's status to go 'UP', 'DOWN' and 'UP' again
and which results in the neutron port's status to go 'ACTIVE', 'DOWN' and 'ACTIVE' again.

The tempest test fail whenever the port's status is in 'DOWN' state (before event 3 is completely propogated up until neutron's port status).

I am not sure if the port added by os-vif during plug is actually helping here.

Any thoughts ? I am not sure how this patch helps during live migration, but looks like for OVN atleast it is probably not needed.
Is it possible to atleast add a configuration option in os-vif to disable creating ovs port and OVN can set this config option ?

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-01-16 15:49:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

i had originally proposed https://review.openstack.org/#/c/602432/
to stop libvirt from modifying ovs. i had abandoned it as it did not apear to be required but have revived that now.

i would prefer not to have a config option for this.
ideally i would like to modify neutron to tell nova and os-vif which ml2 driver bound the port so we can make backend specific decisions in both nova and os-vif in preference to a config option.

this issue shoudl be confied to hybrid_plug=false with vif_type=ovs
it is the only combination where libvirt tries to plug the tap into ovs today. for hybrid_pug=true or vhsot-user os-vif handels pluging the interfaces to ovs. 

one other question does ovn support neutrons multiple port bindings
the nova integration expected that all ml2 backends would supprot it
but the sriov nic agent appears to have not be updated and perhaps that is also true of ovn. i would not expect the port status to be updated by pluggin the port on the destionation node untill its binding has been activated so the fact that you are seeing the neuton port status go active down active woudl seam to sugges that multipl port bindings is not supported with networking-ovn'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-01-16 19:22:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

hi just following up on this a little i belive it is incorrect for netwroking-ovn to change the port status based on the create and removal of the destination port unless that port bining is active.

http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/ocata/portbinding_information_for_nova.html#ml2-changes

if ovn does not currently support multiple port binding instead of the 
port status of the active port binging networking-ovn should be reporting the port status of the single neutron port binding based on the host it is currently bound to.

in both case the active or bound host will be the source host until after the both os-vif and libvirt have plugged the interface on the destination.

that is not to say we should not prevent libvirt form modifying ovs
but even if we did not it would be still incorrect for networking-ovn
to modify the port status as you describe below.'}]

commit_message:
always create ovs port during plug

- This change modifies the ovs plugin to always
  create the ovs interface in the ovs db.
- This change enables the neutron l2 agent to configure
  the ovs interface by assigning a vlan tag and
  installing openflow rules as appropriate.
- This change will reduce the live migration
  time for kernel ovs ports with hybrid plug false
  by creating the ovs port as part of plug before
  the migration starts.
- This change adds the privsep decorator
  to delete_net_dev to account for it new usage
  via _unplug_vif_generic and address bug #1801072

Change-Id: Iaf15fa7a678ec2624f7c12f634269c465fbad930
Partial-Bug: #1734320
Closes-Bug: #1801072

commit_message:
Add python36 job to repo

Also fixes a python 3 issue that was causing these tests to fail.

Note that I don't think we need to worry about supporting py35 in
this repo. I believe the only python 3 platforms we'll ever use it
on are py36 or higher.

Change-Id: I4ade3e0ae1ffa2253d998275f73044cacf656c0e

[{'created': '2019-01-16 12:19:59.000000000', 'message': "Use existing stack parameter for DeployIndentifier

In commit 4cb7a225297e804fb00c037904142dea9262475b we changed
to set the DeployIndentifier to ''. This looks like an incorrect
change. It would set the DeployIdentifier to '' (from the existing
unique value), if  --skip_deploy_identifier is used and this would
result in deployments applied on nodes, whereas we want exactly
the opposite. This checks the existing value in the stack for an
update.

to set the DeployIndentifier to ''. This looks like an incorrect
change. It would set the DeployIdentifier to '' (from the existing
unique value), if  --skip_deploy_identifier is used and this would
result in deployments applied on nodes, whereas we want exactly
the opposite. This checks the existing value in the stack for an
update.

Change-Id: Idd4178aa06aba5668dec6d8ba0427f57dfe5b5b6

commit_message:
Use existing stack parameter for DeployIdentifier

In commit 4cb7a225297e804fb00c037904142dea9262475b we changed
to set the DeployIndentifier to ''. This looks like an incorrect
change. It would set the DeployIdentifier to '' (from the existing
unique value), if  --skip_deploy_identifier is used and this would
result in deployments applied on nodes, whereas we want exactly
the opposite. This checks the existing value in the stack for an
update.

Change-Id: Idd4178aa06aba5668dec6d8ba0427f57dfe5b5b6
Related-Bug: #1759326

driver for Load Balancing in Octavia.

[{'created': '2019-01-16 18:17:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix docker-puppet.py retries (cleanup containers)

The previous code would fail due to the named container

commit_message:
Fix docker-puppet.py retries (cleanup containers)

The previous code would fail due to the named container
name already being used. This patch updates the retry
routine to properly clean up container names before the
next retry.

Change-Id: I1d5161d232d1179dc9cc9bc65624b49352769b89

[{'created': '2019-01-16 13:07:43.000000000', 'message': 'Reuse the container in case we have a temporary podman failure

The "retry" patch[1] didn't take care of the existing container. This patch
intends to allow to reuse the container in case it has failed, in order to
avoid an error when the container is already existing.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614639/

Change-Id: I5c7258c8687582f56b59ed410c0cc8f6ba4c2d4f
Context: https://github.com/containers/libpod/issues/1844
Related-Bug: #1811383
'}]
commit_message:
Reuse the container in case we have a temporary podman failure

The "retry" patch[1] didn't take care of the existing container. This patch
intends to allow to reuse the container in case it has failed, in order to
avoid an error when the container is already existing.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614639/

Change-Id: I5c7258c8687582f56b59ed410c0cc8f6ba4c2d4f
Context: https://github.com/containers/libpod/issues/1844
Related-Bug: #1811383

commit_message:
Fix tempest workspace path

In master it was introduced distro installs
for tempest[1], and with this upgrades from
Rocky to future Stein are breaking because
tempest complains about existent workspace path.

This patch aims to deal with this replacing the
workspace path if there is already a tempest
workspace with a different path.

[1] https://bit.ly/2GTqemC

Change-Id: I27e4f602d0db5bacb074e8389011c70ba5f3085c

messages:
[{'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2018-12-28 12:10:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2019-01-02 10:37:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-01-04 14:19:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

don't we have opentracing for tracing?"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-01-11 05:46:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

ping?'}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2019-01-11 09:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks Matthew.

OpenTracing is for distributed tracing and we have OSProfiler for that. OSProfiler clearly says that it is not intended for profiling a single  process like cProfile(Yappi is similar and better than cProfile). So we need Yappi.

https://docs.openstack.org/osprofiler/latest/user/background.html#why-not-cprofile-and-etc'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-01-12 05:24:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

it looks like this only supports up to py34 (not py35/36 as gate are based on)

no deps of it's own is nice though, has tests, I don't see much active development though, which is a concern (over six months ago was the last commit).

The two items that need to be addressed for my vote are...

1. only supports up to py34
2. no active development"}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2019-01-14 07:54:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> it looks like this only supports up to py34 (not py35/36 as gate
 > are based on)
 > 
 > no deps of it's own is nice though, has tests, I don't see much
 > active development though, which is a concern (over six months ago
 > was the last commit).
 > 
 > The two items that need to be addressed for my vote are...
 > 
 > 1. only supports up to py34

I see py36 CI jobs passing for this patch and also in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627414/ which is using yappi. As explained in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627414/3/requirements.txt comments, I have tested on python3.6 and Zane Bitter has tested on python 3.7 and it is working.

 > 2. no active development
Yappi development status for the project is showing as Production/stable and may be there is no requirement for adding new features. But author is actively addressing issues opened on the component https://bitbucket.org/sumerc/yappi/issues/"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-01-14 08:03:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the comment about addressing the issues (that addresses my second issue).

do you mind requesting that the author state support for py35/6/7 ?  that'd address the first"}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2019-01-14 08:10:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks Matthew. I have reported this https://bitbucket.org/sumerc/yappi/issues/19/concerns-regarding-using-yappi-in'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-01-15 02:11:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

the response to the upstream issue (19) satisfies me, thanks'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-01-15 10:38:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-16 15:24:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Looks like upstream is very responsive and everything else checks out.'}]

[{'created': '2018-12-28 12:10:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add Yappi to global-requirements

Yappi is needed to profile (capture function calltrace) oslo.service
processes.

Is the library actively maintained?
Yes
Is the library good code?
Yes
Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes, it has py3 gates
Is the library license compatible?
Yes
Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?
No
Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?
Yes, oslo.service
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627414/

commit_message:
Add Yappi to global-requirements

Yappi is needed to profile (capture function calltrace) oslo.service
processes.

Is the library actively maintained?
Yes
Is the library good code?
Yes
Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes, it has py3 gates
Is the library license compatible?
Yes
Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?
No
Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?
Yes, oslo.service
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627414/

Change-Id: Ibea0cdb732923f1b53d5cb6aeeb4041fb5973494

Volume backup service with Ceph driver should respect the `--incremental`
option for backups. In this way we can keep consistency between backups.

If the incremental flag is not specified then a new
full backup will always be created, allowing for subsequent deletion of
older incremental backups.

Change-Id: Ifac9607a336146727fc21c9a2e28e2552c439383
Closes-Bug: #1790713
Signed-off-by: Laura Sofia Enriquez <lsofia.enriquez@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP]Ceph driver should respect the `--incremental` option for backups

Volume backup service with Ceph driver should respect the `--incremental`
option for backups. In this way we can keep consistency between backups.

If the incremental flag is not specified then a new
full backup will always be created, allowing for subsequent deletion of
older incremental backups.

Change-Id: Ifac9607a336146727fc21c9a2e28e2552c439383
Closes-Bug: #1790713
Signed-off-by: Laura Sofia Enriquez <lsofia.enriquez@gmail.com>

(4 comments)

-1 is for the wrong uuid used in the bfv scenarios - I'm not really sure how that's passing since the cinder fixture should be failing to find a volume with the given id. I guess the volume GET is passing because of this:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/8c318d0fb20fdfe0ae8e203245e4d4d6668c8a44/nova/tests/fixtures.py#L1729

But I would think the API should fail since that "volume" is not marked as bootable, which should be validated here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/8c318d0fb20fdfe0ae8e203245e4d4d6668c8a44/nova/compute/api.py#L1092

(Oh I see, the API defaults to assume it's bootable, yay)

commit_message:
Add tempest_interface_name var for setting interface

Currently in tasks/tempest_resources.yml file, we are using
ansible provided openstack cloud modules which needs which is
harded to internal. When os_tempest role is getting used with
different deployment tool, interface varies. Adding
tempest_interface_name var mades it easier to use any interface
in clouds.yaml file.

It removes legacy endpoint_type and replaces it with interface.

Change-Id: I8f6a71a1f31069d2f553275e27ecebd971ce0152

commit_message:
Rename tempest_public_net_physical_{type to name}

tempest_public_net_physical_type var stores the physical network
name but due to the name of the var it looks confusing. This
patch renames the var and providing that user can still use
tempest_public_net_physical_type var.

Change-Id: I45f63426a105ada0715c665a1289ed6d09911202

commit_message:
pylint: fix redundant-keyword-arg error

pylint complains 'name' argument is redundant
in positional and keyword arguments.
The existence of 'name' in kwargs is checked before passing to
api.keystone.tenant_create, so we can pass 'name' as part of kwargs.

Change-Id: Ice09cecb21217b042d44a8c1dda7a4736e2b391b

commit_message:
pylint: fix several coding convention violations

openstack_dashboard/context_processors.py:94:15: C0122: Comparison should be link['url'] != 'horizon:project:api_access:openrcv2' (misplaced-comparison-constant)
openstack_dashboard/settings.py:467:4: C0412: Imports from package horizon are not grouped (ungrouped-imports)
openstack_dashboard/enabled/_1370_project_vg_snapshots.py:9:0: C0301: Line too long (86/80) (line-too-long)
openstack_dashboard/enabled/_1360_project_volume_groups.py:9:0: C0301: Line too long (85/80) (line-too-long)
openstack_dashboard/usage/base.py:62:8: W0106: Expression "[instance_list.extend(u.server_usages) for u in self.usage_list]" is assigned to nothing (expression-not-assigned)
openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/utils.py:43:12: W0106: Expression "[public_images.append(image) for image in images]" is assigned to nothing (expression-not-assigned)
openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/utils.py:75:12: W0106: Expression "[community_images.append(image) for image in images]" is assigned to nothing (expression-not-assigned)
openstack_dashboard/api/glance.py:47:4: C0412: Imports from package glanceclient are not grouped (ungrouped-imports)
openstack_dashboard/api/cinder.py:60:4: C0412: Imports from package cinderclient are not grouped (ungrouped-imports)
openstack_auth/user.py:358:4: E0211: Method has no argument (no-method-argument)
openstack_auth/user.py:362:4: E0211: Method has no argument (no-method-argument)
openstack_dashboard/api/keystone.py:75:4: C0412: Imports from package keystoneclient are not grouped (ungrouped-imports)
horizon/loaders.py:43:16: W0706: The except handler raises immediately (try-except-raise)
horizon/themes.py:174:8: W0706: The except handler raises immediately (try-except-raise)

Change-Id: I40cf3ffbc4519657e11180d2e2fe7401387c5556
